description: Armed with the knowledge of the Mortal Cup's location, Clary and the team race to get it before it ends up in the wrong hands.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Clary tells Jace and Magnus the Mortal Cup is hidden inside a Tarot Card; the card is in Luke's office.

Simon wakes up in bed next to Marueen. He has a vision of Clary and calls her name; Maureen is very upset and Simon spirits away.

Luke enters the police station but is confronted by an Internal Affairs employee before he can fetch the card. Jace and Clary see him escorted and decide to act. They enter while glamouring and LUke tells them where to find the card.

Isabel has broken up with Meliorn.

Clary starts a mock fight with Jace in Luke's office and pretends to have lost her key while Luke's boss (who is an acquaintance of Clary) tells her where to find the card. The boss walks off and is trailed by a Downworlder.

Simon watches vampire videos while siting at a food truck and eating a garlic bagel; he is scared of having become a vampire.

Luke is freed by his attorney while IA tells him he is a suspect. Luke then discovers his boss with a slit throat in a closet - but he could not have committed the murder since he was talking to the IA officer.

Alec sets up a diversion for Isabelle who cause a blackout in the building while Jace and Clary climb via an elevator shaft to the evidence room. Clary and Jace find the card but Clary is unable to fetch the Cup from the card at first. Outside the building the band of four is chased by werewolves while Isabelles demon-detecting pendant flashes. They re-enter the building via the cellar to find shelter and are attacked by shax-demons. Jace, Isabelle and Clary split up and Clary is attacked by shax-demons; she scares the demons away by pulling the Cup from the card. A shape-shifting demon tries to get the Cup from Clary and is vanquished by her.

Back in the institute all are reunited; Jace and Clary kiss passionately.

Simon re-enters the Hotel Dumort to find out more about his condition. Camille tells him the symptoms he is experiencing will fade and then bites him.

description: After an attack, the Institute is on high alert. This forces Jace, Clary, Isabelle and the Downworlders to take drastic actions.

description: Time is running out for the Shadowhunters to stop Valentine. Jace wrestles with his feelings, whilst Alec must deal with the aftermath of his choices.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Jace and Clary discuss their parentage. They then ask Simon to join them to the Hotel Dumort, where Camille (who owns the book) is locked up.

Alec and Magnus visit Lydia and find her unconscious. The good guys rewatch security camera footage and discover that Hodge took the Mortal Cup from Lydia. They also find out why a Forsaken invaded the Institute: he brought a ring to Hodge with which Hodge could communicate to Valentine Morgenstern.

Hodge Starkweather visits Valentine Morgenstern and hands him the Cup in exchange for his freedom. Using the Cup, Valentine purifies a tank of blood and hands a cupful of the resulting fluid to a waiting follower. The follower drinks, falls down but stands up and is handed his sword. Valentine now starts branding his army of new Shadowhunters with his double-circle mark.

Valentine chases Hodge away, who is now an outlaw.

Jace and Alec leave to hunt for Valentine; Luke sends out his werewolves to do the same. Jace find Hodge first and confronts him; Hodge blames the Lightwoord family for letting him take the blame and locking him up. In the resulting duel Jace cuts off Hodges hand but is stopped before he can kill Hodge. Jace then takes the ring of the severed hand, puts it on and talks to Valentine.

In the Hotel Dumort Raphael rebuffs the attempts of Isabelle, Simon and Clary to gain access to Camille. While Raphael shows Isabelle the belongings of Camille that he knows of, Simon sneaks Clary in a coffin to the basement and frees Camille. She knows the location of the book (her pied-a-terre in the Upper East side of Manhattan) but will only take them there if Simon signs a document exonerating Camille of killing Simon.

Luke and Alex talk briefly and then find both Jace and Hodge gone. Jace speaks to Alex on the phone and explains his situation with Valentine, his father.

Simon, Clary and Camille prepare to leave and are stopped by Raphael and his vampire followers. At the moment supreme Isabelle uses her whip to create a hole in the outside wall, which serves as a barrier between the vampires and the good guys.

One of Valentine's Shadowhunters posts outside of Camille's apartment and phones Valentine when Simon and the other good guys (including Marcus Bane) drive past. Simon signs the exonerating document and Camille confesses she doesn't know where Dot hid the book, then leaves. Jace calls Clary and tells her to leave immediately as Valentine is on his way Clary refuses and then finds the book, hidden in a cook book containing Clary's favourite recipe (Chicken Caccciatore). The cook book contains a torn bookmark which exactly matches the piece that Clary possesses. The completed bookmark breaks the hiding spell and Clary now has the White Book of Spells.

At exactly that moment Valentine and a few of his new Shadowhunters port in and a stand-off occurs. Clary offers the book to Valentine but he refuses it, telling her he wants her to wake up Jocelyn so that both can join him. He then leaves with Jace, who joins him voluntarily.

Back in the institute Magnus breaks the sleeping enchantment using a spell from the White spell-book.

The episode and the season) ends with Valentine holding the Mortal CUP while standing on a large freighter with several hundred new Shadowhunters on deck; next to him is Jace. Promising his followers a new world where the demons will be slain, they sail off into the night.

End-of-Season summary:

Clary is a powerful shadowhunter
Simon is a vampire
Luke is a werewolf
Jace has joined Valentine Morgenster, his father and mentor;
Valentine has the Mortal Cup and is using it to create an army of shadowhunters
Jocelyn has regained consciousness and is reunited with Clary.

synopsis_with_character_names:
In Young Justice, being a teenager means proving yourself over and over - to peers, parents, teachers, mentors and, ultimately, to yourself. But what if you're not just a normal teenager? What if you're a teenage super hero? Are you ready to join the ranks of the great heroes and prove you're worthy of the Justice League? That's exactly what the members of Young Justice - Robin, Aqualad, Kid Flash, Superboy, Miss Martian and Artemis - will find out, whether they have what it takes to be a proven hero. This all-new series is produced by Warner Bros. Animation and based upon characters from DC Comics. Sam Register (Teen Titans, Ben 10, Batman: The Brave and the Bold) is the executive producer. Brandon Vietti (Batman: Under the Red Hood, Superman Doomsday, The Batman) and Greg Weisman (Gargoyles, The Spectacular Spider-Man, W.I.T.C.H.) are the producers.

Within the Justice League, its members' teen sidekicks push for full membership, but it's only after they successfully investigate Cadmus, in which they find and free its secret young clone of Superman, Kon-El (Nolan North), is the League convinced. In response, the League organizes the teenagers into an apprentice team to be both trained and act on behalf of the League at their own pace. Now these teen superheroes, soon strengthened by more members, must battle the forces of evil in their own way, even as the mysterious cabal known only as The Light has a sinister agenda of their own.

(Plot synopses for beginning of this series.)

description: Clair is upset when Theo brings home a bad report card and claims he has no plans to attend college; Cliff is horrified to meet Denise's date.
tags: ['doctor', 'family relationships', 'father']
synopsis_with_character_names:
The Huxtable family has gathered around the breakfast table before the kids have to go to school and the parents have to go to work. Clair, the mother, is making eggs and serving cereal while the children dance around the kitchen and the table as the radio plays jazzy music. When the family's only boy, Theo, says that he wanted his eggs scrambled, his mother obliges by scrambling the sunny side-up eggs right on Theo's plate. The second-youngest child, Vanessa, asks her mother if they could get a dog (a recurring request of Vanessa's throughout the series' run), to which her brother replies "We already HAVE a dog; YOU!". Vanessa counters by mentioning that Theo's report card, which he will get that day, will likely have grades with the first letter of the word "dog". Clair tells Theo that she hopes his report card this term will be better than last term. Clair's husband, Cliff, comes downstairs to the kitchen and serves himself oatmeal in a silly manner before he leaves for work.

In a hospital delivery room, Cliff follows a would-be father out to the waiting room. The man has been scared off by his wife's attitude in during what appears to be a painful delivery -- the man says his wife had yelled at him to leave the room. Cliff comforts the father and tells him to buck up and to cheer for his wife as she goes through the birth. Cliff's words are very inspirational and the father enthusiastically returns to his wife's side.

That evening, while the family, minus Cliff, eat dinner, the children have the usual spate of arguments, bickering and minor physical altercations, especially when Theo won't stop teasing his youngest sister, Rudy. Clair reminds Theo that he's already in very hot water for bringing home a report card with D grades in every class. Clair orders Theo to his room to await his father's return from work and also orders Vanessa and Rudy to go upstairs and get ready for bed. As they all walk upstairs, Clair has to yell at them again to stop fighting.

Cliff arrives home, cheerful that the birth he was performing was a success. Clair immediately asks him in a cross tone why they had to have four children (a small error in the series, since it's revealed later that Clair and Cliff actually have five children). Clair hands Cliff Theo's report card and tells him to go upstairs and talk to their son about becoming a better student. When Cliff suggests he get something to eat first, Clair glares a bit and he tells her he'll "be meaner on an empty stomach."

Cliff enters Theo's room, which is a complete mess of strewn-about clothes and personal objects and talks to his son. Theo's attitude is one of indifference; Theo feels he doesn't need to do better in school or go to college. He tells Cliff he wants to get a job like "regular people", say driving a bus or working in a gas station. Cliff then demonstrates what life would be like for a person who earns the lower wages of a "regular person" using the money from Theo's nearby Monopoly set. Theo expects that he'll earn $250 per week; Cliff says he'll give him $300/week, $1200 per month. Theo is excited, until Cliff subtracts $350 for taxes, saying "the government comes for the regular people FIRST." Cliff tells Theo he'll have to find an apartment (emphasizing that he cannot live in his parents' home) and that one in Manhattan will cost $400/month in rent. Theo counters, saying he can live in New Jersey for $200. Cliff takes another $200 for a car; Theo takes back $100 saying he'll get a motorcycle. Cliff takes an additional $50 for a helmet. Cliff subtracts a further $100 for clothing, Theo gives him another $100 saying he wants to "look good!" Cliff takes $100 a month for food; Theo takes it back claiming he can "get by on bologna and cereal". When Theo cheerfully says he has everything he needs and $200 extra for the month, Cliff asks him if he plans to have a girlfriend and when Theo cheerfully says "For sure!", heartlessly takes Theo's last $200.

Cliff hears an argument out in the hall and finds Rudy and Vanessa have been kicked out of the bathroom by their older sister Denise, who needs to get ready for a date. Vanessa describes a desperate situation where shampoo from the shower has run into Rudy's eyes & may blind her. Cliff catches Denise as she comes out of the bathroom and objects to Denise's going out on a date and the outfit she's wearing. Denise tells Cliff that she'd gotten permission from her mother. Denise retreats to change her outfit and Cliff goes downstairs to talk to Clair.

When he asks Clair "how ugly" Denise's date is, the young man hears him and Cliff invites him to talk while they sit on the family couch. The young man has a fairly haughty attitude. Cliff notices that he has one ear pierced, a tradition the young man partook of when he was a merchant Marine & crossed the equator. When Cliff asks the guy if he's shipping out any time soon, the guy tells him that he's out of the merchant Marines and back in school -- TWO years behind Denise. He also tells Cliff that after being in a Turkish prison, "everything else is easy." Cliff is flustered a

In the kitchen, Cliff fills Clair in on his conversation with their son. When Cliff tells her that Theo's responded with a mere "I'll try" to Cliff economics lesson and his lecture about doing better in school, Clair isn't satisfied and tells Cliff to talk to Theo again.

Back upstairs, Cliff approves of Denise's new ensemble but questions her about her makeup and her date's personal history. Humored, Denise kisses him and goes off to meet her date. Cliff then remembers he has to finish his talk with Theo. His son gives a heartfelt response to Cliff's earlier lecture, saying that if his father wasn't a doctor & earned less, he would still love them. Theo believes that Cliff should accept Theo's belief that he was meant not to excel in school or go to college and that he can live like a regular person. Cliff considers this for a moment and then tells Theo, in a raised and angry voice that Theo's impassioned reply is "the *dumbest thing [he's] ever heard in [his] life!" He tells Theo unequivocally that he will try harder in school and will be successful. Cliff also tells him in a softer tone that he loves him very much and wants him to do the best he can. Theo agrees.

Down in the kitchen, Cliff gets something to eat and fills Clair in on what he told Theo. Clair is critical at first but then realizes that Cliff had properly lectured Theo on success in life starting in school.

Later that evening when Cliff and Clair get ready for bed, Cliff begins to get amorous with Clair, who reminds him that "this is how we got the children in the first place." Cliff still does but there's a knock at the door; it's Vanessa and Rudy. Following a brief lesson on proper etiquette for entering a room, Vanessa tells her parents that Rudy can't sleep because the Wolf-man is in their closet. Clair invites them to sleep with their parents that night and all four crowd into the bed. When Cliff turns out the light and says "Goodnight, dear" all three comically tell him the same.

description: Cliff forces the entire family to hold a funeral for Rudy's dead goldfish Lamont.
tags: ['doctor', 'family relationships', 'father']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Cliff comes home from a long day at the hospital. He lies comfortably down on the living room couch for a nap but is soon wakened by Vanessa. She tells him there may be an emergency with her younger sister Rudy but is unable to convey just how serious the situation is. She tells her father that Rudy's goldfish, Lamont, is dead. At first Cliff merely says "I'm sorry" but Vanessa convinces him to go upstairs with her and talk to Rudy, whom doesn't understand that her fish is dead.

When they arrive, Rudy is blissfully sprinkling food into Lamont's bowl. Cliff investigates, first shaking the bowl slightly, poking the body with his finger and then flipping it in is hand. He sits down with Rudy and, with some "help" from Vanessa, tells her that Lamont is dead. Theo has also joined the conversation but is mildly admonished by his father when he insensitively confirms the news. Cliff tries to soften the blow for Rudy by suggesting she remember how much fun Lamont was. After Rudy and Theo go downstairs for dinner, Vanessa suggests that Cliff make her a special dinner to cheer her up.

At dinner, Rudy, now feeling the loss of her pet, doesn't want to eat. Claire tries to tell Rudy about the loophole she was able to crack in a legal case at her law firm but Rudy doesn't want to hear about it. Claire takes Rudy out of the kitchen to console her. Cliff seems slightly appalled at the lack of empathy from Theo, Denise & Vanessa. Denise tells him that it's just a dead fish and Theo jokingly says they should have a funeral. Cliff hits on the idea and takes things a few steps further, picking up the phone when Theo suggests they have their local reverend deliver a eulogy. The kids try to stop him and Cliff blackmails them all into attending the funeral on Saturday morning. He also coerces them into wearing black and doing whatever he orders. With the reverend still on the phone, Cliff covers up by asking if Christmas will still be at the same time that year. After he hangs up, he sticks his tongue out at his kids.

Later, in their bedroom, Cliff picks out one of Claire's dresses, a fancy dark blue one that's the closest she has to a black one. Having been rebuffed by most of the family about her great day at work, she refuses to tell Cliff about it at first but finally does when Cliff promises to give her his undivided attention. She begins to tell him but his pager goes off. He shuts off the alarm a couple of times but when a long beep is heard, he finally calls. One of his patients is on her way to the hospital. He then listens to Claire's story, which turns out to be rather pathetic.

On Saturday morning, Cliff calls everyone to the family bathroom, where the funeral will be held. The kids assemble: Claire is wearing her fancy dress, Vanessa wears a black leotard, Denise is in frumpy clothes she dressed in to meet up with friends, Theo is in a sharp blazer and Rudy is wearing a little sailor's dress, Lamont's favorite since it is nautically-themed. Theo brings Cliff the fish on his little net and they all gather around the toilet. Cliff begins to eulogize about Lamont with Vanessa kicking in a few unintentionally silly remarks. Rudy suddenly says she wants to watch television. Denise hears a car horn and leaves, saying her ride has arrived. Cliff is again appalled at the lack of sensitivity and starts yelling. Barely able to keep from laughing, Claire tries to calm him down, saying that the spectacle he's created is mostly ridiculous. She also reminds him that he never went to the hospital to check on his patient. When he goes to check his watch, the net holding Lamont tips and he falls into the toilet bowl. Cliff flushes the toilet. Moments later, Rudy reappears. Cliff asks if she wants to mourn a bit and she bashfully tells him she needs to use the bathroom. Smiling widely, she closes the door after her parents leave.

description: Theo gets a shirt that cost too much, so Denise makes him an "Exact" replica.
tags: ['doctor', 'family relationships', 'father']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Theo and Claire return from a shopping trip to buy a new shirt for Theo, who has a big night out with friends coming up that weekend and wants to impress his date. Theo has gotten something of a boost from the experience, having done the shopping in the store by himself and using his father's charge account while Claire waited outside. Theo is also excited about the shirt he bought; it's from a popular new designer named Gordon Gartrelle. Theo shows his father the shirt and points out some of it's finer features like the silk it's made from, the collar, hidden buttons and its front pocket. When Cliff asks how much the shirt cost, Theo evades the question with further admiration for the shirt. Cliff looks at the sales receipt and sees that it cost a steep $95. Cliff tells Theo he's going to return the shirt, prompting protest from his son. Cliff gives Theo a generous $30 for a different shirt but Theo is disappointed.

Up in his bedroom, Denise joins him and Theo tells her what happened. She reminds him that a $95 price tag is more for the brand than the actual value of the shirt and that the profit goes to paying for the designer's extravagant lifestyle. Theo tells her their father gave him $30 to buy a different shirt and Denise offers to make him a replica of the Gartrelle shirt for him. Thrilled, Theo gives her the money.

Denise finds that making a shirt is very difficult. When she asks her parents for more money to finish it, they give it to her. Cliff and Claire both realize that the situation will end in disaster because they know Denise's tailoring skills aren't up to the job. Meanwhile, Cliff is fighting off a severe cold that he tries to hide from Claire.

On the day she promised to give Theo the shirt, he explodes, complaining about how badly it's turned out: it's too big, the sleeves are uneven and of two different designs, the collar is crooked and it looks like it was assembled from a patchwork of fabric. Furious, Theo goes to his father in the kitchen and shows him the shirt. His father tries to stifle his laughter but tells Theo he's learned his lesson about expecting more than someone could promise him. Theo begs his father for the chance to go back to the store and get a new Gartrelle but his father, amidst Theo's panicky state, tells him he can find the original Gartrelle he'd bought in his father's room. When Theo asks him about it, Cliff laughingly tells him he never took the first one back knowing that something like this would happen.

Theo goes out the kitchen door to the living room and finds that his friends and his date have arrived. When they see in Denise's shirt they seem a bit shocked and Theo is very embarrassed. Cliff walks in and tries to cover for Theo, saying it's his shirt and that Theo can't wear it. Theo steps up and tells his date that it's his. His date is unexpectedly excited; to her it looks like another new, hot designer, Idgy Amorata. Theo is thrilled and confident, saying he'll go out anyway. When Claire tells him to put on a coat, Theo scoffs at the idea of covering up his new, stylish shirt. Claire then turns her attention to Cliff, who still refuses to admit he's sick.

description: Theo gets an earring without permission.
tags: ['doctor', 'family relationships', 'father']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Theo returns home from a weekend stay at his friend Cockroach's house. He sneaks into the house and quickly runs up to his room. Asking Denise to join him, he shows her that he's gotten his left ear pierced, saying that he had Cockroach's sister Tilly do it in their garage. Theo boasts a bit about how he's a man now and free to make his own decisions. Denise is at first giddy about the piercing but notices that it may be infected; when she tries to touch the earring, Theo recoils in pain. Theo makes her promise not to tell their parents, wanting to reveal it to them later.

Worried about her brother, Denise talks to Cliff and Claire and drops hints about everyone's earlobes. Cliff goes up to Theo's room to investigate and finds Theo listening to his headphones. However, when he unplugs the headset, Theo at first is reluctant to take them off and only does when Cliff orders him to. Theo sits with his left ear facing away from his father. When his father tries to look at his ear, Theo cleverly maneuvers himself to avoid any notice but soon can't hide it from his father any longer. Cliff looks him over and determines that Theo's outer ear is infected. He says he'll treat his son's ear; when Theo asks if he can expect a punishment, Cliff eagerly says yes.

Down in Cliff's office, Cliff disinfects the wound and sits down with Theo to have a talk. When asked, Theo tells his father that he had the piercing done as a sign of independence. Cliff isn't fooled and asks what girl Theo is trying to impress. Cliff suddenly shifts gears and tells Theo he won't punish him but will subject him to a morality lecture from his grandfather, Russell, who's due to arrive for dinner in a few minutes. Theo is frightened but thinks that his grandfather won't notice. Cliff insures that he will by putting a large bandage over the wound.

When the grandparents arrive, Theo tries to give them a short greeting and sneak away. Before he can, his youngest sister Rudy notices the bandage, calling his grandfather's attention. Cliff eagerly tells his father what happened and leaves Theo to Russell's devices. Russell surprises his son and grandson by stating that he has no intention of lecturing Theo, especially since Cliff once tried a crazy idea when he was about his son's age to impress a girl. Russell tells Theo the story of how Cliff tried to straighten his hair by mixing up a tonic that used nitroglycerin to relax the curl. The solution burned Cliff's hair and scalp and left him temporarily bald. When Theo asks his father who he was trying to impress, Cliff tells him it was Claire. Overjoyed, Theo runs for the kitchen to share the story but Cliff stops him short. Theo agrees not to reveal Cliff's secret but then asks his grandfather to tell the story. Russell jogs Claire's memory, prompting her to tell everyone. Russell then tells Claire that Theo had his ear pierced but then bids Claire not to come down hard on Theo because he'd already talked to him and had taken the same tone with Cliff when he was younger and acted just like his son.

Everyone gets a good laugh over the conversation but Cliff's mother Anna chimes in saying that Russell was not so understanding or patient in dealing with Cliff. She mentions a tattoo that Russell had gotten when he was a teenager. Russell had wanted to get Anna's name tattooed on his chest to impress her but when he went to the tattoo parlor he had a severe cold and mispronounced Anna's name, saying "Adda", the name of another girl from their neighborhood who was also attracted to Russell. When the tattoo came back misspelled, Russell had it removed, leaving a large scar on his chest. Cliff suddenly remembers how his father told him he'd gotten the scar during combat in World War II, a story Russell had made up to avoid embarrassment. The ladies leave the men behind in the living room, Denise telling them they're all crazy. After they leave, Cliff gives them all nicknames: Skinhead for himself, Scar Chest for his father and Hole-in-the-Lobe for Theo.

description: Cliff's going to be Physician Of The Year. Theo is tapped to make his Dad's speech and accept the award for him, when Cliff's called to deliver a baby.
tags: ['doctor', 'family relationships', 'father']
synopsis_with_character_names: From the time I first saw the Cosby Show at age 11, until I got an after-school job, I lived watching this sitcom. Of all the episodes of the Cosby Show, my favorites showed the close bond that Cliff & Theo had as father & son. It reminds me of me and my dad. But this episode is very dear to me because it taught that you always need to reach for your dreams and goals. Do not let anything hold you back. Your happiness is too important for that. Believe in others, and most importantly, believe in yourself. There will always be obstacles in your ways, but if you want that goal, you have to get through those obstacles. As the speech in the end concludes, "This is my American family, and I hope that nothing gets in the way of their dreams."

description: When Clair finds a marijuana joint in Theo's history book she and Cliff confront. Theo explains that it is not his and both Cliff and Clair believe him, but Theo feels that they are going to look down on him from this point on. So they next day he goes to school to confront the person it actually belonged to.
tags: ['reference to turkey', 'doctor', 'family relationships', 'father', 'anti drugs', 'drug use', 'drugs']
synopsis_with_character_names: The long-running theme to the Cosby Show has always been a positive loving African-American family in Brooklyn, N.Y. This show broke so many sterotypes of African-Americans. This episode definitely proved this point. One point that my mother tried to make to me while I was growing up was the point of integrity. She always said that when people believe you, you will always have your integrity to fall back on. The issue of this episode is does Theo smoke marijuana. I love what his dad said, "You done many things, some good, some bad. But one thing you are not is a liar. So if you say it isn't yours then we believe you." The value of integrity is the lesson of this episode. Theo knew this; and that is why he did not lie to his parents and why he went back to school to find the drug user and have that boy tell Theo's parents as proof of Theo's sense of integrity.

description: When Granddad and Ed Wuncler open a soul-food restaurant, it ends up having a terrible effect on Woodcrest.
tags: ['stabbed with a fork', 'reference to krispy kreme', 'krispy kreme doughnut', 'reference to biz markie', 'huey freeman character', 'riley freeman character', 'robert freeman character', 'ed wuncler character', 'uncle ruckus charater', 'tom dubois character', 'sarah dubois character', 'jazmine dubois character', 'hand drawn animation']
synopsis_with_character_names:
This episode is a metaphor about a white banker funding a black drug dealer in an effort to profit off the drug sales up front and then profit even more in the longer term by buying up the blighted real estate in the area affected by the negative consequences of that drug use.

Grandpa's Greasy Soul Food stands in as a substitute for narcotics strong enough to induce a stupor "the itis" when consumed and feelings of withdrawal identical to those experienced by hardcore street addicts in need of a fix. Wunsler's sudden interest in funding Grandpa's "lifelong" dream (scripted joke-three weeks since seeing a TV cooking show) is fully exposed in the fade to end scene when he smiles at the sight of the urban blight he knew he would create by funding Grandpa's dispersion of the Soul Food (drugs). Huey plays the usual part of morally outraged kid while his greedy brother smiles broadly at the spoils. The full genius of Wunsler's premeditated evil is saved for the final reveal where (IIRC) a voice-over fills in the details of his genius success in the fine art of forced real estate acquisition at bargain basement prices while panning the rundown wreckage of a formerly vibrant community.

description: When the team comes together to help Sophie, they intercept guilt-ridden corporate fixer Harry and decide to help him take down an evil billionaire making money on the back of an opioid crisis.
tags: ['closeup of eyes', 'porcelain tea set', 'cheese board', "visiting a friend's grave", 'overhead camera shot', 'reunion', 'reference to george clooney', 'museum of fine arts boston', 'rembrant painting', 'year 2002', 'art theft', 'pickpocket', 'knocked unconscious', 'flashback', 'feeling guilty', 'reference to vermeer', 'gardner museum heist', 'three dimensional printer', 'machine learning', 'canvas', 'francois auguste rene rodin  sculpture', 'reference to claude monet', 'scare tactic', 'fake auction', "sommersby's auction", 'cleveland museum of art', 'forklift', 'forgery', 'punched in the face', 'four against one', 'threatened with a shovel', 'burning a painting', 'gloating', 'insurance fraud', 'wedding ring']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Harry Wilson breaks into a museum, and remembers telling Fletcher Maxwell that he never picks a side. He comes to a painting and stares at it.

Three Days Earlier

Sophie Devereux wakes up in her bed alone She looks at the empty side of the bed next to her, and she gets a text on her phone saying they'll meet her there. She goes down to breakfast and considers saying she can't make it, but reconsiders. Sophie gets a text from Parker saying she misses Sophie, and Sophie huddles on the bed.

At her late husband Nate Ford's gravesite, Sophie kneels by the stone and places flowers. Her former teammate Eliot Spencer joins her, and then Alec Hardison and Parker. The four of them go to Sophie's house and talk about Leverage International and the twelve teams they've formed, and toast Nate who is one year gone. Parker mentions Eliot's food trucks, Hardison talks about how he's using satellites to coordinate refugee efforts. Sophie finally tells them to stop and walks away. Parker goes over and tells Sophie that they should steal something to distract Sophie from her grief, and the others agree. They take Sophie to the nearby Boston Museum of Art and go in past protesters protesting Maxwell's family. The others go off to check the place.

Sophie overhears Maxwell arguing with the curator about how the issues with his family have nothing to do with his art. Maxwell threatens to pull his Rembrandt from the show, and calls in his lawyer Harry. Maxwell tells Harry to fix the situation, and Harry says that they can cancel Maxwell's next donation. The curator says that they don't want Maxwell's money, and Maxwell threatens to call the museum board and walks off. Sophie goes over to Harry and points out that Maxwell isn't that likable, and Harry explains that the Maxwell family has donated millions to the museum, and Maxwell is a collector.

Sophie follows Harry to a gallery where he's looking at the piece Maxwell donated, and says that it was formerly stolen. She knows all about the theft, and admits that she stole it. Sophie figures that the cameras are cut, and Parker and Hardison join her and say they already know. The alarms go off and Harry directs everyone out, and he stays behind as the security gates come down. Once he's alone, he cuts a painting down and finds Sophie watching him. She points out that he has two-minute window to steal the Rembrandt and should carry on. Parker comes up, steals Harry's wallet, and checks his ID. Hardison runs a background check on Harry, and Harry works for bad people.

Parker and Hardison go to wipe the camera while Sophie admires Harry's work. He explains that he learned his technique from Youtube, and she works out that he has access to a hidden employee door. Harry accidentally sets off a hidden alarm on the painting, and Sophie tells Harry to leave the painting and they have to go. Harry goes through the door, and Eliot is on the other side and punches Harry unconscious. Sophie tells the others that Harry is the distraction, and Eliot has to carry Harry out on his own. Back at the house, Harry wakes up and finds the team staring down at him.

Six Months Earlier

Harry is with Maxwell and Bligh, and says thy can protect $100 million and get the rest in settlements. Maxwell refuses to settle, saying it's not his family's fault "addicts" took advantage of the medication his family produced as part of their pharmaceutical business. Harry pints out all the evidence against Maxwell for making the drug deliberately addictive, and if Maxwell agrees then Harry will convince each of the litigants to settle. Maxwell finally agrees to employ Harry, who insists he's not on anybody's side.

Later, Harry goes to the trailer home of one of the litigants, Cole Hoskins, who prepares to attack Harry with a shovel until his sister Jenny tells Cole to go inside. She says that she has power of attorney, and is tempted to beat Harry herself. Harry says that the company wants to settle, and Jenny explains that they had to sell their grandparents' house the second out of three times Coles was in rehab because of the medication. Harry convinces all of the litigants to settle and goes back to Maxwell, and Maxwell tells Harry that they're not settling. He figures the litigants will die in the years the cases will take, and he has plenty of money. Harry is shocked at Maxwell's plan, and Maxwell assures Harry that he couldn't have done it without him.

The Present

Harry tells the team his story, and Sophie figures he felt guilty. He explains that he locked up all of Maxwell's money in the Bank of Malta, with airtight security. Harry also wanted to hurt Maxwell, taking his painting in eight museums across the country, rather than his money, but Eliot figures that it's about Maxwell's reputation, not the art. Sophie figures Maxwell is afraid of his legitimacy being taken away from him. She insists that she's retired and they're not going to help Harry, and the others point out that Sophie was the one who spotted Harry, and had them bring him there.

Harry figures he can trust them, and Sophie figures that Maxwell is looking for a big score to eliminate all the scandal associated with him. She figures they can hook Maxwell with a lost Rembrandt, and review Nate's all files. He was checking a case about a team of thieves who stole 13 paintings from a museum, including a Rembrandt. Anybody who found and returned one of the paintings would be a hero. If someone returned a fake of one of the paintings, their reputation in the arty world would be ruined. Hardison points out that Sophie already has a plan, and she agrees to do the one job and they'll need Harry as an inside man. She says "Let's go steal..." in honor of Nate.

Later, Sophie and Parker go into the museum and find Maxwell making a call about his name being taken out of the brochure. Parker fakes being on the phone to someone, and says that she's an expert on Monet's collection. Maxwell overhears her and picks up the Invigtation-0only invitation she's "accidentally" dropped.

In the house's garage, Hardison sets up his 3d printer and the program he uses to make forgeries. They check Nate's collection of stolen master piece to find the right date for the canvas, and Eliot and Hardison go in an auction house and convince the staff a steam pipe is going to burst, so they should all leave. Once they leave, the team and their people set up their own auction with Parker as the auctioneer. Maxwell comes in and takes a seat, and Maxwell "wins". Parker tells Maxwell that she can't sell the item to him because his name has been flagged, because the seller doesn't want his piece seized in a future lawsuit.

Eliot is listening, steps in, and says that Maxwell is known as a drug dealer, and steps in to take the item. Maxwell goes to make call and tells his people to find whoever flagged him Sophie and Eliot stage a conversation where Eliot threatens to send Sophie back to her humble beginning if she doesn't get high-ticket items like he wants. Maxwell overhears them, and Eliot walks off. As planned, Maxwell approaches Sophie and she plays being upset, and he invites her to his place later for a proposal. Sophie agrees, and she walks over to a watching Parker and Eliot and tells them that it was exhilarating. Meanwhile, Maxwell has his people do a full security check on Sophie.

Later at Maxwell's place, Maxwell has dinner with Sophie. He says that he had someone check up on Sophie, and Harry comes in and says that after running the background check, he can confirm that Sophie is legitimate, but her "boss", Eliot, is the son of a mobster and apparently buying art at random. When Sophie starts to go, Maxwell asks her to oversee his Monet collection. Sophie agrees, and tells Maxwell that Eliot is flipping art to cover his drug money, and his father stole the Rembrandt along with the other twelve pieces of art. Maxwell asks Sophie to help him screw Eliot.

Later, Eliot "procures" a failing trucking company. He tells Sophie that he figures that as the son of a Boston gangster, she wrote the part with Nate in mind. Eliot offers to talk with her about her loss, and Sophie says that it is her way of talking about it. Sophie talks to Harry privately and says that Nate burned with anger and loss, but at least he burned.

Maxwell comes to the company and approached Eliot, and says that he wants to buy the Rembrandt. He says that he has Harry working with the IRS so Eliot can never sell the painting, and he'll pay Eliot $25 million for the $40 million painting, and then give it back once it's authenticated.

Later, the team brings the fake painting to the company in one of Eliot's food trucks. Eliot takes it in, while Hardison shows Sophie how the truck is now a "miniature Lucille" that has computer equipment for Leverage International. Meanwhile, Maxwell calls and cancels his meeting with Harry, with Eliot. Eliot arrives and finds four of Maxwell's security thugs waiting for him, along with Bligh, a woman who provides security for Maxwell. Blight recognizes Eliot for who he really is, and says the audition is for the thugs. Eliot smugly describes how they'll attack him, and how he'll defeat them. She figures he's doing so to get them to second-guess themselves, and Eliot smiles and then defeats them and walks off.

In the truck, Harrys suggests they offer up another painting. Sophie advises against it, warning that the con is blown. Hardison checks Blight's security company, Quality Protection, and confirms they have offices all over, and they tend to work for bad people and are more like a private army. He suggests they should run, but Sophie refuses to abandon her "home" where Nate lived. Eliot barges in and grabs Harry, grabbing him and figuring that Harry betrayed them. Harry insists that he didn't and that working with the team in insane. He says that he wanted to make amends and tried to track down everyone he and Maxwell hurt.

The Past

Harry goes to Cole's house and finds it's been posted for foreclosure. A neighbor tells him that Jenny left, and that Cole OD'd and hospital bills took what was left of Jenny's money.

Tre Present

Harry says that if he can't be forgiven, he's trying to take something from people like Maxwell.

Later, Harry goes back to the museum and breaks in as the alarms go off. He burns the Rembrandt and laughs in triumph.

The next day, Maxwell calls Harry into his home. One of Maxwell's bodyguards immediately beats Harry, and Maxwell finishes his call to his insurance company having his funds transferred and giving his account routing number and password. Maxwell finishes his call, and tells Harry that it's for the Rembrandt Harry burned. When Harry denies burning the painting, the bodyguard beats him again. His employer points out that there's no evidence but he's left with Harry, and the bodyguard points a gun at Harry's head. Maxwell says that he can easily make it look like Harry threatened him, then gets a call from museum wanting to apologize to him for their bad security. He tells Harry that he's called his firm and had Harry fired, and goes to the museum.

The insurance agent, Connie Lieu, is at the museum with the curator. Maxwell comes in, and they ask him why he hired someone to burn a fake Rembrandt. Harry had Hardison make the fake, and Parker broke in and swapped the real one for the fake. Maxwell says that it's a mistake, but they figure he sold the real painting and torched the fake to collect the insurance. The curator has called the other museum displaying Maxwell's painting, and confirmed they're all fakes, since Parker broke into the other eight museums and put in fakes. Maxwell storms out and calls his insurance company, and discovers the person he called earlier to give his passwords was a fake.

The team pulls up in a car, and Harry tells Maxwell that he stole the passwords when he was in Maxwell's house earlier. Later at Sophie's house, Harry says that gloating was fun. Hardison tells Harry that they sold the painting and are sending the money to the people Maxwell hurt, but they couldn't find everyone. He tells Harry that the lawyer has a long way to go to fully redeeming himself, and he has many things to do to pay penance. Conning Maxwell isn't a win, but it's the start. Harry admits to Sophie that Hardison is right, and a newscast about Maxwell comes in saying he's fled to Panama. Harry tells the others that Maxwell's family had one more emergency fund, and Parker tells Sophie that it's her call if they go after Maxwell. Sophie says that she said one job, but the job isn't done. As the others go to pack, Sophie looks at her and Nate's wedding ring on her finger.

description: With a new team member on board plus the arrival of Hardison's genius foster sister, the team heads to Panama to pull an elaborate heist before an evil billionaire can get his money and flee to a non-extradition country.
tags: ['new orleans louisiana', 'wall safe', 'horse painting', 'fictional company lybrus pharmaceuticals', 'vault', 'trifold brochure', 'aerial surveillance drone', 'panama city panama', 'bribe', 'food truck', 'foster sister', 'security system tour', 'rave', 'celebrity', 'gulfstream 650 business jet', 'gold bullion', 'crawling through an air shaft', 'diamond drill', 'elevator', 'optic fiber', 'safecracking', 'laser', 'bearer bond', 'foot chase', 'bomb']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In New Orleans, Harry walks into his firm's office building and the receptionist Lola tells him that he's been fire. A security guard comes over and Parker, posing as a janitor, pickpockets his badge. Sophie distracts Lola with a fake call, and Parker uses the badge to go up in the elevator posing as an intern while the senior partner, John Safer, is coming down to talk to Harry. Using the floorplans on his computer, Hardison directs Parker to Harry's old office, and Parker discovers the files on Harry's old clients aren't there.

Safer talks to Harry in the lobby, and Harry loudly says that Safer must have moved his files into Safer's office, so Parker can hear him over the comms. She goes there and finds the safe, while Harry berates Safe for working for Fletcher. Safer, unimpressed, walks away. Harry leaves, and Fletcher's guards drive up and take Harry to Fletcher. Eliot, posing as a workman, knocks them out and leaves with Harry. They go to an old abandoned business that belongs to one of Harry's old clients, but Hardison is distracted monitoring his operations around the world. Eliot confirms that RIZ tried to nab Harry, and Fletcher's family transferred Fletcher to Panama along with Ryan Corbett, a former US military intelligence agent who came along. Eliot knows Corbett from his reputation of being smart and ruthless, and Corbett bought the building where Fletcher is., and where Corbett uses the old CIA vaults to store any offshore valuables. Fletcher's family storing $20 million there, while Fletcher waits for his money to clear with Panamanian government. Sophie finally says they should go steal $20 million dollars. A drone is monitoring the team as they leave.

At the Panama City courthouse, Fletcher waits with Judge Ramos and complains that he's been waiting a week for the banks to transfer his funds. He slips Ramos a bribe, and Ramos says he can take care of it. As Ramos goes to his chambers, Hardison and Sophie approach him posing as UK agents who say they're after Fletcher for funding a terrorist attack and may have exposed Ramos to a toxin. Once they convince Ramos he's been exposed, he runs off to decontaminate himself.

Harry, Eliot, and Parker go into Corbett's building and start burning files, saying the Federales are coming. At the courthouse, Sophie tells Hardison that drawing on the past helps her, but she can't work forever. Eliot meets them at an open-air market, and Eliot spots the drone. and knocks it out with a thrown fruit. They spot one of Eliot's food trucks nearby, open the door, and find Hardison's foster sister Breana inside. They take her to the others, and Breana admits that she was tailing them just like Parker taught her when she was 11. Breana admits Nana doesn't know she's there, and she wants to fight rich guys rather than do day jobs. Hardison is reluctant, and Parker drags him off. Hardison hopes she'll make the right choice, while he calls Nana and finds out what's really going on. She goes back and tells Breana that she can do on job, and should get into the building's electronics and security to prove her worth. They figure Harry can get in because he "reads" like a Fed, and Breana uses Hardison's equipment to hack the building electronics.

Fletcher meets with Corbett and tells him that he wants his $20 million, but Corbett refuses unless Fletcher has the government paperwork. Corbett then meets with Harry, who gives him the tour of the building's vaults, while Fletcher texts with his mole, Corbett's aide. Later, Harry shows the plans to the team and Breana suggests they start an ATM pop-up concert next door to spoof the seismic sensors. Sophie, Breana, and Harry go to set up to the concert while the others drill into the vault.

The first team set up the concert for the Panamanian spider monkey and Sophie convinces DJ Com4rat to appear. Corbett hears about the concert, and goes to see Breana with some questions. She says that she's the concert promoter, turns on her comm, and patches the signal through to the others. As they head back Corbett asks Breana why she's there. Sophie gives Breana a general plan, saying Corbett is greedy and can't imagine anyone not like him. Breana tells Corbett that she's making a personal profit, and Corbett says that he's a big fan of Com4rat, and admires her hustle, and will come back and shoot her if he finds out that she's lying. He leaves with his aide, Diego, and the others arrive in time to see Corbett leave. Parker doesn't want to risk Breana's life, but Sophie figures Breana did well and they should give her a chance.

The next day, Hardison and Eliot take the drill to the target site. Hardison checks with Breana, who has things under control, and then with Harry, who has gold bricks rigged with explosives.

Fletcher meets in a park with Diego, and offers him $8 million if Diego gets him into the fault with his money. Diego agrees and says that he'll use the concert that night to distract Corbett. Sophie picks up the masked Com4rat at the airport, while in a nearby hanger Harry meets with Corbett and Diego and gives him the gold bars he wants to store in one of their vaults. At the base, Hardison is still working with his refugee problem via phone. Eliot notices and asks Hardison if it's a side gig, and it's okay if Hardison switches to something else. Hardison checks in with Breana, who is in one of the food trucks monitoring the concert-goers. She thanks Hardison for the opportunity.

As they drive to the building, Corbett assures Harry that his gold is safe. Then he gets a call.

Hardison is in contact with Sophie, and has her have Com4rat increase his music to cover the drill noise. She does and Eliot starts drilling, and Parker goes in through the vents. Diego suggests that Corbett meet with Com4rat, and Harry hides his face as Fletcher comes in to meet with Diego. Harry tells the team that Fletcher is there, while Corbett comes into the office and sees Hardison and Eliot drilling. He orders Diego to the vault, and Eliot fights Corbett while telling Hardison to keep drilling.

Diego goes to the vault and tells Fletcher to go to the office. Breana detects Diego's elevator and shuts it down, and blocks his walkie-talkie signal so he can't call for help. Eliot knocks out Corbett, and Harry arrives and tells him and Hardison that they can't access the vault level since Breana shut down the elevator. Breana tells Sophie that she won't let them down, and runs electronic interference for them. Hardison lowers a fiber-topic camera into the vault via the drill hole, and Parker enters the outside hallway via the vent. Breana intercept the code word request and hacks the system to get it.

Hardison directs Parker through safecracking the vault door, and she hears Diego and his men coming. Eliot crawls through the vents, drops down, and fights the approaching security men. Parker gets into the vault but smells lasers, and tells Hardison to talk her through them, while Eliot fights Diego. She gets to the box and opens it, which turns off the lasers. Fletcher enters the vault and draws a gun on Parker, and she smiles as Eliot comes up behind Fletcher, disarms him, and she knocks out Fletcher. They run into the neighboring concert, joining Harry and Hardison, with the recovering guards in pursuit. Corbett and Fletcher join them, and they figure one of their targets is hiding in the Com4rat costume. When Corbett pulls off Com4rat's mask, he reveals the real Com4rat. The guards run out the exit and find the waiting ravers,

The team meet up in the food truck, and then Harry calls Fletcher and tells him that US Marshals are on the way. Harry tells Fletcher to call his lawyers and make sure he's still paying the bills, and Fletcher does so. His phone signal triggers the detonator, which up Harry's explosive-rigged gold and everything in the vault. Corbett learns about it and is none too happy. He tells Fletcher that they have to run, for the rest of their lives,

Sophie tells Harry that Corbett was as bad as Fletcher, and they don't leave loose ends. Hardison asks Harry to help him with something, and Harry agrees.

Later back in New Orleans, the team meet at the bar they're using as their new base, and Hardison explains that they used the old business that they bought. He says that he's leaving, and Parker walks off, upset. Hardison goes after her, and says that he's going to Sri Lanka to prevent an economic collapse. Parker tells him that he should go, and wants him to do it. She asks him to take Breana with him, and Hardison finally reached Nana and found that Breana is doing the same thing he was going at her age. Parker hugs Hardison and tells him not to leave Breana with her,.

They go in and Sophie says that she's sorry her "reunion concert" has come to an end. Everyone think Sophie should stay, even Harry, and Eliot tells her they could use the help. Sophie agrees but says that it's not permanent. Harry serves drinks and figures that he'll stay with the team because they need an inside man.

description: The Leverage team takes on a greedy riverboat casino owner, before he can bulldoze the homes of longtime New Orleans natives for his planned expansion.
tags: ['boat', 'mortgage', 'pump action shotgun', 'callable loan', 'bicycle bell', 'wearing bells', 'numbing cream', 'year 1901', 'fictional company clamshell corporation', 'reference to virginia wolff', 'pairing devices', 'riverboat casino', 'skeet shooting', 'sazerac', 'explosion', "running for one's life", 'coffee', 'giant pearl', 'woman wears a hoop skirt', 'champagne', 'security camera', 'diamond ring', 'safecracking', 'russian mob', 'pile of money', 'laundering money', 'russian oligarch', 'knocked unconscious', 'sleeper hold', 'thumbs up hand gesture', 'vault', 'life vest', 'historical house', 'punched in the face', 'home made cake']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A New Orleans home owner, Lenore Petitpas, is at home when Jake arrives and tells her that she's being evicted, and the bank sold her loan. She says that they did receive notification, but it said the new owners couldn't kick her out. Jake tells her there's a clause in the loan, and the new owners are exercising the loan to kick her out. Lenore's granddaughter, Ava, comes up to complain Jake is a thug. She pulls a shotgun on Jake, and, unimpressed, he says that he'll be back and threatens Ava.

Jake goes to his car where his boss, Austin Chaudry, is waiting. He tells Austin that Lenore will be evicted, and they drive off.

At the restaurant, Parker is wearing a suit covered with bells and training Breana how to pickpocket. Breana insists that the test is impossible, Sophie leaves to do "client intake" with Harry, and goes to meet with Lenore at the latter's house. Harry goes over the paperwork and confirms that Breana forged the clause so it appears Lenore put up the house as collateral, letting him foreclose on Lenore. Sophie admires the homemade dresses Lenore has made for her family, and Lenore goes to get her sketchbook. Ava tells Sophie that the neighbors have been driven out, and isn't interest in selling out. As Sophie and Harry leave, Sophie compliments Harry on how well he did.

At the restaurant, Breana reports to the team that their opposition is using a shell company, and the papers on the house were never filed. No one is impressed with her work to find out a shell company is involved, and the fact she didn't follow the money all the way. Harry figures whoever is foreclosing has someone in city hall, and Breana says she'll check it out but might have to crash the whole city's computers. Sophie says that they'll go old school and walks upstairs. Eliot and Parker put their fingers to their noses, and Breana and Harry don't get the joke.

At the City Hall Bureau of Records, Sophie and Harry go in and Breana directs them to the one employee who is living above his means. The two teammates go into the office of Billy Barnes and Harry blurts out that they're married. Sophie plays along and says she wants to determine what assets Harry is hiding, and Barnes looks them up on his computer but doesn't find anything. Sophie gets a glance at Barnes' laptop, while Harry overacts. Sophie matches him and storms out, and Harry goes after her and they talk about their marriages and divorces.

Sophie leaves her phone behind, and Breana uses it to clone Barnes' phone as he calls Austin, a former Congressman. Breana refuses to call Hardison for help, and she and Parker listen in as Austin tells Breana that they'll take possession in a week and then all Barnes has to do is count his money. Breana confirms who Austin is and reports to the rest of the team, and determines that he owns a riverboat casino, the 'Mississippi Pearl'. Breana boasts that she stole a thumb drive from Harry' briefcase, and discovers that Parker stole it from her.

Breana confirms that Austen has put everything he has into the casino, which has expanded onto land. If he fails to build his complex, he loses his license and goes bankrupt. Lloyd Van Winkle, with the Gaming Commission, decides if Austin gets the license, and Harry's firm dealt with him and Van Winkle is honest. Because of that, Austin will have to get his license legitimately and Sophie figures the team will have to stop Austin from doing that. Breana suggest they get Austin on a misdemeanor, and the others point out that Austin has connection that would make any misdemeanor disappear. Sophie figures they'll have to rob the casino's vault, and the team go over the casino plans.

Eliot applies for a job with the casino, while the others figure they have to meet with Van Winkle and convince Austin they're competing for his license. Harry has a membership at VAN WINKLE's gun club, where Austin meets with him, while Parker flirts with VAN WINKLE using a flowchart Hardison made for her. When Austin approaches Parker and VAN WINKLE, VAN WINKLE declines and Parker makes sure Austin hears her say they'll talk more about gaming licenses at a party later. Parker then talks to Harry about how her party, and how a nearby Sophie is planning it. Once Parker and Sophie leave, Austin approaches Harry, who tells him Parker's cover story and how she's planning to build a casino complex, and Austin asks Harry to introduce him to Parker.

Eliot interviews with Dennis, the head of casino security, He notices that Dennis used to be with the police and says he was as well, and Breana feeds Eliot information when Dennis asks him questions about where he was stationed. Eliot takes it from there, making it convincing.

Harry takes Austin over to Parker, who Sophie is arguing with and threatening to walk if Parker doesn't pay her what she promised. Once Sophie walks off, Austin offers Parker some "friendly competition" skeet shooting. As they shoot clay pigeons, Austin tells Parker that Louisiana doesn't have any spare gambling licenses. Harry shoots rigger clay pigeons for Austin so he misses, and Parker says a license might be opening up. Austin tells Jake to follow Sophie.

Dennis hires Elliot and shows him around, including the private team wearing suits that handles the casino money. Later, Eliot tells the team what he's seen and Breana suggests they don't need to follow the money but just be the money. The next day, Austin pulls up to Sophie on the street and invites her to join him, and she does. Meanwhile, Breana goes into the Pearl and puts down some money, and Parker briefs Breana over the comms on how to infiltrate.

Sophie goes for a walk along the river with Austin, and she says that she brings in big spenders for Parker's parties. She talks about how Parker plans to get the license through bribery, and Austin complains about his parents couldn't afford the bribes they needed to start a hotel. He vows that no one will stop him from building his "empire", and everyone will know his name. Austin suggests that Sophie bring Parker big spender--"whales"--to him.

Dennis shows Eliot the surveillance room, and tells him not to push the big red emergency button that seals the vault. There are no cameras in the vault, but in the counting room that is the only way in our out of the vault. Eliot secretly plants an electronic device on the cameras, letting Parker at the restaurant tap into the CCTVs. The money Breana is spending is marked with ID tape so they can follow it into the vault, and a guard shuts down the sensors around "the world's largest pearl" on display to clean it. Breana tells Parker and wants to steal it. Parker resists temptation and tells Breana to stay on mission, bur Breana approaches the pearl and Parker and Eliot both see her approaching the display. The head of security grabs Breana before she can grab the pearl, and Eliot gets there and takes Breana into custody. He then sends her to the restaurant.

At the restaurant, Parker complains that Breana didn't follow her orders. The others tells Breana to wait for her chance, and Sophie tells Breana that they might recognize her face so she's back in the food truck. The others figure they have ten minutes between shifts to crack the vault and grab the money, and get off the boat.

Harry finds Breana outside, and he asks her what she wants. She wants the world to stop sucking, and doesn't believe in hope. Harry tells Breana that she really has to be part of the team.

Later, Breana and Sophie time Parker hiding money underneath her dress. Once Breana leaves, Sophie tells Parker that they have to help Breana grow, and Sophie figures Parker needs a bigger dress.

That night, everyone is gambling at the Pearl. Parker comes in with a big white hoop dress that Lenore made for her. She sits down at a table to play, and Sophie is with Austin and tells him that she invited Parker so Parker could see all the "whales" lose. Eliot and Dennis are in the surveillance room watching the counting room, and Eliot gets Dennis out on a pretense for their "window". Breana loops the empty hallway footage Parker recorded earlier, and Parker excuses herself from VAN WINKLE, saying she has a "personal bodily function" to perform and it could take hours.

Three of the "whales" start winning big, thanks to them and the dealer being plants that are former friends of Nate, that Sophie brought in. Austin notices and goes over. Meanwhile, Eliot and Parker go into the counting room, knocking out the guard, and Parker easily safecracks the vault door. There's more money in there then will fit under the dress, and Eliot tells from a tattoo on the unconscious guard that the men in suits are Russian mob.

Sophie realizes that Austin is laundering money for the Russians , to finance his empire plans. Jake is the employee, protecting money for a Russian oligarch. She wants to regroup, but Breana comes up with an idea. The plants keep winning, and Austin assures Jake that it's fine. He goes over to the bar to order a drink, and Jake warns him not to lose Dmitri's money.

Breana assures everyone her plan will work, and Parker tells the team to "trust the newbie". Eliot follows Breana's instructions and goes through some heavily patrolled areas to get what they need. Jake calls the unconscious vault guard on the radio but gets no response, while Parker takes off her dress. Sophie sees Jake leave and tells Eliot to hurry, and Eliot gets a laundry cart. He knocks out more guards with nitrogen tanks and life jackets that he has in the cart, then unloads them in the boiler room. Dennis finds him and wonders what he's doing, and Eliot tells him that the guys in suits are Russian mafia. Dennis gets punches unconscious by another arriving guard, and Eliot knocks the guard out and makes sure Dennis okay.

Jake goes to the camera room, trying to reach the guard on the radio, and find the tapping device. Once he disconnect it, Jake sees the screens showing Eliot in the counting room. He also sees the unconscious guards scattered around the ship. Meanwhile, Sophie and Austin watch the plants win, and Sophie tries to dismiss it as a hot streak. Jake calls Austin and tells him that they have thieves in their vault, and Austin tells Jake to call the cops. The Russian hits the emergency seal button, trapping Parker and Eliot inside.

Jake rejoins Austin in the casino and they wait for the police. Austin tells Sophie to make sure the plants start losing and leaves with Jake, and Sophie signals the plants to cash out while she tries to raise Parker and Eliot on the comms. Austin and Jake go to the vault with the police and open the door, and find the vault empty with no one inside. Going back to the casino, Austin sees the plants cashing out and tells Sophie to stop them. VAN WINKLE is with Sophie and asks Austin if there's something wrong. The former congressman insists that there isn't, and Sophie loudly says the plants won $2 million. VAN WINKLE wonders if Austin can pay out, and Austin assures him that he can. He then accuses Sophie of setting the whole thing up, and tells the arriving police. Sophie asks Austin if he knew his casino ran a rigged game, in front of VAN WINKLE, and VAN WINKLE offers the police his office's assistance. Sophie smugly tells Austin that the Russians won't be happy with him, tell Austin that now everyone will know his name, and walks off. Jake takes Austin to see Dmitri.

As Sophie walks out, she hears Dennis telling a detective that the men in suits are Russian mob. She sees that the pearl is missing from the display case, while the police discover that the counting room floor is soaked. Earlier on Breana's instructions, Eliot and Parker sealed off the vault's air vents, filled the room with nitrogen from the tanks, then cut a hole in the floor and pushed the money through. The river current swept the money on the life jackets away, and then they dove in and followed it to shore. The others pick them, up and Parker tells Breana that she did a good job.

The next day, Sophie and Harry give the deeds, free and clear, to Ava and Lenore. Sophie assures the family that they've done the same for any neighbors still in the area, and anyone who got forced out will get fair compensation. Harry has also got the whole neighborhood historical status so no one can tear the houses down.

Back at the restaurant, Eliot calls Dennis and assures him he'll help him pass the entrance exam to the police force. He tells Breana that he doesn't make friends, and is furious when Parker eats the carrot cake Dennis sent him. After Eliot leaves, Breana asks Parker why she decided to trust her on the boat. Parker says that Hardison wrote to trust the person in the van on one of his flowcharts, and they both wish Hardison was there. Parker assures Breana that they have her and she's glad the girl is there. Breana wants to learn everything and take on the bad guy, and Parker says that Hardison trust Breana with Parker and she doesn't want the girl to come to harm. Breana says that she grew up in the world like it is and she's not scared, and Parker tells Breana that training starts tomorrow, tosses Breana the pearl, and leaves.

description: One member of the team seeks redemption and justice by convincing Leverage to con a developer out of an entire luxury apartment building.
tags: ['construction site', 'building collapse', 'unsafe building', 'cover up', 'punching a heavy bag', 'blueprint', 'speaking klingon', 'chauffeured limousine', 'crowbar', 'sledgehammer', 'building tour', 'tranquilizer', 'modern art', 'targeted subsonic projector', 'wall safe', 'vertigo', 'safecracking', 'cracked ceiling', 'running upstairs', 'jumping off a building', 'emergancy escape chute', 'discredited', 'panic']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Mateo Navarro is directing his construction crew to do stud reinforcement on the building they're working on, and the owner Jason Crawley arrives and complains that they're behind schedule and there's no need for the reinforcement. Mateo warns that they're cutting corners and can't afford to cut more, and Jason says that he doesn't care. As Jason laves via the stairs, the building shakes and he runs and gets out. The building collapses behind him as he takes cover behind a nearby car.

Three Years Later

Mateos's daughter Isabella is outside a new building Jason is constructing, and trying to raise people's attention about the death of her father Mateo after the building collapsed. Harry is across the street watching, Laster he goes to Xavi's home and says that he wants to talk about Mateo, and Xavi slams the door in Harry's face. Isabella answers the door and apologizes for her uncle, invites Harry in, and explains Xavi wasn't working the day the building collapsed. She says that Jason ignored Mateo's complaints, and the complaints disappeared from Jason's files. They're not homeless only because Xavi gets disability, and she just wants to make sure it doesn't happen again and wants Jason to be held responsible.

Later at the bar, Harry plays a newscast about the building collapse and how the charges were dismissed against Jason because of lack of evidence. Sophie says that they let their clients find them, and Breana briefs the team on how Jason is marrying Krista Moore-Crawley and they had the date of the wedding moved up. Krista's rich family connections got the charges against Jason dismissed, and her money is propping up Jason's real estate business. The couple is about to open a new building, the Axios Tower. Eliot notes that the plans show Axios is the safest building in America, because Jason is living in Axios. Sophie figures Jason's financial margins are razor-thin, and the Crawleys only have $10 million left. If something goes wrong with one of their loans, they won't have enough cash on hand to cover it. Harry wants to give Jason justice, and Sophie tells him that they'll do what they can. There's a new lead banker, Adreienne Bisset, assigned to the Crawley's loan and the couple have never met her, so Parker will take her place.

Parker calls Jason in his limo and tells him that she's checked his loans and discovered some overages. She tells him that she'll be coming by for an inspection, and Krista takes the phone and says that they're looking forward to it. Once Krista hangs up, she tells Jason that there's nothing for Parker to find and tells him to do his breathing exercises, while she and the driver, Liam, exchange glances.

Sophie then calls Adrienne pretending to be Krista, and says they're going to need more money to convert their floors, and invites her to come check it out.

The team goes to Axios, and Sophie tells the team that Parker will tour the completed area, while she tour Adreienne through the uncompleted area. Eliot and Breana will make the uncompleted area look like such a disaster that Adreienne will pull the loan. Breana and Eliot go in and wreck the uncompleted floors.

Parker meets with Jason in the lobby, while Harry and Sophie meet with Adreienne in an alley behind Axios. Breana and Eliot go back to the foot truck and Breana tracks both groups on her laptop. A nervous Adrienne quickly leaves, and almost runs into Parker and Jason as Parker leaves. Jason sees Harry and recognizes him a lawyer that used to work for his business. He jumps at loud noises and takes tranquilizers, and Harry goes over to the food truck. Sophie is waiting, and figures that Harry forgot to mention that he's connected to Jason.

Later at the bar, Harry tells the others that Jason was one of his former clients and it was his team that killed the case against Jason after the building collapse. Eliot points out that keeping information from them is how mistakes are made, and Harry admits that he saw a chance to make a little bit of what he did right. Sophie says that they don't work for Harry, and he's too close to the situation. Breana wants to keep Harry on the con, Parker, Eliot, and Breana all vote to keep Harry on, and Sophie agrees but tells Harry no more surprises. Sophie figures Adreienne will pull the Crawleys' loans, and that will give them a week to pay them back before the bank seizes Axios. Eliot figures they put the money out and control the situation, and Breana says that she can do her part. Sophie agrees but tells Breana that she'll do all the talking.

Once the Crawleys get word the bank is calling in the loan, Sophie and Breana go to see them. Sophie poses as a business manager to the "artistic elite", and Breana as a street artist, 6daze, who is looking to move to the States. Breana has already done a painting of Eliot and put it online for Krista to find, proving Breana's credentials. Krista says that it would be an honor to show them around, and takes them on a tour of Axios.

The Crawleys show Sophie and Breana the penthouse. Jason worries about the price, but Krista tells him that once word get out that Breana is living there, they can double the price on every unit. Liam comes in and tells Krista that she has a call, and she tells Jason to close the deal and goes with Liam. Sophie tells Jason that they can get a letter of credit as required, but it will take about two weeks. So he doesn't have to tell Krista he failed, Jason says that they'll take letters promising some of Breana's profits on her next sale, as long as they can get the money within a day.

Later, Sophie calls Jason and tells him that Breana has accepted a residency in Reykjavik and won't be moving in. Harry helped write the contract with a hidden clause that they can write when they want to. Krista goes over the contract with Jason and is not happy when she finds the clause, and they realized they can't get financing within the week. She insists she isn't going to let them fail and goes to make her phone call.

Harry tells Sophie that the Al-Abadi family just became shadow partners in Axios, and figures the team lost. He's received an invitation to Axios' opening. She meets with the team, and tells them the party has to be such a failure that the Al-Abadi's back out of the deal. They'll undermine Jason's faith in the tower, which will undermine the Al-Abadi's faith in Krista. She figures Jason is primed to stress out, and Breana has a plan to use rumble packs And subsonic projectors, which Parker helpfully tests on Breana, knocking her down. They need a place closer to Jason, and Eliot suggests they set up in the suite near the office. Parker has found a hidden safe in the nearby office, and Harry figures the evidence about the building collapse is there. Sophie tells Harry to focus on the con, but Harry and Parker convince Sophie to agree.

Eliot goes in with the caterers, posing as the head chef, and compliments Krista. He sees Krista leave with Liam, and plans the rumble packs he had hidden in his food tray.

At the restaurant, Harry prepares for the party. Sophie asks him if he can handle the situation, and he admits he didn't tell the team because he didn't want them to realize he took pride in his prior work when he was doing. Sophie assures him he isn't that person anymore, and Harry tells her that he won't let them down.

The team sets up their control room in the suite. Harry and Eliot take the elevator up, and Eliot tells Harry that they all have regrets but they move past them. He says that he learned how to live with what he did by not caring about how he hurt or who paid him, but the others showed him there was another way. Parker, hiding in a cart with them, agrees. As the trio go past Jason and Liam, Parker slips out and goes into the office. Parker first plants a heavy-duty rumble pack in the office,

Jason takes Harry to the party and introduces him, and he talks about how to hide cash. Meanwhile, Parker finds the hidden safe but discovers that it has an iris scanner. Rather than Parker getting Jason's iris with a pair of chopsticks, Breana has her find a high-res photo of Jason on his desk. Sophie realizes that Harry's hand is shaking because he feels ashamed and tells him not to let his shame get in the way, and to distract the partygoers while Parker opens the safe.

Parker uses the photo of Jason's eye to get past the scanner and open the safe, but only finds Jason's receipts for workmen's comp.

Jason tells Harry that the Al-Abadis want Harry to negotiate the deal. Harry angrily tells Jason that he helped make sure the Crawleys didn't have to pay Mateo because he didn't have his green card, and Jason has Liam take Harry to his car. Harry shows himself, and Sophie tells Harry that he got himself burned and he's off the con.

Harry goes to the control room, and Sophie tells him that he's out of second chances. She figures that they're still prepped and all they have to do is execute. Harry goes back to the party where everyone has dinner. Parker hides in a nearby vent and uses the equilibrium device on Jason. Jason falls on the floor and thinks the whole place is shaking, and goes to his office. In the office, Jason takes his tranquilizers and tells himself that the place is safe. As Eliot goes to the control room, Breana feeds alarms to Krista into Jason's computer. Jason calls the foreman, and Breana intercepts the call and tosses the phone to Eliot. Eliot says that the building is sub-standard.

Breana activates the rumble packs in the office, and Krista comes in and asks Jason what is going on. He says that she went behind her and hired contractors who did a terrible job. Jason shows her the contracts that Parker substituted, and Krista tells him to calm down. Krista tells him that the people who died don't matter, but they matter, and he needs to calm down so as to not ruin the deal. She tells him to stay out of sight and leaves, and goes back to the party and tells the guests that Jason has a migraine from working too hard. Al-Abadi says that they accept the deal, and Krista goes to the office to get the paperwork. She grabs Liam in the hallway, takes him with her, and says they're plan is working.

Eliot and Harry set off charge above Jason's office, making him think the building is collapsing. He runs past Al-Abadi and heads for the roof, and Sophie tells Harry to "earn it back" by going after Jason. Krista and Liam arrive by elevator in the control room, kissing, and Krista realizes that the team is trying to sink the deal and tells Liam to take care of them. Eliot intercepts Liam and the two men fight.

Jason makes it to the roof and Harry gets there. When Jason climbs up on the edge, Harry tells him he doesn't have to jump.

Krista takes Al-Abadi and his wife Sana to the nightclub where she says Jason is meeting them with the paperwork.

Eliot and Liam fight, while Breana looks on and provides not-so-helpful advice. When Eliot knocks Liam into the computer, it turns up the vibrations and breaks the computer so Breana can't turn them off.

The building shakes and Jason jumps... into the state-of-the art fire escape chute he knows is there.
