Parker arrives, and Harry jumps into the chute and reaches the ground level just to see Jason leave in a taxi. Sophie, Eliot, and Breana come out, and Sophie tells Harry that there's still the finale. Earlier, Parker told Jason that she could hide any money for him. He calls her and tells her to transfer the money, and does so and then jumps into the chute after Harry. Harry isn't impressed that they just got the money, and Breana sends Krista the video of Jason confronting her in his office. Al-Abadi and Sana are in the limo with Krista and hear the video, and Al-Abadi calls off the deal, while Sana says that all of their friends will know what happened.

Parker joins the others who are eating from the food truck, then goes back to take the chute again. Harry apologizes to Sophie for getting too close, and she tells him that it's personal for all of them, but they don't keep secrets from each other. Axios will go up for bid cheap in a few months, and they'll buy it. Then they'll donate the tower to a low-income housing non-profit, and gives Harry the files from the safe.

Later, Harry gives the file to Isabella and Xavi, and tells him that Jason pays into workmen's comp and the fund has one benefactor: Xavi. Xvi knew about the flawed structure, gave Xavi the money, and told him to keep quiet or they'd deport him. He apologizes to Isabella, who takes her uncle's hand comfortingly. Harry tells Xavi that if he comes forward and testifies, Harry will do everything he can to protect him, and make sure the Crawleys face real consequences for the collapse. Xavi agrees, and the others watch from outside through the window. Eliot figures that Harry has gotten back a little piece of his soul back.

description: When a woman believes she is being haunted and runs from her home in terror, Sophie leads Breanna and Parker through a con to convince the two real estate scammers responsible to target Leverage HQ.
tags: ['halloween decoration', 'power outage', 'noise in the night', 'house fire', 'telephone call from mother', 'hit by a car', 'scared', 'candle knocked over', 'woman uses crutches', 'pack of money', 'minispeaker', 'miniprojector', 'hundred dollar bill', 'denying the truth', 'bouquet of red roses', 'real estate scam', 'incompetence', 'flipping a house', 'electrocuted', 'falling down stairs', 'threatened with a knife', 'hitman', 'tasered', 'fog machine', 'sniper', 'cane', 'new orleans louisiana', 'halloween candy', 'fake haunted house']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Four Days Before Halloween

Tina Reynolds is at Aunt Mildred's home, talking on the phone to her mother about her Mildred's funeral. As they argue about Tina moving in with her mother, with Tina refusing, the lights go out. Tina points out that Mildred left the house to her, and her mother cuts the connection. After Tina goes to bed, she jerks awake as a door in the house slams. She turns on a flashlight and hears doorsteps in the floor above, and a wind blows through the room. Mist fills the room, and the nearby candles light up by themselves. "You did this!" appears in blood-red letters on the mirror, and Tina screams and runs out. She knocks one of the candles over, setting the bedsheets on fire, and runs out to the street where she's hit by a passing car. Parker sis nearby, goes over to Tina, and tells the driver to call 911. As people gather, Tina gasps out that she came back two men, Lyle and Deke Herbert, walk away and the older one says that Tina is a problem. The younger one, Lyle, wonders what they're going to do now.

Halloween Day

Breana, wearing a skeleton costume, is wearing a skull costume and decorating the bar for the holiday. Sophie comes in with a mummy dummy, and asks Breana why it's by the front door. Breana points out that Sophie said she could decorate, but Sophie didn't anticipate her going overboard. in response, Breana notes that Christina Killian Santoro is leading the Halloween parade the night, and she's a politician who goes after crooked polluters and other criminals, and Breana read that Christina loves Halloween and wants to impress her. Sophie tells Breana to take it all down and she can decorate the attic.

Parker comes in with Tina on crutches, and Tina sits down with them and tells them what happened. She says that the insurance company accused her of setting the fire herself for the payout, The women offer Tina their spare bedroom, and Breana takes Tina there. Sophie believes Tina's story but tells Parker they can't let guests stay there. Harry and Eliot are in Brunei helping Hardison with an extradition, and they both agree they're not committing crime, although they obviously are. Parker admits that she's afraid of ghosts, and figures they have to help Tina.

Parker and Breana go to the house and search the house, posing as arson investigators. As Breana finds the guestbook from Mildred's funeral, Officer Stuart comes in and tells them that no one is allowed in. Parker bluffs Stuart and he leaves, and after he leaves she finds a hidden speaker and takes it back to the bar to show Tina. They also find projectors that projected the mist and writing. Tina refuses to say why Mildred would blame her for her death, and hobbles off. Parker figures that they just convinced Tina more that she's haunted by showing her evidence that she isn't, and they have to plant clues so Tina figures out for herself the "haunting" is fake.

Parker goes through the guest book, looking for anyone who might have come in to plant the equipment. She spots Lyle and Deke as strangers, and Sophie calls the insurance company and confirms they want absolute proof Tina didn't set the fire. They're from New Jersey, and Sophie figures that it's a real estate scam. The Revenant Realty company they're with is out of New Jersey, and Lyle owns the company and after his brother's death, his nephew Lyle put his design degree plans on hold to help Lyle. Parker figures they need to show Tina who the Herberts really are, and Sophie says that they'll turn the bar into the perfect mark for the Herberts and then Tina will see them at work.

Later, Parker finds Tina packing. Parker explains that there are people that take advantage of the gullible and weak-willed. Tina talks about why she holds herself responsible for Mildred's death, and it was her fault Mildred died. Parker convinces Tina to stay one more day and has Tina tell her what the Herberts did, so they can know what to expect.

The Herberts arrive late and Sophie, playing the grieving widow, greets them. Deke admits he used to be a designer, much to Lyle's irritation. Lyle has a cover story for how he knew the dead man, "Big Daddy", Deke goes off to put away the flowers and tamper with the breaker box. and Breana opens the locked lid for him via remote. He flickers the lights right on cue. Lyle suggests that it might be a sign from Big Daddy, and Deke comes back. Sophie says that Big Daddy died there in a fall, and the Herberts suggest she might sell the place, and they'd be interested in buying. Sophie says she'll stay unless Big Daddy tells her otherwise, and then escorts them out.

As they walk away down the street, Lyle tells Deke that it's the perfect setup for their con. Deke figures that it was too perfect, and his uncle tells him to focus. Lyle calls a man and tells him that they have another place and they'll have it cleared out by that night. The man, the Wraith, looks over his table of guns.

Sophie and the others "se the scene", figuring the Herberts are in a hurry because they bought Sophie's story so easily. Breana has set up the cameras so Tina can see everything, and put the monitors in her guest room. After night falls, the Herberts sneak in and Breana turns on the lights, startling them. Sophie loudly says on the phone that she's going up to her room for a nap, and Lyle says that they have to get thing done fast.

Breana shocks and drops paintings on the Herberts via remote control, then runs off to do the "big finish", with Parker and Tina following her. Meanwhile, Sophie confronts the Herberts and says that they're trespassing,. Wraith and his spotter Hamilton come in and Wraith wonders why Sophie is there. The Herberts grab Sophie, and Wraith draws a knife on Sophie but tells the Herberts to kill her. Parker, watching with Tina, recognizes Wraith as a notorious hitman and tells the others via the comms.

The Herberts tie up Sophie, and Deke suggests to Wraith that Sophie harmless and they let her go. Wraith says that they're his problem if they want to let Sophie go, and Hamilton shows him a podcast of Santoro and the parade approaching. Lyle takes the hint and tells Wraith that they'll take care of Sophie. Breana see the podcast and realizes that Santoro is Wraith's target, and the New Jersey Mob sent small-timers like the Herberts in to secure houses along the parade route. The parade will pass the bar in ten minutes,

Parker and Tina go up to Tina's room on the third floor and Parker tells Tina that she's going out the window.

Lyle tells Deke that he didn't sign up to kill anyone, and Sophie asks him what he wants to do. The younger man says that he only signed up to drive people out of their homes. When Lyle talks about their scam, Wraith overhears him and tells him that people shouldn't mess with the afterlife. He insists that the spirits are real. He says that he didn't cause people's death, and is just a weapon. Sophie overhears him and tells Breana that she has an idea. Breana reports that she has access to all the "haunting" equipment that she set up as well as the Herberts.

Wraith sends Hamilton up to the third floor to find a good line of sight, and Sophie warns Parker. Hamilton comes in and Parker fights him, and then tasers him unconscious. Breana turns on the speakers, and Sophie tells Wraith that it's the house voicing its opinion.

Parker lowers Tina down on a rope, and Breana has her start on the fog projector. Meanwhile, Sophie goes over Wraith's victims from Breana's briefing earlier, and how the ghosts aren't happy with Wraith's presence there. He threatens her with a knife when she keeps talking, and she reminds him that he thinks he doesn't cause the deaths of others. Wraith tells Lyle to kill Sophie, and when Lyle tries to put Wraith off, Wraith gives Deke the knife, tells him to watch Sophie, and drags Lyle off with him. Sophie screams at Deke to put the knife down, and when Wraith and Lyle run back, they find Sophie with her throat cut.

The parade approaches and Wraith tells the guilt-ridden Deke that it's time. Parker sets up the speakers and Breana warns her that Wraith is heading her way. Parker hides in the rafters as Wraith comes in, and he sets up to shoot Santoro. The voices whisper to Wraith and the fog spreads through the room,

Lyle tells Deke that they should leave and let Wraith take the blame. The two men go to get their equipment and hear the voices, and when they try to run, a crate slides over and blocks their path.

The spirits of Wraith's victims appear to him in the mist, thanks to Breana's computerized animations. Earlier, Sophie convinced Deke to help them in return for getting him back into design school. When Deke agreed, Breana supplied fake blood packs so they could fake Sophie's "death". Breana took photos of the "dead" Sophie, and animated it into a "spirit" which Parker helps project to confront Wraith. Wraith panics and runs into a cabinet, knocking Hamilton out of it. Hamilton is tied up in a sheet, and Wraith further panics. As Wraith run downstairs, Parker drops down and tasers Hamilton unconscious again.

Wraith tells the Herberts that they have to get out, and Breana turns up the "voices". A skeleton pulls Deke out of the room, and Breana hits Wraith and Lyle with all of the effects. They panic and run out, where Tina is waiting with the police she summoned. The two men are glad to confess as long as the police get them away from the ghosts.

Parker and Sophie escort Deke out, Parker having played the skeleton. He's glad he has a chance to go out of the family business and go back to school, Later, the woman gather and Breana sends the footage to Tina's insurance company to convince them the fire was an accident. Tina figures she'll rebuild her aunt's property, and her aunt would have wanted her to. Parker gives Tina Mildred's cane that they found in the house, and they all share a toast to neighbors.

Harry and Eliot return the next day, and the women tell them what happened. The women say that they went trick-or-treating but Parker refuses to share her candy. A door opens on its own, and Harry figures the women are messing with him. Voices start whispering, and the women put on skeleton masks and reach for Harry and Eliot.

description: The Leverage team dives into the world of a high fantasy collectible card game with a devoted following to take down a pharmaceutical bad boy who is price-gouging drugs to fund his own house of cards.
tags: ['uprooted tree', 'prescription drug', 'drug price increase', 'laid off', 'pendis pharmaceutical', 'cordocorp hedge fund', 'vulture capitalist', 'niche medical treatment', 'price gouging', 'suck up', 'deed', "springer's castle", 'competitive', "spirit's ruse card game", 'rochambo', 'annual game faire', 'tailing a suspect', 'disguise', 'impersonation', 'vault', 'clue', 'queen ziel card', 'turkey leg', 'medieval costume', 'jousting', 'sword fight', 'twirlling a sword', 'squid', 'tree', 'hole in the ground', 'wearing a crown']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Jenna and her father Michael are walking through the woods, and come to an uprooted tree. Michael gives Jenna her medication on schedule but only gives her one pill, and admits that it's the last one they have even though Jenna is supposed to have two. He hopes that the truck will sell, and she collapses after taking the pill.

Later, Harry and Sophie meet with Michael, who says that Jenna is still in the hospital and has a respirator disease called Swale fever. She gets treatment once a month, and the pill cost went from $30 each to $3,000 each. Michael got laid off six months ago, and the pharmaceutical company, Pendis, got bought out recently by a hedge fund, Cordocorp. He couldn't afford the deductibles and the pills, and the company wouldn't tell Michael the reason for the price hike, Jenna and other kids like her might die because of the price hikes.

The owner, Jim Cordozar, invokes his Fifth Amendment rights at a hearing about his price hikes. The team watch video of the hearing and Harry explains that no legal action was taken against Cordozar, a "vulture capitalist", and he's negotiating with several other pharmaceuticals after his success with Swale fever. What Cordozar's doing isn't illegal, so they'll find his weakness and go after him.

At Cordocorp, Parker and Breana go in with Breana looking for a job there after Parker makes sure the woman Breana would be replacing didn't show up for work. Breana "bumps into" Cordozar's assistant Carter Lagrange and introduces herself, and says the temp agency sent her. Parker is pretending to be a HR rep, making Lucy watch sexual harassment videos. Carter takes the coffee Breana brought in for Cordozar, directly to his boss. Harry and Eliot are at the office watching via Breana's hidden lapel camera, and Harry confirms that Carter is an artificial intelligence expert and Cordozar's key man who writes the programs that helps Cordozar make all the trades. Carter and Cordozar are college friends, and Cordozar exploited Carter's intellect in return for social status.

Cordozar goes off with Carter, and Breana sneaks into Cordozar's office and plans a hidden camera in a lamp. She searches his personal belongings and finds a photo of a castle that she recognizes. Carter comes in and asks Breana what she's doing there, and Breana asks him if Cordozar bought Springer's Castle. He's surprised that Breana recognizes it, and she says that she's a big fan of the game it's the origin for, Spirit's Ruse. Carter says that he wrote an algorithm to find it for sale, and they bond over geek talk. He confirms that Cordozar isn't a fan, but came in second place in a tournament in elementary school. As Breana leaves the office, she tells the others that Spirit's Ruse is the best CCG ever.

Later at the bar, Sophie tells the team that Cordozar can't resist exploiting an opportunity and they can use that against him. Breana briefs the team on Spirit's Ruse, who is a recluse who no one has seen in over a decade. Fans come to the castle once a year for an annual faire and there's a treasure hand to run the super-rare Queen Ziel card. The tournament winner is crowned queen or king of the faire, and they'll convince Cordozar to buy the company that makes the game, while making a fake company to sell him. Then Cordozar will invest all of his assets and lose everything.

The next day at Cordocorp Breana tells Cordozar and Carter that the people she works for want to buy the castle at twice the price Cordozar paid for it. She gives Cordozar a card with a number to call and leaves, and Cordozar tells Carter to follow Breana. Breana leads them to a hangar filled with promo material for the castle. Sophie poses as a developer, and Cordozar figures she wants to turn the castle into a theme park. Sophie says that she's working with someone who will pay double the amount Cordozar paid, even though Carter says Deric Springer would never sell the company. Cordozar tells Sophie that he's going to host the faire for at least the next two years, and Sophie says that she worked for Springer and the designs were what she did for the company. Cordozar doesn't think the company would have sold him the castle if it was worth anything, Sophie claims that Spirit's Ruse will be the beginning of a big franchise, and she'll tear it apart and sell the pieces. Cordozar says that it's a dumb idea and refuses to sell, then leaves. Sophie admits to Breana that they screwed it up... perfectly.

Back at his office, Cordozar confirms that Springer is a recluse that no one has seen for years. He send an email to Springer's last known email address, asking for a meeting. Breana intercepts it, and they send Harry in to pose as Springer, with a fake beard and some extra weight. Harry wants to sell the company because it has made the game into a business, not art, and negotiates as a curmudgeonly artist rather than a lawyer. The real Springer also shows up in Cordozar's office, and Eliot, posing as Harry's lawyer, drags Harry out of sight. Carter has used an analytic program to find Springer, and Springer says that he's ready to sell.

The team regroup at the bar and figure that they messed up by giving Cordozar the idea he could buy the game from Springer. Sophie says that they're not giving up, and what happened when Nate lost his son. Breana ties into the camera feed in Cordozar's office and they listen to Cordozar and Springer talk. Springer doesn't want to hand the game over to a non-fan, and Cordozar says that he has the Queen Ziel card, and shows a photo of it in its original vault Springer will only work from a handshake, and Cordozar is glad to shake with him. The game designer says that they'll shake at the faire on the upcoming Saturday, and Cordozar will walk him through the clues he solved to find the card. They'll trade the card for the company.

Breana tells the team that the Queen Ziel card is the holy grail of the game, and it's hidden in a secret vault in the castle. No one has been ever to solve the clues Springer left to the vault's location, and if they get their hands on the card before Cordozar does, they can kill the deal. They examine the photo and Parker figures she can break into the vault in the photo if they can find it.

The team go to the castle, and Harry will get Parker into the castle as Cordozar shows Springer how he found the vault. Sophie and Eliot will intercept Springer and try to keep him away from Cordozar as long as they can. Breana gives Parker her own note back on her analysis of the clues to the card, and Parker says she doesn't need it because she can find the vault doing the "Parker stuff".

Harry claims to be a member of the local union and distracts the guard while Parker slips in. Meanwhile, Sophie and Eliot slip into an employee to get costumes, much to Eliot's disgust. Breana intercepts Cordozar, Carter, and Cordozar's bodyguard, Bolo, and Cordozar tells her that he's buying the company so she loses. Breana isn't impressed, and Cordozar threatens to have Bolo throw her off the property. She reminds him that he came in second-place in his elementary school tournament, and Cordozar backs down so Breana walks off. Cordozar tells Carter that Springer will see through him in giving him the clues, but if he wins the tournament he'll prove himself worthy. He tells Bolo to find Springer before Sophie does, and make Sophie disappear.

Sophie and Eliot come out wearing costumes, Eliot dressed in armor. They spot Springer and check in with Parker, who says that she's searched everywhere and there is no vault. Breana says that the game is a quest, and the vault is somewhere on the property, hidden. Sophie greets Springer, who is happy that someone at the faire recognizes him, Springer goes to meet with Cordozar, but Sophie convinces him to stay and watch Eliot in the jousting tournament. Cordozar and his group see them and follow.

Carter rigs a pair of glasses with a hidden microphone to get him through the card tournament. Breana tells Harry and Parker that they have to be on a part of the ground where they can't see the castle, based on the first clue. That only narrows it down to half the grounds.

Eliot enters the jousting track wearing an inflatable dragon ring, and Bolo sends two of his men in with instructions to "break" Eliot. His opponent deflates the dragon and the two swordfight, along with Bolo's men. Eliot realizes they're experienced fighters, and Sophie spots Bolo in the crowd. The fight is real, and the crowd cheer as Eliot tosses away his sword and fights hand-to-hand. Everyone applauds as Eliot wins. Meanwhile, Breana is playing in the card tournament and realizes that the lake picture on a card is longer than the pond on the property. She figures the vault in in the space on the lake that isn't on the pond. Parker wonders what kind of mentor she is if Breana is teaching her things, and Harry says that she's the best kind and Breana is trying to connect with Parker, and Parker should let her.

Breana and Cordozar both win and end up playing each other. He tells her that she's going to lose the tournament because she's worried about being nice, and if she wants to be a winner then she has to take and take, and don't worry about who likes her. Breana points out that he's not worried about the kids who can't afford his drugs, and Bolo calls Cordozar and tells him that Sophie is with Springer. Cordozar tells Bolo to get Sophie away from Sophie and over to him.

Springer wants to leave, and Sophie asks him to stay for her sonnet recital. Breana has Sophie say that she's reciting one of his sonnets, and Springer gives in. While Sophie waits to recite, Breana is called back to her match with Cordozar. She realizes that he's cheating and calls a time out, then intercepts the signal to Carter, who says that Breana needs one card to win and Cordozar has an 86% chance of winning, using the same algorithm to calculate the odds that he used to find the vault. Breana tells Harry and Parker, and Parker hesitantly praises Breana.

Sophie gives her typical bad acting performance, and Breana listening in realizes that the clue is in the sonnet. Parker and Harry find the tree mentioned in the sonnet, while Sophie gets into her performance and everyone applauds as Parker finds the tree branch that is secretly a lever that opens the vault. Breana returns to the game, while Parker and Harry enter the vault and discover the card is gone, and Cordozar must have it.

Breana plays the one card she needs to, and Cordozar accuses her of looking through her glasses. She points out that's impossible because he doesn't have a camera built into his glasses. Cordozar has no choice but to toss away his glasses, but calls for a new deck for the final round. Eliot and Sophie find Springer and Bolo, while Harry searches the boxes in the vault and says they might have found something even better.

When Springer and Bolo enter the tent, Cordozar calls a timeout and goes over to greet Springer. Cordozar shows Springer the Ziel to prove he's a fan, and Sophie and Eliot come in. Harry and Parker come in and say that the FDA is going to freeze all of Cordozar's assets. Cordozar hid his own valuable in the vault thinking it was safe, including his research on the cure for Swail fever. They sent the cure to all of Cordozar's competitors, so now the drug treatment is worthless. That's fraud, so even if Cordozar doesn't go to jail, he'll lose his company and banned from ever busying another drug company again. Bolo tries to attack them, and Eliot knocks him out. Sophie points out that Cordozar doesn't have any money to buy Springer's company, and reminds Springer that he promised to sell him the company if Cordozar gave him the card. Springer insists on keeping his word, and Breana asks if he's going to keep his word to her and all the people who love the game he created. She says that Cordozar can't show Springer how he found the vault, and it's more than just a business to all the fans. Breana tells Springer that his game made them feel like they weren't alone in the world, and they could belong.

Springer tells Cordozar that he can't sell him his company, and gives the Ziel to Breana. She takes it as the fans applaud, and she bows to Springer.

Later at the bar, Michael tells Harry and Sophie that Jenna is responding to her new treatments. They got the company's new owners to pay Jenna's bills, and happy they can avoid paying a class action lawsuit. Sophie tells Michael that knowing Jenna and the kids like her will be fine is all the payment they need, and all she needs. Harry and Sophie then go back to the others, who are playing Spirit's Ruse for money with Breana teaching everyone.

description: The team takes on a brilliant software developer who is selling a groundbreaking facial recognition system that threatens everyoneâs privacy except his own.
tags: ['programmer', 'searchlight facial recognition software', 'oklahoma city', 'stalker', 'finger puppet', 'safehouse', 'police officer', 'new identity', 'divorced couple', 'arlo louisiana', 'police surveillance camera', 'field test', 'child custody', 'woman fights a man', 'unloading a gun', 'running away', 'computer room', 'beta test', 'locked in', 'fire suppression system', 'sleeper hold', 'invasion of privacy', 'security team', 'surveillance drone', 'electric fence', 'underground cable', 'smart house', 'falling off a chair', 'bad temper', 'virtual assistant', 'fingerprint', 'biometric authentication', 'coffee maker', 'antihistamine', 'graphite powder', 'eye drops', 'blender', 'voice recognition', 'foot chase']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Libby Barnes is out shopping with her daughter Frankie and they're getting into the car, when Libby's ex-husband Reese Johnson comes up, pounds on the car window, and yells at Libby that he'll find her because she can't hide forever. Libby drives off and calls her friend Parker to tell her what happened.

Later, Parker gathers the team and tells them about Libby. Libby and Frankie are in a safehouse, and Parker explains that Reese is a cop in small-town Arlo, LA. Libby got full custody of their daughter, but Reese won't leave them alone. Four years ago, she, Eliot, and Hardison helped hide Libby in a new town, and gave her and Frankie new identities. Hardison wrote an algorithm to scrub Libby's face off the Internet, and Reese could only have found Libby by cracking Hardison's algorithm. Eliot suggests an analog solution, but Breana doesn't believe it and figures something else is going on.

Parker, Harry, and Eliot go to Arlo to check it out, and they notice the police cars are the latest models and have state-of-the-art computers. There's been a tech boom in the area, and Breana confirms via computer that the crime rate in Arlo has gone down over the last six months. Eliot points out all the CCTVs, the latest tech, and Sophie figures the police are being paid to use it. Breana sets Eliot up with a fake ID with a Federal bench warrant out on him. Eliot bumps into a man while going to a coffee shop to get spotted by the CCTVs, while Parker watches Eliot. The police arrive within a minute, even though Eliot is covering half his face.

Federal marshal Maria Shipp approaches Eliot, who immediately runs. Maria goes through the shop and ambushes Eliot in the back alley. He disarms her, and the two fight hand-to-hand. The marshal manages to hold her own, but the police arrive and capture Eliot at gunpoint. Breana tells Sophie that Arlo has advanced facial recognition that is more powerful than the FBI's by a factor of ten. Sophie has Breana make the bench warrant disappear, and then go into the system physically. They call Parker in so she won't get recognized by the system.

Breana goes to the Arlo police station after wiping the warrant. Harry is Eliot's lawyer, and demands that the police release Eliot. Maria isn't convinced, and she and Eliot flirt. She figures that Eliot is former special op, even though his record doesn't show it. Breana goes to the server room and realizes that a program named Searchlight is running... and is predictive and told the police that Eliot was going to a bank to rob it. Whoever wrote Searchlight scraped millions of photos. The author, the man Eliot bumped into outside the coffee shop, is watching Breana via the monitor cam, and seals the server room and turns on the fire suppression system.

Harry goes to the server room to try to get Breana out, and a security guard approaches Harry. The ex-lawyer tries to choke him out on Eliot's advice, Parker has Harry use the guard's taser to overload the magnetic plate on the locked door, freeing Breana.

The trio go back to the bar, Breana says that no other facial recognition software compares to Searchlight. Reese found Libby using the police access to Searchlight, and Libby was in the background on a photo. The image was so blurry Hardison's algorithm didn't flag it, but Searchlight did. It can be used by dictators and mobsters, and Arlo is small enough to be a controlled experiment. There has to be a dedicated line running from the police station to the master computer. Eliot and Parker go back to Arlo to track the high-end security like the guard at the police station, figuring they and their portable fitness devices can lead them to the master computer.

Later in Arlo, Eliot and Parker spot three guards at the coffee shop. Eliot distracts the nearby Maria, while Parker poses as a waitress and takes one of the guard's cell phones and fitness devices. Inside, Maria notes she's there to investigate the lowered crime rate and Eliot gives her his real name. They go back to the bar, and Breana determines the private house outside of Arlo where the master computer is. Maria texts Eliot, and the others notices and tease him about it. Eliot identifies the man he bumped into as Joseph Cheng, from the driver's license photos of the homeowners in the area. He's a reclusive Silicon Valley game designer.

Parker, Eliot, and Breana go to Arlo and watch Cheng from a food truck. and Breana confirms that Cheng sues anyone who write about him, so there's not much information out about him. He wrote an app game and then was sued for marketing information on his customers to marketing companies. Parker is in the shop and sees Cheng complaining to barista about her using the wrong oil in his coffee, and she cracked a cell tower and found calls between Cheng and a Buddy Harwick. Harwick is Cheng's investor, and Breana hacks Harwick's phone. Harwick is meeting with RIZ in two days, and they'll sell Cheng's software to all their clients.

Breana and Eliot go to Cheng's mansion, posing as utility workers. Cheng has massive security and they figure his servers are in the house. Breana sends in a drone to get the layout, but an electrical fence shorts it out. Eliot starts up a drill, and Cheng's house ALAY-NA warns him that his blood sugar level is low. Cheng is upset that the drill is running his concentration, and he pounds on the window in anger.

Harry gets into Harwick's emails and learns that Harwick has been trying to get Cheng to see a social interaction consultant.

Breana taps the fiber optic lines going into the house, and confirms that there are no camera in the house. She finds a line for biometric scanners and figures the smart-house AI is Cheng's security. In the house, ALAY-NA tells Cheng to get some extra sleep, and he tells the AI that it's the best. Meanwhile, Breana tells Eliot that Cheng is trying to control people's lives, and they won't be able to escape their mistakes or pasts. She wonders how she can beat Cheng if Cheng beat Hardison's algorithm, and Eliot assures her that they figure Breana can beat Cheng and he know she can.

Sophie figures they'll ruin Cheng's big sale, and then hack into his servers. Harry send a text from Harwick's phone to Cheng, pushing up the meeting a day. He's working as a barista at the shop, having bought out the previous owners, and annoys Cheng until he tells Harry his name and to let him go. Breana has sawed through Cheng's chair leg, causing him to fall over and further unravel. Harry tempers with Cheng's coffee order, as he tries to sell his program to the RIZ representatives. The representatives leave, and Harwick looks up social interaction representatives and comes up with Sophie and Parker's names, thanks to some Internet tampering by Breana. Sophie will distract Cheng with advice, while Parker finds the server so Breana can hack in and wipe the root code. ALAY-NA talks with them, and Breana tells her teammates via the comms not to say anything to them, because ALAY-NA will hear them.

Eliot tells Sophie to use beta blockers if necessary to keep Cheng calm, while Parker looks for a way into the servers. ALAY-NA feeds Cheng signals via his glasses that Sophie is lying, and Sophie says that she's lying and doesn't find tech that impressive. Sophie riles Cheng, while Parker goes into the bathroom to find Cheng's medication and ALAY-NA talks to her. Breana suggests they hack Cheng rather than his system, and alter his biometric signifiers. using his antihistamines. Then ALAY-NA will mistake him for an intruder, he'll have to shut down the system, and the team can go right in. Eliot has Parker use her graphic to alter Cheng's handprint to further confuse ALAY-NA.

Parker and Sophie go to work, removes his glasses, and give him eye drops to help him "blink less". Cheng figures ALAY-NA is malfunctioning and the house identifies him as an intruder, then puts the house into lockdown. A security guard is called in, and Eliot chokes him out. He and Breana then go in posing as guard and insist on doing a clean sweep of the premises. Cheng confirms that Breana is the person he identified at the station, and figures they're trying to steal his software. He resets ALAY-NA, then tells it to lockdown the house and call the police. He runs out to his car and calls Warwick to tell him they're closing the deal immediately.

Parker duplicates Cheng's biometrics and fools ALAY-NA, with Breana using Cheng's voice from earlier and raising her heartbeat to his. ALAY-NA recognizes her as Cheng and unlocks the house, and Sophie has Harry stall Cheng while Breana erases the root code. Harry approaches Cheng in Arlo and gushes over his game app, 'Dozer Duel'. Meanwhile, the team releases a news alert of Cheng being an international fugitive he meets with Warwick and the RIZ people at the shop. The RIZ representatives say that they're done, and Cheng loses his temper and storms out. ALAY-NA sees Cheng's reflection in a window and notifies the authorities, and Maria knocks Cheng out as he tries to run.

Later, Cheng goes back to his house. The team is waiting for him, and Sophie tells Cheng that everyone's sins have been wiped out except his. He says that he'll change his software back, and Breana tells him that they control Searchlight and ALAY-NA. ALAY-NA speaks up to agree, and Sophie advises him to sign the house over to them rather than face a lawsuit for compromising people's privacy.

Later at the bar, Parker and Eliot vies Libby everything she needs to relocate, with ALAY-NA's help. Breana talks to Harry about his knowledge of 'Dozer Duel', and figures he's a real fan of the game. Harry smugly says that she has no proof, and no one would believe her if she did. Sophie asks Eliot when he's going to see Maria again, and her own life changed when the right person arrested her. Eliot gets a text from Maria, ignores it, and tells Sophie that it isn't like that before walking away.

Breana has made up a list of her mistakes, and Parker tells her that what she did before she joined the team doesn't matter to them. The team tell her that they don't need her to be Hardison, but just the person she is, mistakes and all.

description: Sophie must keep her feelings in check when she discovers that someone has written a memoir of the team, casting himself as Nate â which leads an exiled criminal to kidnap Harry and âFake Nateâ, forcing the Leverage team to pull a heist.
tags: ['impostor', 'expose', 'advance copy of a book', 'reverse image search', 'impersonating an exterminator', 'chauffeured limousine', 'schmuck', 'cellphone hacked', 'tranquilizer dart', 'jammer', 'private jet', 'forensic accountant', 'bouquet', 'some scenes in muted color', 'zafir scarab', 'tied to a chair', 'earpiece', 'reference to claude monet', 'hunting knife', 'boring man', 'helium balloon', 'helium voice', 'robbery']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Sophie runs up to Eliot and Parker, and says that her cover is blown as alarms go off. Fake Nate walks up and tells them that they should keep their heads, and he knows they can because he's the Mastermind.

King Navid looks at a manuscript of 'The Mastermind' and figures that's exactly what he needs, and chuckles in triumph.

At the bar, Sophie prepares to go out for the anniversary of Nate's death, and Parker tries to stop her. Eliot brings Sophie some of her favorite vegan dishes that he made for her, and Sophie tells them to stop cosset her, and insists that she's fine. Harry comes in with Sophie's favorite British drama for movie night, and Sophie says that she's going to go buy clothes to cope. Breana arrives and shows them the manuscript, and the team read the copies. They wonder how someone has all the intel on them, and Eliot complains that he's portrayed as a brute who flips his hair a lot. The manuscript kept popping up the Internet, and Hardison's algorithm kept finding it popping up. The book hasn't been published yet, and Eliot warns that there's enough right to be dangerous.

Sophie is clearly upset about reading the manuscript, and Harry joins her with a drink. She tells him that it's the anniversary of the day she and Nate met, and she talks about how it feels like Nate is back when she reads the manuscript. Sophie points out that she isn't in the book, and apparently she isn't important to the story. Harry figures that Nate didn't feel that way, and Breana tries to track down the author but finds nothing. The publishing company put out a website on the author, but there is booking info about media appearances, and the publishing contract has a kill clause so the author can stop it at any time. Sophie figures that the author isn't Nate, and he's going to pay for that.

The author is preparing to do an appearance at a TV studio, and Eliot and Harry come in as exterminators and claim there's an outbreak of rare dangerous insects. Once everyone leaves, Fake Nate pulls up and Breana is outside to greet him. She brings him in, pretending to be a PA, and Navid comes up and says that he was hoping to have a word with Fake Nate. Breana blows Navid off and goes inside, and manages to get hold of Fake Nate's phone. She clones it and sends him to the studio, and figures Fake Nate is a schmo.

Fake Nate comes in where Eliot and Parker are waiting, and Breana comes in and calls in Sophie, posing as the host Fake Nate sits down with her and recites Nate's words about what the team does. Sophie points out that everyone stole from knows who he is, and Fake Nate says he didn't think of that. Suddenly nervous, Fake Nate says that he knows how to counteract any measures taken against him, and Sophie sarcastically says that he's a mastermind and can handle any situation. Fake Nate vaguely agrees, and the show ends and Breana escorts Fake Nate out. He discovers that he's been hacked out of his own phone, and someone is demanding a million dollars or they'll release all of Fake Nate's emails.

Parker approaches Fake Nate and tells him she's a Russian agent. She says that they need to contact one of his marks, an oligarch, and want Fake Nate to reach out to him while wearing a wire. Fake Nate excuses himself to use the restroom. He runs for the exit, and Eliot grabs him and pretends to be a former mark looking for revenge, but is going to let Fake Nate run for the rest of his life.

Fake Nate runs out, and Harry approaches him and claims he's the publisher's lawyer and it's the publisher's responsibility to protect Fake Nate. Harry suggests that Fake Nate cancel the book's publication, and Fake Nate hugs him in relief. Breana and Sophie are inside watching via a hidden camera, and something scrambles the signal. Navid and his thugs dart Fake Nate and Harry, then load them in a van and drive off. The others come out, and Breana confirms that someone used a high-grade military signal jammer to block the cameras. Breana brings up image of Navid from earlier, and Eliot identifies him as from a Middle Eastern nation, Zafir. They go to the airfield Navid and his mercenaries were heading.

When Fake Nate wakes up, he's in Navid's limo. Navid tells Fake Nate that he's about to steal something for him. They pull up to a private museum in south of France, and Navid explains that he wants Fake Nate to steal Zafir's most treasured artifact: the Zafir Scarab. He admits that the Scarab doesn't belong to him, but his ex-wife Liliana. Navid escorts Fake Nate inside before Liliana can see them, Inside, Navid explains that he and Liliana got divorced, and she got the Scarab in the settlement. He wants it back, and he can't afford the international fallout of having his men shoot the place up. Navid needs a mastermind, and there'll be a party where Fake Nate can blend in. If Fake Nate doesn't get the Scarab by the end of the day Navid will kill Harry and Fake Nate. Fake Nate says that he doesn't know Harry, but Navid figures that Fake Nate is putting on an act.

As Navid walks off, Sophie comes up to Fake Nate and tells him that he's in a fix. Eliot is there as well, and drags Fake Nate out to a food truck. Breana is there, and Fake Nate realizes who they are. Fake Nate admits that he's an accountant for IYS, Nate's insurance company, and was Nate's forensic accountant. The accountants did the behind-the-scenes research, and Nate was the only one who paid them any attention, praising them. Fake Nate admits that he's boring and knows it, but Nate said everyone has a superpower and one day they'd find Fake Nate's. Then Nate left the company, so Fake Nate "borrowed" Nate's life and was fascinating. Parker is in a warehouse vent, and Sophie gives Fake Nate a comm. Breana explains that they tracked Fake Nate's phone to a warehouse, and Parker went there to rescue Harry.

Fake Nate explains that he eventually caught up to Nate after Nate left IYS, and told him all about the crew. Fake Nate got laid off and needed the money, so he published the pieces of the stories he had. He explains that now they have to steal the Scarab, and Sophie tells him that they're getting Harry back and going home.

Parker sneaks into the warehouse and frees Harry. Breana checks and confirms that Navid was overthrown by democratic rebels. The only asset that wasn't seized was the Scarab, because it wasn't his. If Navid sells the Scarab, he can afford mercenary teams to take Zafir back. If they don't steal the Scarab, Navid will take it and reclaim his throne, and Sophie tells Parker to leave Harry where he is. Breana warns that the security around the Scarab is impenetrable, while Parker leaves her taser with Harry and leaves. Fake Nate wonders how they steal the Scarab, and everyone looks to him as "the Mastermind".

The party begins, and Sophie and Fake Nate watch from a distance and Sophie tells Fake Nate that they need him seen taking part in the con. Eliot goes in and Breana locates a room in the basement that is probably the security control room. She spots a hidden door going to it, and Sophie will go down and distract the guards, Eliot will watch the perimeter, and Parker will penetrate the pressurized case and steal the Scarab. Fake Nate remembers that IYS insures the Scarab, boring Breana to sleep. Sophie tells him that it's best that he stick as close as possible to his true self, and he figures that Sophie new to the crew. She says that she was Nate's wife, and it never came up in Fake Nate's conversations with Nate. Sophie approaches Liliana and claims she's a duchess, and introduces Fake Nate as her insurance agent, there to inspect the security.

In the warehouse, Harry drops the taser, warning his guard, Drago. Harry covers it, claiming he was trying to get some circulation in his limbs, and points out Navid has no money to pay his mercenaries.

Parker goes in posing as the decorator and takes some helium-filled balloons decorating the party into the room with the case. She tell Eliot that they need to clear out the room, and Eliot asks Liliana to speak to her in private. Intrigued, Liliana follows him into the nearby greenhouse, and he says that he's agent assigned to keep track of Navid. Eliot seduces Liliana, saying he was told to let Navid kill her but he's disobeying orders. He knocks out one of her bodyguards as the man approaches them, claims the man was one of Navid's killers, and tells Liliana that she should get the guests in one concentrated area so no one will try to kill her. Eliot tells Liliana that he'll be there if she needs him and walks away, and she does as Eliot said.

The guests gather in one spot outside, and Fake Nate tells Sophie that he doesn't know why Nate never mentioned her. Sophie tells him to stop, and she doesn't need him to feel sorry for her. She needs him to realize how much pain he's caused, and how little he really knew Nate, and then she needs him to stand watch, cancel his books so no one else gets hurts, and then disappear. Eliot arrives, and then Liliana arrives and pulls Sophie and Eliot over to the others.

Harry continues undermining Drago's confidence in Navid's ability to pay, and Drago says that they did a background check and confirmed Navid has $10 million. Harry offers to set Drago up with an IRA account.

Sophie tells Fake Nate over the coms that he'll have to distract the guards. He admits that he has no ability and bores people to sleep, and then he enters the security room, claims that he's with IYS, talks about the security specs, and bores the techs to sleep, while Breana helps by raising the room's temperature. Parker climbs across the sprinkler pipes which don't have security, overloads the sensor with helium from the balloon she's holding, and removes the Scarab.

Parker drops the balloon and sets off the alarm, waking up the techs in the security room. They spot Parker on the monitors and head to the room, and Sophie tells Fake Nate to leave. Eliot assures Liliana that the police are on the way, and walks off even though Liliana wants to kiss him. Parker joins up with Sophie and Eliot and shows them the Scarab, while Fake Nate gets out only to find Navid and his men waiting for him. They drive him away, and the team hears it all over the comms.

The team drives after Navid's limo, and Sophie has Fake Nate tell Navid that the Scarab will "meet them" at the warehouse, and they'll trade the Scarab for Harry. Sophie figures that they'll do what Nate would have done: walk directly into the fire

Navid and his men bring Fake Nate into the warehouse, and Drago brings Harry along. Sophie comes in and says that she's with Fake Nate, and Fake Nate says that Sophie is his co-mastermind and that's why she's not in the book. He figures that's why Nate never told her secrets and tells Navid as much. Sophie says that she has the Scarab and Navid takes it and tells Drago to kill them. Harry tells Drago that they have a bond, and Sophie tells Navid that it's the wrong form. Fake Nate takes the hint from their earlier conversation and starts talking about how Liliana used the wrong form because the Scarab is a fake. He breaks it on the floor, and Sophie adds that Liliana probably sold off the original years ago to fund her lifestyle.

Navid says that he's paid off the local authorities, and Sophie points out that some of Liliana's guests were with Interpol, which will be there in no time. Drago demands his money before killing anyone, and Navid discovers that there's no money in his Swiss bank account because Harry got the account number from Drago earlier, which Breana intercepted and drained the money. Sophie leaves with Harry and Fake Nate, while the mercenaries express their displeasure to Navid.

Back at the bar, the team confirms that Navid chose to be arrested rather than be killed by his own mercenaries. Some of the other crews want to use Fake Nate's "superpower". Sophie asks Fake Nate to sign her copy of the manuscript, and Fake Nate admits that he didn't know the book would hurt so many people, including Sophie. Sophie says that taking down Navid made up for anything Fake Nate did. and he signs it with his real name: Milton Friedlander. Sophie says that thanks to Milton, she got to pull one last job with Nate.

description: The Leverage team's holiday good deed goes awry when their attempt to give a small-town librarian the spy-thriller adventure of a lifetime is interrupted by a shadowy spy organization.
tags: ['checking a book out of library', 'reference to arthur conan doyle', 'reference to robert louis stevenson', 'reference to elwyn brooks white', 'stage four cancer', 'gateway 2000 personal computer', 'feigning injury', 'car theft', 'breaking a car window', 'hot wiring a car', 'thumb drive', 'man wears an eye patch', 'character says thank you for your service', 'fistfight', 'tasered', 'stealing a motorcycle', 'injection in arm', 'fictional operation kansas', 'post traumatic stress disorder', 'floppy disk', 'church', 'spy', 'shot in the chest', "camera shot of a woman's feet in high heels", 'faked death', 'reference to james clavell', 'nintendo', 'christmas present']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In Kenner, LA, a girl, Emma is getting books at the local library. The librarian, Mr. Blanche, gives her one more book as a recommendation. Once Emma leaves, a man looking on, Maurice, comments on Blanche helping the girl and how Blanche gave him a book to read when he was Emma's age. Blanche has a heart attack and collapses, and Maurice goes to his side and have someone call 911.

At the bar, Harry is talking to his daughter Nicki on the phone as he comes in. As he hangs up the call, Sophie comes up behind Harry and they talk about the holidays with their loved ones gone are bad for them. They join the others having Christmas dinner, and someone knocks at the door. Eliot answers it, and finds Maurice there. Maurice says that he needs the team's help, and when they let him, Maurice explains how Blanche gave him refuge when he was a fifth-grader being chased by bullies. Tghen he says that Blanche has stage-four cancer and refuses to get treatment, and is having episodes with his heart. Sophie wonders how they can help, and Maurice explains that he wants them to make Blanche feel like a hero like the ones in his books, for one day.

Once Maurice leaves, Sophie tells the others that what Maurice is asking isn't what they do. Parker figures that lying to people during Christmas is what the holiday is about, and the others agree. Sophie finally gives in and says they have to treat Blanche like any other mark.

Later at the library, Breana and Eliot run surveillance on and Breana admires the library's "antique" computers. She gets a list of every book Blanche has checked out over the years and sends the list to the others at the bar. Meanwhile, a local tries to take out a homeless person and Blanche objects. When the local threatens to get violence, Eliot grabs his hand and tells him to leave. Once the local leaves, Blanche asks Eliot what he can do for him. Eliot leaves with Breana and a book, and figures they should give Blanche a spy adventure. Someone is running surveillance on Eliot.

Back at the bar, the team rehearses the parts in their spy drama, written by Sophie. Breana figures they need a safe word, and Sophie leaves it up to Eliot. Eliot goes back to the library pretending to be shot and tells Blanche that he needs his help. Blanche threatens to call the police, and Eliot tells Blanche that he's a spy, but was compromised, needs to get a thumb drive to his case worker, and asks Blanche to help him. Blanche agrees and Eliot takes the librarian out to his car, Blanche steals a nearby car because Eliot's enemies will know his car. At the bar, Breana thanks Sophie for doing it for them, and Sophie says that she's doing it for Nate, who would have hated it. She figures they all need a nudge out of their comfort zone.

Eliot says that he needs to send an encrypted message to his case officer, and needs to find a hacker on the dark web. He gives Blanche his phone with the GPS location, and Blanche tosses it out the window so no one can trace the phone. Blanche says that he learned how to hotwire a car from his misspent teen years, and says that it's the most alive he's felt in years. They go to a planetarium where Parker pretends to be a hacker, because Sophie needs Breana to be the real hacker. Blanche figures they should check to see if the drive has been wiped, and Breana realizes there's nothing on it except Eliot's secret chili recipe. Breana sends Parker the real file.

Blanche and Eliot go to the address on the drive, which is a wine & beer garden, to make the drop. Breana and Parker are in a food truck nearby monitoring the situation, and Parker serves cocoa. Sophie reviews the script for the "big action scene", complete with three of Eliot's soldier buddies as stuntmen. Harry is wearing an eyepatch and a fake mustache, and goes in to get the drive. Eliot gives Harry the drive, and Blanche notices the customers acting suspicious and punches Harry and unconscious, then tells Eliot that it's a setup. Sophie tells Eliot over the comms that Blanche is hooked and Eliot should go with it. Eliot does, and the stuntmen come in. Blanche does surprisingly well, but one of them tasers Eliot. The other stuntmen knock down Blanche and leave with Eliot.

Blanche recovers and steals a motorbike, and goes after the "stuntmen". Meanwhile, Parker and Breana realize the "stuntmen" aren't the men Eliot brought in, and go back to the bar to tell Sophie and Harry. They got the drop on Eliot's team, knocked them out and tied them up in their own van. Parker brings in Blanche's bag and discovers there's spy equipment in it, and they realize Blanche is actually a spy.

The RIZ thugs take Eliot to a secret lair where Bligh is waiting. She refuses to say who she's working for, has decrypted the drive, and knows it's not the real Ledger. She compliments Eliot on finding Copperhead and reactivating him, and asks where the real Ledger is. Eliot plays along, saying the Ledger is In his truck, and Bligh has one of her men inject Eliot with a psychotropic to get him to tell the truth.

Breana checks the DoD database and determine Blanche used to be a black-bag op, and 30 years ago he vanished... just when he became a librarian. Blanche comes in, aiming a gun at the team, and tells them that they should tell him who they are and what's going on.

Bligh tells Eliot that when Copperhead retired, he took a cache of information with him, about people who are now leaders of nations and want the information found. Nobody thought Copperhead was still alive until the team went after him, and people saw Blanche's picture. Bligh thought the team was running a con to get the Ledger, and wants to know where Copperhead is. Eliot says that he doesn't know and wouldn't talk if he did, and Bligh explains that the drug he was given will bombard him with his most traumatic memories. When she mentions the code name of an operation Eliot was a part of, he has PTAS.

The team tell Blanche what they were doing, and Harry points out that Eliot is missing. Blanche figures the men that attacked him were private security, but doesn't know the major players in the present. Sophie figures that it's RIZ, and Harry suggests Breana check the Flanders group, the shell corporation Breana confirms that they have office space in an office park outside of town. Blanche has slipped away, and Sophie realizes where he's heading. She refuses to let Blanche die of stage-four cancer on a mission they guilted him into, and Sophie tells Harry to stay there if Blanche comes back.

Bligh continues to taunt Eliot about how he avoids seeing his father, and says that she'll make the PTSD stop if he gives her Copperhead. Eliot recites his chili recipe, and Bligh tells her man to give Eliot another dose. Once Bligh leaves, Eliot breaks the chair he's tied to and takes out the RIZ guard, then leaves.

Outside in the truck, Breana confirms that the loading dock is the only way in. She remote-disables the camera on the dock, but warns that it will take time. They back the truck in instead, to block the camera, and Parker climbs onto the roof. Meanwhile, Blanche finds Eliot after taking out the remaining guards and takes him out. Parker joins them and gets them out the way she came in, and they take Eliot back to the bar and flushes his system with saline to get the psychotropic out. Eliot figures Bligh will keep coming until she gets the Ledger, and Blanche says the Ledger no longer exists because it got destroyed on his last op. Nobody would believe that, so Blanche ran, and hid as a small town librarian. Now the people Blanche knows will never be safe, and Sophie suggests they give RIZ a fake Ledger. Breana figures she can fake a dummy floppy disk to convince RIZ the data broke down over time. Harry says he can arrange the hand off, and he has way of getting into his old firm's holiday party. Parker has gotten a tuxedo for Harry, and not very convincingly claims that she bought it.

Harry and Sophie go to the party at a private club, and Sophie points out that he's still keeping secrets from the team. Blight comes over and introduces herself, invites Sophie to come to her with the signed auction, and tells Harry to stay behind. As they go, Bligh says she's becoming annoyed with the team's interference. She tells Sophie that if the team gives her Copperhead, she's let the team go. Sophie says that she'll giver Blight the Ledger, if Blight lets Copperhead go. If Blight refuses, Sophie will sell the Ledger to Blight's biggest competitor, and walks away

Harry meets one of his former partners, John Safer, at a church. Safer doesn't believe that Harry is seeking redemption, and figures the team doesn't know about Harry's crooked past. Harry admits the choices he made cost him his marriage and his daughter, and neither one of them have to keep making bad choices. Safer admits that sent the invitation to Harry, and has Harry's office waiting for him as he leaves.

Eliot and Blanche meet at the library, as Breana makes the fake disk out in the foot truck, and Blanche admits that he knows about "Operation: Kansas" that Blight was torturing Eliot with earlier. He figures it isn't easy for Eliot to keep it down, and Eliot wonders why Blanche isn't seeking treatment for his cancer. Blanche says that isn't how he wants to go out, and Eliot figures that Blanche sounds like his father, and says that he hasn't spoken to him since he was 18. He feels like he's waited too long, and Blanche sympathizes as the disk finishes. The power goes out, The three RIZ men go into the library, gun drawn, and Breana sets off the squibs in the books. Their opponents return fire, and one man goes to turn on the lights. Harry takes him out with a cattle prod, and Eliot attacks another with a library cart. Blanche takes on another, who knocks Blanche out, and Eliot fights the third and final man. One man tries to shoot Eliot, and Blanche jumps in the way and takes the bullet meant for Eliot. The shooter uses a sonic stunner on Eliot, also hitting the others the backlash. He gets the floppy from Blanche and leaves.

Eliot goes to Blanche, administers CPS, and yells for help.

The next day, Bligh and two of her men grab the shooter, and Bligh point out that the disk data is corrupted and Blanche is worth nothing to her dead. and he's terminated... but it's a business and she isn't going kill him. If he violates his NDA, she'll expose his past.

At the library, Breana confirms that there's no bugs, and Blanche reveals that he was wearing a blood pack, and Parker secretly gave the RIA men blanks in their clips, and they all used the same type of guns. Harry has found the book that Blanche checked out every year, that he hid the Ledger desk in. .Eliot assures Blanche that he saved the lives of everyone that came into the library, and changed others. He gives Blanche the keys to the red Ferrari he was going to use in the con, so Blanche doesn't have to hotwire it. Blanche eagerly takes the keys and gives Eliot the disk, but first Blanche tells Eliot not to wait.

That night at the bar, Sophie hands out gifts. She tells Harry to keep trying to bond with his daughter, and Hardison sends a text to Parker saying he sent Maurice. Breana says that the information on Blanche's disk was unreadable, while Eliot goes to his family holiday party and gets a text from his sibling that his father isn't coming. Disappointed, Eliot goes back to the bar. drinking the alcohol he was going to give his father as a gift.

description: The Leverage team explores the failing memory of a legendary grifter to try and find her greatest score before her abusive elder guardian gets his hands on it and takes over her life.
tags: ['pickpocket', 'reference to theodore roosevelt', 'framed pistol', 'dementia', 'london england', 'year 1976', 'grifter', 'personal possession', 'gun pointed at face', 'gold plated pistol', 'wall safe', 'playing pool', 'car keys', 'mercedes', 'woman kisses a woman', 'painted portrait', 'thunderstorm', 'strangled', 'shot point blank', 'character says life is a journey', 'reference to harry houdini', 'switch', 'power of attorney', 'mother and daughter reunited', 'lesbian couple']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Phil Hinkley barges into the house of Stella Voleur and starts taking her things, and Stella wonders why Phil is selling her things. He says that Stella is getting forgetful in her old age and that's why he hired Antonio Alvarez, a nurse, for her, and part of what he's selling will cover Antonio's fee. Stella insists that she's fine by herself, but Phil reminds her that judge awarded him control of her care and her possessions. When Stella says that Phil is a stranger to her and robbing her blind, Phil acts offended and says her memory lapses are part of her problem. He has Antonio give Stella her meds, and she reluctantly tells them. Meanwhile, Phil tells her that she won't have to be confused in her big house much longer, because he's going to sell it and move her to a facility by the end of the week. Once Phil and Antonio walk away, Stella spits out the med and throws it away.

Sophie pulls up to Stella's house in a food truck, with Breana with her. Breana complains about having to do community service, and Sophie points out that Breana got caught stealing a watch from a councilman's brother, and Harry managed to get the charges reduced. Breana takes food up to Stella's front door and rings the bell, and Stella comes out. Stella pickpockets Breana's phone, and Sophie sees her doing so. They go inside, and Sophie follows them inside and tells Breana to check her pocket.

They go over to Stella, who is calling someone on the phone. She claims that she's a frail old lady and asks for a glass of water, and Breana goes to get it after taking her phone back. Sophie congratulates Stella on her style and asks what her name is, and the two of them bond over changing their identities so often. Breana goes through Stella's mail and announces her name, and Sophie asks Stella who she was trying to call. Stella says that she was calling for help because her legal guardian is stealing her home and her things. She explains that the court assigned Phil her legal guardian, and he took her phone and won't let her call anyone. Sophie says that they'll help her and realizes that Stella has things in her collection that she tries to get, but was beaten to them by "The Jackal". When Breana wonders who Stella is, Sophie tells her that Stella is the greatest grifter who ever lived. Stella says that she's meant to be there, and she fell in love with a mark. After a moment, Stella forgets who they are,

Antonio comes in and objects to the newcomers' presence, and threatens to call the cops. Sophie whispers to Stella that they'll be back, and leaves with Breana. They go back to the bar and Sophie tells the team about the Jackal, and was her inspiration. Sophie wonders why Stella is stuck in a house instead of living it up in the south of France. Eliot has checked with his contact in the police, who found Stella wandering outside confused because she has early-stage Alzheimer's. Breana has researched Phil, and confirmed that he gets appointed a guardian to senior citizens and then robs them, and dumps them in a cheap nursing home. Harry figures they need a durable power of attorney and then move her out of the house, but Sophie points out that Stella said she was "meant" to be in the house and wonders why. Breana suggests that Stella is waiting for someone, and Sophie tells Harry to get the guardianship papers and find out more about Phil. Sophie will speak to Stella and get more of her story.

Stella is at home watching TV with Antonio keeping an eye on her. Sophie comes in posing as Stella's new nurse, and Stella plays along while Sophie syncs Antonio's phone with Breana's computer. He calls Phil, and Breana intercepts the call and simulates Phil's voice. Eliot does the talking, and Antonio threatens to sue for breach of contract. Breana runs a background check on Antonio and confirms he has 87 unpaid parking tickets. Eliot threatens to tell the police about the tickets and hangs up, and a disgusted Antonio leaves.

Once Antonio leaves, Sophie discovers that Stella has slipped out. The team comes out and Breana goes into the house while the others search the neighborhood for Stella. Sophie figures Stella is going for coffee, and Breana finds the nearest coffee shop. Stella comes back in with a cup of coffee, and asks what Sophie's theatrics were about. They tells her that they're going to get Stella free from Phil, and Stella says that she has a durable power of attorney with the greatest score. She refuses to get it, and finally admits that she can't remember where she put it. Someone she loved signed the POA, but she can't remember them, either. All she knows is that they were happy there, and says she moved there because she was on a job nearby, and it's the same job where she fell in love with the mark. Breana takes Stella up to her bedroom.

When the others arrive, Sophie points out that the Jackal was more into the con than the coin, and never kept what she stole. The only stolen object that hasn't resurfaced is the 1902 Turlington Pistol, solid gold and made for Teddy Roosevelt. The gun isn't in the house and it hasn't gone on the black market. Eliot figures Phil still has it but doesn't know what he's got, and Harry has confirmed Phil has to file his weekly report with the court in an hour. Sophie and Breana will stay and try to get Stella to remember, while the others will use Phil to find the gun and the POA, and maybe find the person who signed the POA.

At the courthouse, Harry and Parker see Phil meet with Judge Linus Clark, who appointed Phil Stella's guardian. All of Phil's wards came from Clark and Clark is Phil's business partner. Parker starts yelling about the lousy food, and Phil comes over. Harry tells him that Parker is his sister and he's her guardian, and she's not "stable". The former lawyer says that Parker inherited half of their parents' estate, and Phil offers to help.

At Stella's house, Sophie laments to Breana that Stella will just fade away. She points out that Breana was good with Stella earlier, and figures Breana has had experience. Breana says that her grandmother had Alzheimer's, and Sophie tells Breana that she should take the lead on the job. Breana agrees and takes coffee to Stella, and says that she enjoyed a cup with "Joe". She talks about 1976 London and everyone was talking about a vault heist of $1 million in gold coins. Stella learned that a gangster named Earl pulled the job, and he spent most of his time in a pub. She went there, slipped into Earl's office, and found his safe.

Stella needed time to find the combination, so she got a job at the pub as a waitress. Stella loses his memories, and then goes to her bed. Breana tells Sophie that the bar owner and Earl's wife, Josephine, was the "Joe" that Stella fell in love with, and Josephine the POA.

Later at the bar, Breana packs some furniture for Parker and runs a background check on Clark. Phil's wards give "donations" to Clark's election campaign, and Sophie figures that they have to take Phil and Clark down, and recover the Pistol, before Phil puts Stella in a home. Harry realizes that Breana is giving Parker his stuff, and Breana and Sophie go back to Stella's house.

Parker and Eliot break into the warehouse where Phil has put "Parker's stuff" along with everything else he's taken. They search for the Pistol.

Sophie and Breana arrive at Stella' house, and find her looking wistfully at a photo of her and Josephine. They get to talking about the London job, and Earl and his men come in and he tells his wife that he won the Pistol in a card game. He points the Pistol at Josephine, then puts it down and laughs at the "joke". He has his wife take the Pistol up to his office, and Stella goes with her to put the "big bills" from the register in the safe. Josephine opens the safe and Stella uses a mirror in the box to see two of the four numbers in the combination. Stella says that Earl should treat Josephine with more respect, and Josephine says she doesn't care as long as Earl lets her run the pub the way she wants.

Stella stays close to Josephine in the pub, and sees Josephine glares at Earl as he flirts with another woman. The two women go out to lunch the next day, and Josephine picks a museum for them to go to. She tells Stella that she used to be an art student, but then she met Earl who chatted her up. They both about how they chase "the next big score" when all they want is someone to sit with. Josephine admits that it's been a long time since she had a friend, and Stella says that she's not used to people being nice for no reason.

Despite slowly becoming more than friends with Josephine, Stella doesn't want Josephine to know who she really is. She slowly works to get the last two numbers on the safe, and Earl goes to France with his men to sell a shipment. Stella asks Josephine what Earl is selling, and sees a bruise on Josephine's face. It isn't the first one Stella has seen, and shows Josephine Earl's car keys that she pickpocketed. They go for a spin, pull over, and kiss. They go back to the pub and Josephine shows Stella the first painting she's painted in years. It's a portrait of Stella, and Stella tells Jo that it's perfect, and so is Jo.

Later, a beaten Jo tells Stella that Earl said they had to go to Italy to lay low. Jo told her husband that she wanted to stay there with Stella, so Stella has to go before Earl arrives, and she'll go with him. Stella says they should go somewhere, and Jo writes down the safe combination and tells Stella to get the money so they can run away using it, and she'll meet her in the car. Stella figures that if she took the coins, Earl would hunt them and Jo would know she was a thief, so she walked away with nothing but the Pistol. They drove away ahead of Earl, came to New Orleans, and settled down. Then they discovered that Jo was pregnant with Earl's child, became a family of three, and eventually got married. The couple signed POAs and Earl tracked them down when they filed the paperwork.

Stella abruptly ends her story, refusing to talk about it further. She tells Sophie and Breana to get out, and they go back to the bar and tell Harry what happened. Harry figures they need to come up with a reason for Stella to want to help them. Parker and Eliot come in and say they didn't find the Pistol, and Parker saw Phil keep a gold watch for himself even though he told Clark he'd give it to him.

The next day, Sophie goes back to the house and finds Breana sitting with Stella on the porch. Sophie apologies for pushing Stella, and says they think they know how to get the Pistol back and get rid of Phil for good. However, they need the Jackal to do one last job.

At the courthouse, Stella approaches Phil and tells him to walk with her. Eliot poses as a food delivery man and brings a sandwich Clark didn't order to Clark, takes his cell phone, and puts a tap on it. Meanwhile, Stella offers to split the Pistol's sale with Phil. Clark overhears them talking, while Sophie comes over as Stella's nurse and leads Stella off. The judge confronts Phil and says that Phil didn't show him the Pistol, and wants his cut of the gun. If Phil doesn't pay him 90%, their deal is off.

Sophie takes Stella to the bar, and Parker has listened in on Clark's phone and learned they're going to sell the Pistol that night. All they have to do is capture the sale on camera and then Eliot does his job. Breana says that the fence Jean-Pierre is paranoid, and they won't have time to set up a camera. Eliot tells Sophie that if their plan doesn't work, she'll have to find Jo and Sophie says that she'll try.

Once the others leave, Stella tells Sophie that if she finds the POA, she'll find Jo. Sophie tells Stella that it could be her second chance, and asks what happened when Earl showed up.

In the past, Earl pours drinks and calls Stella a "degenerate". Stella asks him what he wants, and Earl says that he wants the Pistol and his money. Jo comes in and says that no one stole anything, and Earl says that he asked around and learned Stella is a thief, the Jackal, and she set Jo up. Earl tells them that they have until midnight to get his money and his gun, says that otherwise he'll take their daughter, and leaves.

Breana joins Sophie and Stella, and Stella explains that Earl had all the power.

In the past, Jo asks Stella why she didn't tell her the truth. Stella says that she thought Jo would hate her, and Jo asks if any of it was real. When Stella points out that they've never cracked despite all they've been through, Jo wonders what they do. Stella takes the Pistol and tells Jo that she'll finish it alone. Jo leaves with their daughter, and Stella tells Jo that she'll find them later. Come midnight, Earl returns and Stella tells him that she never got into the safe and took his coins. He says that the coins were in a hidden compartment in the car's trunk, and Stella tells him that they dumped the car eight years ago. Stella tells him to just take the Pistol, but Earl starts strangling Stella. Stella grabs the discarded Pistol and shoots Earl dead.

In the present, Stella tells Sophie that was the last night she saw Jo. Sophie asks Stella if she would have left with Jo if she knew it was going to end, and Stella realizes that Sophie lost someone. She says that she had some of her greatest adventures after Jo, and live is a journey. Harry comes in and says that Phil and Clark have gone to the warehouse.

At the warehouse, Phil shows Clark the Pistol. Stella comes in, says that the Pistol is hers, and takes it. Sophie comes in as the nurse and tells Stella that she's having one of her "turns", and Phil takes the Pistol's case but discovers the Pistol is no longer inside it. Clark takes the Pistol from Sophie's bag and gives it to Phil. As Sophie and Stella leave, Jean-Pierre and his bodyguard come in. Jean-Pierre examines the Pistol and points out that it's a fake, and the police pull up outside and tell Phil and Clark to surrender. The fence admits he called in the police, after Parker asked him to and offered him a "personal favor". Sophie and Stella switch the real Pistol for a fake. The police take Phil and Linus away, while Stella and Sophie watch. Sophie is thrilled to have pulled off a job with the Jackal. Jean-Pierre comes out and confirms there's no POA in the case.

Back at Stella's house, Stella tells Sophie that she'll need a proper home no matter what. Sophie suggests Stella could go live with Jo, and Sophie figures that Stella isn't telling her the truth about what happened after Earl died. Stella says that Jo came back and shot Earl, and Stella kept the gun in case she ever needed to take the blame. The older woman doesn't remember what she did with Earl's body, and she didn't want to burden Jo and her daughter with her presence. Sophie realizes that the POA is hidden in Jo's painting of Stella,

That night at the bar, Harry tells Stella and Sophie that Stella's daughter didn't hesitate to take over the POA. Stella worries about her seeing her daughter and what she'll think of Stella, and Sophie says that Nate was her greatest score and she'd give anything for one more day with him... and now Stella has that chance with her daughter. Stella thanks Sophie for everything and they go to see Jo and their daughter.

As the family hugs, Harry asks Sophie what she's thinking. She says that she's wondering what her next adventure will be, and Harry takes Sophie to get some coffee. The two of them walk off together arm in arm.

description: An old friend visits, sparking a self-doubting Harry to uncover an unlikely client on the links at his exclusive golf club.
tags: ['woman slaps a woman', 'back hand slap', 'golf practice', 'changing password', 'bankroll', 'throwing darts', 'illegal immigrant', 'human trafficking', 'golf hustler', 'deliberately annoying', 'maced', 'hit with a golf ball', 'hit in the groin']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Carl Bishop, the owner of a nail salon, goes in and complains to the immigrant workers about how they're taking too long and not making enough money. His assistant Mai translates, and he tells them to focus on the nails rather than the customers. Mai slaps one of them on Carl's orders, and he threatens to send them back to Vietnam. He tells them they don't get any calls home to their family unless they improve, and Mai collects their phones. Carl's supplier, Frank Dupree, notices that one woman's son, Bao, is missing.
