Carl asks Bao's mother where Bao is, and she glances outside.

Going outside, Carl finds Bao in the back alley using his clubs and making good shots. Carl tells Bao to go again, and Bao lands another shot. The owner tells Bao that he's been holding out on him, and offers to "introduce" Bao to the American Dream.

At the bar, the team returns from a successful job and a depressed Harry pours himself a drink. The others make sure to congratulate him on his part, and he tells Sophie that he almost screwed up his job. Hurly comes in and greets Harry as a disgraced former lawyer. He cheerfully greets the others, who are glad to see him. Eliot says that Hardison drug Breana off to a code camp, and Parker tells Harry that Hurley works on their crews all over the world. Hurley sways that he's on a stopover and wanted to play golf with Eliot.

Sophie remembers that Harry is a member of a golf club, and Harry offers to get Eliot and Hurley in as his guests. They go to the club and Harry suggests they bet on winning the holes. Hurley is will, but Eliot tries to cut Harry off. Hurley admits that he's in recovery and shouldn't be gambling, and they tee off. Harry loses his ball in the weeds, and while looking for it spots Carl playing at the next hole. He misses his shot and loses the game, and convinces his opponent to play the next game double or nothing. Carl then gets a call from Frank, saying he's gotten Carl's delivery and wants the cash up front. Carl agrees and Harry overhears the conversation. Once the call is over, Carl goes over to his caddy Bao and tells him no mistakes or Bao will pay.

Once Carl leaves, Harry goes over to Bao and introduces himself, and claims he and Carl are old friends. Bao excuses himself, and Harry goes back to Eliot and Hurley and tells them what happened. They figure Bao is a ringer, and Carl deliberately lost and will convince his opponent to let Bao play in in his place when Carl pretends to have thrown his back out. Harry figures Bao is scared and needs their help, and Hurley and Harry both figure Carl is up to something. Eliot is on his day off and would rather play golf. Harry confirms Carl's lawyer is Rick Saffron, who's legit, and Harry tells Hurley that he'll break into Saffron's office and figure out what's going on, and then find the evidence to set Bao free from Carl. Hurley figures the "golf con" is on, much to Eliot's disgust.

Later back at the clubhouse, Hurley confirms that Carl is in the bar with his opponent and mark, Travis Pomaville, Hurley uses reverse psychology to convince Eliot to help, and Eliot says that he'll bring Hurley in as his ringer when Carl brings Bao in. Eliot poses as a rich drunk to get Carl's attention, and tells Hurley to get him the cash.

Harry goes to Saffron's office, and worries over the comms to Eliot that he's in over his head. Eliot tells him that he called the job and has to see it through, and goes to flirt with a cashier. Harry uses Parker's lessons to break into Saffron's office. Meanwhile, Eliot convinces the cashier, Jennifer, to tell him when Carl's next tee time is. He gets the name of who he's pretending to be, Travis, while Hurley poses as a waiter and lifts a guest's money clip.

Harry gets into Saffron's office, works out the lawyer's computer password, fails, and finally calls Saffron at his home, poses as IT, and gets Saffron to tell him his password. Harry confirms Saffron has nothing on Carl in the firm's main servers, so it must be bad. Sarah Nichols comes into Saffron's office and mistakes Harry for Saffron, and Harry plays along. The woman introduces herself as the new associate and tests her law knowledge. Harry then convinces Sarah to use her keycard to let him into the file room so he can check Carl's old files, and talks about how the firm's clients are all crooked. Sarah says that a lawyer in her hometown took her case pro bono against a crooked realtor and saved her dog when it was falsely accused, and Harry says that Sarah reminds him of his daughter.

Finding Carl's files, Harry takes the box, thanks Sarah for her help, and leaves. Suspicious, she has a friend send her a photo of all the firm's lawyers from a wedding the previous year. Meanwhile, Harry goes back to Saffron's office and goes through the records, and finds out he's using his business including the nail salons to launder money. He tells Eliot, who offers backup. Harry notices Sarah outside in the hallway, while Hurley comes over and shows Eliot the money's he's stolen.

Travis is nearby having a drink with Carl, and gets a call from Sophie posing as his doctor. She tells him that his colonoscopy results aren't positive and then puts him on hold. Travis wanders off while waiting, and Eliot hooks Carl into playing a game of golf with him. Carl figures that Eliot would beat him and challenges him to darts, and Eliot accepts.

Outside, Hurley "accidentally" bumps into Travis and commends that Travis looks pale. Hurley then goes over to where Bao is inspecting Carl's clubs, and Bao talks about his mother back in Vietnam couldn't afford clubs for him so he got some from lost-and-found. Hurley tells Bao that he can help him and Bao quickly excuses himself to find Carl.

Harry takes Sarah to the Carl's salon for a "spa day" and says he's going around the back to make a phone call. Sarah draws her mace spray on Harry and demands to know who he really is, and he tells Sarah his real name and he's trying to stop Carl's deal, and figures the police won't help if he goes to them. She wonders what kind of lawyer Larry was, and Harry says that he was a good lawyer until bad clients chipped away at him, and Sarah shouldn't let that happen to her. He asks Sarah to help him, and Sarah asks Harry to tell him everything he knows.

Carl and Eliot play darts and Eliot wins, and Carl figures he's a hustler. Eliot says that he's an investor who likes to spend money, and gives Carl his (fake) business card. After Eliot leaves, Carl checks his fake name on his phone Internet and finds that Eliot is an investor that burned through his daddy's money. Carl goes out and Bao tells him that he just saw Travis leave. Eliot and his "caddy" Hurley pull up in a golf cart, and Carl suggests that they play for money.

Harry and Sarah break into the salon's storage room where there's a safe, and they figure Carl's laundered money is in the safe. Bao's mother Tien comes out to throw the garbage in the dumpster, here's a passing police siren, and quickly ducks back inside. The lawyers figure Tien is undocumented, and Carl has her documents in the safe... and he's a human trafficker. Harry calls Sophie and tells her. She's posing as a mourning widow, and Sophie tells Harry to make a plan and trust himself... and play it by ear when things go off the rails. Sophie signs off to distract a padre while Parker breaks in.

Harry calls Eliot and tells him that if they're going to bring Carl down, they need Bao on their side. Eliot has Hurley tell Bao that Tien saw Bao play and win golf, and brought him with her to the U.S. hoping his skills could get him a scholarship. Bao says that if he doesn't win for Carl, Carl will send Tien away and never see her again. Hurley says that they can set Bao and Tien both free, but they need Bao's help. Bao says that he can't risk it and walks away.

The golf game begins and Carl says that his business is human capital, and it's never going away. Eliot makes a bad shot and Carl laughs, and Eliot admits to Hurley that the bad shot wasn't intentional, and he hasn't played for a while. Hurley warns that if Eliot doesn't start winning, Carl might not bring in Bao and Eliot tells Hurley that he's got it.

In his care, Harry tells Sarah to go in, pretend to be a customer, and make a distraction while he breaks in the back and empty the safe. Sarah wonders what happens to Carl, who is just a link in the chain. Harry admits that it's imperfect justice, but it's all they have to work with. Sarah figures that it's not justice at all, but it's all they have to work with.

Carl finishes a call to Frank, and Hurley tells Bao that his teammate is at the salon and going to get Tien's and the others' passports. Bao tells Hurley to leave him alone, and Hurley tells Eliot that he's got it. Eliot messes up his next shot.

Sarah tells Harry that she can't do it, and Harry repeats what Sophie told him earlier about humans being hardwired to trust. Encouraged, Sarah goes in.

Hurley tells Eliot that they're back in business if Eliot can birdy the next three shots, but Eliot isn't convinced. Figuring that Eliot thrives on chaos, Hurley insults Eliot's chili and posts a photo of him online cooking and wearing an apron. Eliot loses his temper and his game improves, He continues tormenting Eliot and Eliot keeps making his shots.

In the salon, Sarah demands to speak to a supervisor. Mai comes out and Sarah claims that someone stole her watch.

Carl fake-throws his back out and suggests Bao play for him. Eliot agrees if Hurley can play for him and they double the stakes, and Carl agrees. Hurley panics at the thoughts of gambling, and starts cracking.

Harry breaks into the safe, fails, and calls Eliot. Eliot is busy with Hurley, so Harry calls Parker. She's in the middle of her job, but he didn't bring a drill with him. After Parker signs up, Harry looks for a drill or a bomb.

Bao sinks the putt, and Eliot tells him that the Hurley he knows is only addicted to wiping the smile off of Carl's face. Hurley makes the shot, and Carl admits that he doesn't have the money to pay up on him. He offers to get the money from the safe in his nearby salon, and Eliot agrees but asks to "keep" Bao as collateral. Bao goes with Carl, and Eliot tells Harry that Carl's on the move. Harry has rigged up a charge, but holds the switch as Mai comes in and aims her gun at him. He explains that he rigged a bomb out of salon supplies.

Carl comes in and Mai tells him that Harry has a bomb. The trafficker figures Harry is bluffing, Harry is bluffing, and Carl tells Mia to shoot Harry as a burglar. Saffron comes in, having gotten a text that sad hackers were trying to get at his legal files and he should come right away. Frank comes in, and Harry says that they texted Frank to bring the "merch" there, using Carl's phone that he gave to Bao at the course, who gave it to Hurley who sent the texts to saffron and Frank.

Police sirens approach, and Harry tells Carl that he's busted. Sarah comes in with her mace spray and says that she called the FBI rather than the locals Carl has paid off. Saffron tries to run, and Sarah sprays him with mace. Out in the salon, Eliot and Hurley arrive, and Eliot takes out the guard. Frank comes out, sees what's happening, and goes for his gun. Eliot drives a golf ball into his groin. The FBI open the safe and get the papers when they arrive, and take Carl and his partners away. Bao gives Tien her papers, and Harry tells Sarah that a witness in a Federal case if safe from deportation, and the Federal case could take months. The others will need a good lawyer, and Sarah smiles and goes over to them.

As Harry, Hurley, and Eliot leave with Bao, they give Bao the money that Eliot won playing darts against Carl. One of the players there is the head golf coach at LSU, and wants to give BAO a golf scholarship. As Bao goes over to the coach, Eliot says that he's the one who said they should have taken the case from the beginning. They don't remember it that way, and they all go to play a round of golf.

That night at the bar, everyone toasts Harry's running his first job. He says that he did it on his own, and they remind him of how they helped.

description: Stuck together during a massive hurricane, Eliot and Parker must stop a band of corrupt cops who have taken over a small hotel, and find what the cops are searching for, before it's too late.
tags: ['running from police', 'beaten by police', 'weather forecast', 'category 4 hurricane', 'lottery ticket', 'no cell phone service', 'ham radio', 'beacon inn', 'dislocated shoulder', 'knocked unconscious', 'catching food in mouth', 'cheese puff', 'resuscitation dummy', 'climbing a rope', 'tied to a chair', 'kicked in the head', 'zip tie handcuffs', 'smart gun', 'choke hold']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In a coastal resort hotel, a man, Omar Selina, runs through the lobby and outside. A policeman, Jim Abel, comes up in front of the man and punches him. Abel's partner Boggs joins him, and they tell Selina to give them the phone. They drag Selina below the dock and beat him. Finally Boggs holds Abel back when he goes too far, but not before he beats Selina unconscious. Boggs calls in a medvac,

Two weeks later at the bar, Sophie and Harry return and Sophie complains that they should have finished the job a week ago, but were delayed by Hurricane Esme slamming the Gulf. Breanna I got out on a plane just ahead of the storm, heading to a comic convention. Harry hasn't heard anything from Parker and Eliot yet.

Parker and Eliot are stuck on the Beacon Inn on Greenbeach Isle, and Eliot tells Parker that he called for backup. It's Maria, who calls him back. Maria cuts off, and the two teammates go in to dry off. Eliot figures that since the job is over, He's not worried about giving away any secrets to Maria. Boggs, comes over and wonders where they came from, Boggs glares at them and says that they're closed, and an older man limps up and says that Boggs can't leave people outside in a storm. After a moment, Boggs tells Eliot and Parker to wait in the bar. As Boggs' fellow cop Collins comes up and whispers in Boggs' ear, Eliot tells Parker that the two men are cops.

The older man, McCloud, goes with the teammates and introduces himself. There are other cops in the halls, and McCloud tells Parker and Eliot that he owns the hotel. Roxie, Jimenez the hotel manager, is working the bar, and greets the teammates despite her obvious misgiving about them being there. Roxie goes to get the partners towels, and Eliot figures McCloud is overrun and there are cops on every floor. Another cop, Abel, comes up and greets them and Parker tells Abel that they're siblings who were on a fishing trip. Eliot asks why there are so many people there, and Abel says that he and the others are there to secure the hotel. McCloud sits down and reads a newspaper article about a winning $230 lottery ticket that hasn't been claimed.

Boggs comes in, and as Roxie come in with the towel, Boggs tells her that he'll have to check out the rooms again. When McCloud tries to intervene, Boggs tells him that they got it. Parker stages a fight with Eliot, feigning being drunk, and stumbles back into Abel, lifting his wallet. They go to the kitchen to get her something to eat, and Parker tosses Abel's wallet to Eliot. Abel's name is in on his ID, and Parker says that Abel smells like cleaning supplies. She calls Sophie but the cell service is down, and the landlines are down because the cops took them out. Eliot tells Parker to get a walkie, and she says they have one problem.

Maria arrives at the hotel and Boggs tells her that they're closed. She brushes past Boggs, and Abel joins them and draws his gun but keeps it behind his back. Parker reminds Eliot that he already called for backup, and Eliot goes over, hugs, Maria, and tells her to keep her badge hidden. He tells Boggs that Maria is his friend and came to get them off the island, and takes her to get dried off. Once they're alone, Abel angrily tells Boggs that he told him not to let anyone in, and Boggs should lock the trio in the bar.

Later, Roxie confirms that they're locked in and McCloud tries to reassure her. Eliot tells Maria that the cop have taken over the hotel. He wonders if Maria can get them all off in her boat, and she warns that the swells are too high for anyone to leave. Parker comes over and says that the walkies are short range and she can't modify them. Maria introduces herself, and Eliot asks McCloud and Roxie about the cops. Roxie says that they're from Greenbeach, and they just showed up saying they came to help. Parker and Eliot figure the cops are looking for something, and they're using the hurricane as cover to hide it. McCloud confirms that he has an old ham radio in the boathouse, but they'll have to go outside to get to it. Maria insists on going with Eliot to get it, and Parker gives Maria her comm and says she'll distract the guard while they slip out. McCloud directs them to the freezer, which has a loading door to the outside.

Eliot and Maria go out through the freezer to the boathouse, and they talk about Eliot seeming happy with Maria. He quickly ends the conversation by finding the radio which Maria knows how to work. Meanwhile at the bar, Harry still can't raise a signal to Parker and Eliot. Eliot reaches them on the radio via the analog system that Breanna has been working on. Sophie responds and Eliot tells her what's going on.

Abel tells Collins to check the boathouse,

Sophie uses Breanna's laptop to get more intel on Abel, while Harry calls his contact in the police union.

Eliot apologizes to Maria for getting her into a situation, and she tells him not to bother because the people need help and he's helping them, and that's what she likes best about him. Harry calls back and says that Abel was recently suspended for beating Selina, and it happened two weeks ago. Selina was medvacced to a nearby hospital, and Harry goes to check it out while Sophie mans the radio.

Collins comes into the boathouse, and Eliot and Maria hide. He finds the radio and Sophie saying that Harry went to the hospital, and Eliot emerges from the shadows and fights Collins. Collins grabs a spear gun, and Maria hits him over the head with board. The spear gun goes off and Eliot dodges the spear, but it cuts a line which swings a boat into Eliot, and knocks him into the radio, breaking it. The impact dislocates Eliot's arm. Maria draws her gun on Collins, and Eliot questions Collins on what Abel is up to. Collins finally cracks and tells them that Abel got suspended for beating Solina, an ex-con drug dealer. The cop crew ran drugs and Solina blackmailed them, and Solina had proof on his phone but it wasn't there when they caught up to him. They figure Solina hid the phone in the hotel, and that's what they're looking for. Eliot "borrows" Maria's gun, takes out the clip, and knocks Collins out with the gun.

Abel calls Collins on the walkie, and isn't fooled when Eliot tries to impersonate Collins. He goes to the bar and asks Parker where the other two are. Parker still feigns being drunk, and complains about her "brother". Abel goes to the kitchen and finds Eliot and Maria kissing. Abel tells them to stay in the bar with others and they go, and Bogs has another cop check the boathouse and confirm there's been signs of a struggle and no sign of Collins. Abel figures someone else is in the hotel, and Boggs the others to be on watch for an intruder.

Eliot has McCloud check the radio, and McCloud says he might be able to fix it with fuses and there's a spare in the electrical room. Parker goes to get it, while Maria bangs Eliot's shoulder back into place. Eliot admits that he's done some things he can't take back, and Maria tells him that he can't live like he's to blame for bad things happening to good people.

Parker gets to the electrical room, gets the fuse, and smells the same cleaning chemical she smelled on Abel. She hides when Abel and Boggs come in looking for the phone. Boggs says that things are getting out of hand now that they have hostages, and Abel figures one of the other cops are messing with them. When Boggs questions him, Abel admits that they're all implicated and they have to stick together and he's got it covered how they're going to keep everything quiet.

Harry goes to the hospital and finds the injured Solina under police guard. Harry tells the receptionist that he's a lawyer, but she points out that he isn't Solina's lawyer, who already checked in. She leaves to help a patient, and Harry gives Sophie the name of Solina's lawyer, Jackie Dumont. Sophie recognizes Dumont as a lottery lawyer and tries to call her teammates.

At the hotel, Parker gets back to the bar. Maria goes over to Roxie and identifies herself as a U.S. Marshal. Parker found an invoice signed by Roxie, with the last name Solina, and realizes that Omar is Roxie's brother. Roxie breaks into tears. Roxie insists that Omar wasn't involved with drugs, and work with at-risk youths. Omar gave her the phone and Roxie hid it.

McCloud finishes repairing the radio, and Sophie tells them about the lawyer. Eliot figures the winning ticket is in the phone case, and Abel plans to steal it and tells the other cops that the phone has blackmail material, and the cop at the hospital with Omar is in league with Abel. Sophie tells Roxie that they'll do everything they can to keep Omar safe, and Parker realizes that Abel smells like accelerant, not cleaning chemicals, and he plans to burn down the hotel and everyone in in it to cover his tracks. Roxie says that she hid the phone in the lighthouse, even though it's unstable.

Parker goes to the boathouse and gets nautical line. Maria, McCloud, and Roxie leave the bar with the radio, and Eliot shuts off the lights and the backup generator at the fuse box. Abel figures that it's their saboteur and one cop, Daniels, goes to the bar to check on the prisoners while Boggs and the others go to the electrical room. Daniels finds Maria in the kitchen and she says that the others are gone. He checks and makes sure, figures McCloud won't make it far, and leads Maria out.

Boggs and his men find Eliot, who tells them that Boggs is running them. The cops turn on the lights and leave with Eliot. Meanwhile, the cop at the hospital prepares to move Omar. Sophie tells Harry to improvise, and he poses as a doctor and tells the cop that he needs to run one more test on Omar in Radiology. Harry takes Omar out on a gurney, while the cop confirms with the receptionist that Omar is ready to go. The cop catches up to Harry and takes the cloth-covered gurney. Harry has Solina nearby, while the cop takes "Omar" to the ambulance, prepares to shoot him, and discovers Harry has put a CPR dummy on the gurney.

Parker uses the line to climb up to the lighthouse. Meanwhile, Daniels brings Maria into the room where Boggs has brought Elliot, and has both of them sit down. Eliot tells the cops that Abel was going to take the ticket for himself and kill them all. Abel says that he was going to tell them about the ticket once they got it, and then punches Eliot in the face to shut him up. Boggs goes for his gun and draws on Abel, who draws his gun and aims it at Boggs.

Parker finds the phone case and the ticket inside, but accidentally turns on the light, alerting the cops. Her line blows off in the storm, and the cops on guard warn Abel over the radio. Abel figures that it was a distraction while Parker got the ticket, and sends the guards up to get her. He says that they'll split the money evenly, and Boggs lowers his gun. Abel says that they'll soon they'll have "his" ticket, and Eliot points out his slip. Abel punches him again, while Parker fights the two guards as they come up into the lighthouse.

Eliot continues undermining Abel's men, and Abel prepares to punch Eliot again but Boggs stops Abel and asks why Abel didn't tell him about the ticket. Abel finally tells Boggs that he's weak and is letting Eliot get to him. Meanwhile, Eliot and Maria work at their zip ties with blades that they smuggled in. Maria says that Abel's words are a good confession, and the two prisoners break free and take down the cops. Abel runs and Eliot tackles him, while Boggs jumps Maria when she takes his smart gun that won't fire for her. He grabs her throat and chokes her, and Parker arrives and knocks Boggs out from behind, while Eliot knocks out Abel.

Maria calls in her people to take in Abel and the others, and Parker admits that she likes Maria. Roxie confirms that Omar is safe, and Parker gives Roxie the ticket to give to Omar. The next day, Eliot asks Maria not to mention him and Parker on her report. Maria asks Eliot who he works for and then says that she doesn't care, and figures that he's good no matter how bad he thinks he is, and that's good enough for her. Eliot holds Maria and they look out to sea.

Later at the bar, Harry tells the others what they did. Maria calls Eliot and confirms that Boogs is going to testify against the others. Sophie and Harry go to get a refill, and Parker admits to Eliot that Maria did all right. She's worried that Eliot will want to leave the team to be with Maria, and she can't do it without Eliot. Eliot tells her that's never going to happen and puts arm around her.

description: Two local farmers are targeted by a hate group, but something more poisonous on the farm leads Team Leverage to a crooked green energy innovator and an old-fashioned train heist.
tags: ['flatbed truck', 'beaten with a baseball bat', 'firing a rifle into the air', 'alchoholic cardiomyopathy', 'blight', 'cobalt poisoning', 'redemption list', 'reference to nikola tesla', 'passenger train', 'battery', 'picture frame', 'soil analysis', 'hazmat suit', 'corroded battery', 'investment fraud', 'champagne', 'royal canadian mounted police', 'windsor ontario', 'detroit michigan', 'binoculars', 'flame thrower', 'hit with a shovel', 'thrown from a moving train', 'lincoln memorial penny', 'lesbian kissing in public', 'illegal dumping', 'hazardous waste', 'contaminated ground water']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At a farm in Louisiana, local farmers Leon Famille and James talk about how a blight on their field makes no sense, and what they've harvested isn't enough. James worries about how they'll make it, and Leon assures him that his grandfather got through worse they will get through it. Leon gets a call and goes inside to take it, and men with baseball bats approach James as he loads up his truck and hit James, then tell him they don't want "his kind" around there. The others beat James, and Leon comes over and fires a shotgun blast into the air to scare the attackers off. Leon runs to the unconscious James and holds him in his arms.

Later at the bar, Eliot brings Leon and James in, since he's buys some of his food from them. James talks about how Leon's family farm is a legacy, and Leon talks about how half of their crops I the last year have suffered the blight. Eliot promises that he'll find the attackers, and they recently had bloodwork done showing they're being poisoned. If the couple doesn't figure out what's going on, they'll lose everything.

Later, Parker takes James and Leon to a hotel, while the others review an identity of the attackers WIM--White Identity Movement--web site. Breanna says that the WIM men have a train at their disposal, and brings up an aerial satellite photo of the farm. The area of the blight goes beyond the farm boundaries, and there's a burial site near where the train tracks end on the property. The parish hasn't tested the site yet, and Harry suggests that it's cobalt poisoning, based on his knowledge from one of his firm's previous cases. Blake Whitcomb owns the land the tracks run on, and is big in the green energy game and runs his business from his private train car. The train runs on renewables, and Breanna reports that he has plans for electrical planes. There's a big review in Detroit that weekend.

Parker parachutes in and says she took the fat way back, and confirms that one of the paintings in the video the team are watching was bought because of the appropriate size to conceal a safe, not the value of the painting. She's eager to rob Whitcomb's train, and Sophie figures that the poisoning from the train is related to Whitcomb. Sophie suggests that the3 poisoning is unintentional or someone could be trying to frame Whitcomb, and Breanna determines the car is hooked up to a train and going to leave in 30 minutes. Eliot insists on going to the farm with Harr and finding out what' buried there, while the others go to the train.

At the station, Parker steals a ticket from a passerby so she can board the train with the others. They avoid a party of bachelorettes and go to the back of the train where Whitcomb's car is hooked up, and discover that his meeting there and he has one of the HIM men, Karl as a bodyguard.

Eliot and Harry arrive at the farm, and figure the couple calling for the parish to run the soil sample, and the HIM attacking them immediately thereafter, is connected. Sophie has a cover for Parker, and Breanna goes to set up mobile communication in a forward car. Harry has a testing kit and a bailout bag in the back of his car, and he insists that he's just prepared.

Breanna goes over the passenger manifest and finds one woman, Emily Woo, who is an engineer for Whitcomb's company. Emily headed the design team for the plane's body, which is why she's along. Emily is nervous about the launch according to the company's message board, Sophie overhears Whitcomb talking about his home as the "eagle's nest", and tells Breanna over the comms to set her up as German royalty.

Senator Jefferson Gwynette approaches Sophie and hits on her, and Sophie puts on a German accent as Breanna sets up Sophie's German royalty background. She has Gwynette introduce her to Whitcomb, while Parker poses as a conductor and takes tickets. Emily wants to talk to Whitcomb about the plans, but he brushes her off and talks to Sophie. Whitcomb is entranced by Sophie, who is taken aback by his enthusiasm. Karl runs a check on his phone on Sophie and finds Breanna's fake background, and nods to Whitcomb in approval. Meanwhile, Breanna gets into the patent files and brings up everything that Whitcomb has ever filed.

Harry and Eliot reach the burial site and Harry runs some tests on the soil, and figures the site is heavily contaminated with heavy metals. He and Eliot put on Harry's protective suits that he brought along.

Sophie and Whitcomb share a toast, and Sophie convinces Whitcomb to take her into an adjoining private car. Parker joins Breanna, who can't find the plans in the patent filings. The thief figures that the airplane plans are in the painting safe, along with the evidence of what is being dumped at the safe, and just smiles when Breanna wonders how she's going to get by Whitcomb's security precautions.

Whitcomb shows Sophie around his private car filled with German memorabilia, and Sophie spots the painting while trying to fend Whitcomb off. The battery is on a table, but he says that she'll see it in action when the train gets to Detroit where it's going. Whitcomb boasts that the battery will him make him millions, and with that he and his investors will put the world back in "order".

Sophie tells Whitcomb that the European Union plans to put electrical airplanes into place within ten years, and she wants to be ahead of the curve, and return Europe to its former glory. Whitcomb agrees and kisses Sophie on the cheek. She puts Whitcomb off when he tries to kiss her more firmly, and takes Whitcomb back to the party. Parker drops in through a roof hatch and starts breaking into the safe.

Harry and Eliot dig up the site and Harry asks Eliot if he thought Harry would last long. Eliot admits that he didn't think so at first, and then asks Harry how far he wants to go. He tells Harry that Harry stared his past in the face and kept digging, and Harry could be a part of team the long-term.

Parker opens the safe and discovers that it's empty, then figures that the car is off-balance. Harry figures she can tell because of the taste, and tells the others that they found batteries at the burial site. Whitcomb is dumping the batteries, but they're corroded and leaking. Breanna explains that electrical batteries have to be carefully recycled or they leak cobalt. The cobalt got into the ground water and poisoned the couple, and Breanna figures that the "junk batteries" will never fly a plane, and he's using the fake batteries to get investors so he can eventually make the plane. Meanwhile he's using the HIM to cover up what he's doing at the farm, Eliot and Harry plan to take some of the evidence with them, and Sophie tells Breanna to come in.

Sophie goes over to where Whitcomb is talking with Emily, and convinced him to let Emily get her some coffee. Once Emily goes, Whitcomb says he has some people he wants to introduce Sophie to and he'll go get them. Sophie tells Breanna to either take Emily down, or tell her the truth and Emily joins their side. Emily notices that Breanna has tree-planting drones on her tablet, and comes over to talk to Breanna about it. Breanna invites Emily to sit with her. Sophie tells Breanna to use her feelings to seduce Emily, and Whitcomb introduces a foreign Secretary to Sophie, preventing her from giving Breanna more advice.

Emily tells Breanna that her boss developed the batteries in a separate building away from her, and she wants to make the world a better place but it feels like she's being sidelined. Breanna tells Emily that it sounds like she's talking herself out of her instincts. Sophie, who has been listening in, figure Emily is a "true believer" and Breanna should show her the truth about the batteries. Parker goes to take control of the train just in case, but she has to go through the bachelorette party to get to the engine. She discovers that their Canadian Mounties, not bachelorettes.

Harry wonders what the big deal is about Mounties, and Eliot tells Harry that the Mounties are the most feared law enforcement agency in the world. Parker says that all of them are wanted by the Mounties, and if they put them down they will put them down forever. All of the team is wanted in Canada, and the Mounties never forget a face. Breanna confirms that the train's final destination is Canada, giving the Mounties jurisdiction.

The HIM spot Harry and Eliot walking back down the road with the batteries.

Emily tells Breanna that she has to go back to the party and invites Breanna to come with her. Sophie tells Breanna that it's the opening they need and to go, and Breanna agrees. Meanwhile, Sophie overhears Karl telling Whitcomb that his men have spotted Harry and Eliot at the site. Whitcomb tells his men to burn the farm down, and kill anyone in the way. Sophie overhears the conversation and warns Eliot, and Eliot heads for the farm to protect it.

Breanna and Emily arrive at the party, and Breanna asks Emily if there's somewhere they can privately to talk. Emily agrees and introduces Breanna to Whitcomb, and asks if she can show Breanna some of her equipment. Whitcomb jokingly tells Emily not to sell any state secrets.

Eliot and Harry get back to the farm, and Eliot tells Harry to get the batteries to the authorities while he deals with the HIM. After Harry drives off, the HIM men arrive

Karl lets Emily and Breanna into the private car and Breanna starts breaking open the paneling to find what Parker thought was there. There are standard batteries hidden inside, and Breanna explains Whitcomb's scam to Emily. She tells Emily that Whitcomb lied to Emily, and shows her a photo of the dump site. Breanna asks for Emily's help, but Emily warns that if she exposes Whitcomb than her dream of electric flight dies. Whitcomb comes in and see the exposed batteries.

Eliot asks any of the HIM men if they served, anyone but themselves. Harry drives back and hits one with his car, and Eliot attacks the others. Harry hits the last one standing, who is preparing to torch the farm with a flamethrower. The blow doesn't knock the man down and he goes for Harry, and Eliot knocks the man out from behind. Harry throws up from getting into his first fight.

Whitcomb calls for Karl, and Sophie and the rest of the party guests come in instead. She lured him to the next car and Parker kicked him off the train. Whitcomb insists that everything's fine, and Sophie asks him to show them the battery right away. With them from some prodding from Breanna, Emily demonstrates that the battery is a fraud and Sophie says that Whitcomb is a fraud. Emily confesses everything, and Whitcomb insists that the battery is just the presentational model and they're working on the real thing. When Sophie says that he's a fraud, Whitcomb says that she knows nothing and Gwynette points out that Whitcomb has been saying that Sophie is an expert. Emily says that her team built the plane and Whitcomb just sold it. Sophie tells them the guests that Emily is the one who can build them a plane, while Whitcomb is a conman and a thief.

When Whitcomb runs out, Sophie reminds him that he's on a moving train. He keeps running... right into the car with the Mounties. Parker hits the emergency brakes, throwing Whitcomb at the feet of the Mounties. The Mounties have received a tip about Whitcomb from Harry about Whitcomb smuggling toxic waste across the border, and Sophie, Breanna, and Parker gloat from the door window.

Later, everyone gathers at the farm and Eliot prepares the food. Breanna apologizes to Emily, who is happy with how things turned out. The two of them kiss and then join the others to eat. Eliot says that they cut off the HIM funding by taking down Whitcomb, and "someone" sent their phone numbers to the FBI. Whitcomb had to liquidate his personal funds to finance his Canadian legal morass, and clean up the waste. One of their contacts bought Whitcomb's train and is selling off the parts to private collectors, and the resulting money is going back to the farm. Parker complains that they didn't hold up the train, so she suggests they do it another time. However, Sophie points out that she bought the safe painting, so technically she stole it. They share a toast to the farm.

description: The Leverage team infiltrates an oil rig and a trial to find evidence that a corrupt oil CEO is hiding a dangerous oil leak in the gulf, causing illnesses along the spill zone.
tags: ['texting', 'car crash', 'sorting mail', 'refinishing woodwork', 'asking for help', 'new orleans cityscape', 'orleans baptist hospital', 'benzene', 'lawsuit', 'brake line cut', 'attempted murder', 'hyperion oil rig', 'sikorsky s 92 helicopter', 'woman wears a red dress', 'baby shower', 'oil rig explosion', "breaking a drinking glass in one's hand", 'cliffhanger']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At night, a boy outside a house text to her girlfriend, who sneaks out to be with him. However, a man in the bushes grabs her Becky stomps on his foot and breaks free, and then runs. The man gets into his car and drives off, swerves to avoid the boy as he steps out in front of him, and hits a parked car, knocking himself out on the driver's wheel. Becky goes back inside and gets her mother Grace and her step husband Ethan, and Ethan calls 911.

The next day at the bar, Harry comes in with the mail and finds Eliot refurbishing the walls because of Parker and Becky crashing things into them constantly. One letter is forwarded from one of Eliot's aliases, and one for Sophie from a London theater offering her the position of director there. Parker and Becky come in from training, and Parker storms off when she hears Sophie describing the offer. Sophie figures the team can function without her like they did before she came out of retirement.

As Sophie walks off to call London and Becky follows her, there's a knock at the door. It's Becky, Harry's daughter, who says that she needs Harry's help. They talk privately and Becky explains that she tracked Harry by the tracker he put on her phone. She explains that someone is trying to hurt their family and someone is coming after Ethan. Ethan says that it's no big deal, refuses to call the police, and says that he'll handle it himself. Becky doesn't think Ethan is taking the matter seriously, bur Becky isn't convinced and asks Harry to help his ex-wife and her like he helps other people.

Harry asks the team to help Ethan, an oil company CEO, and Parker and Breanna refuse. The ex-lawyer says that Ethan is a good guy, and was brought in to help clean up an oil spill. Sophie points out that Ethan doesn't fit the4 profile of their usual clients, and Harry insists that Ethan is good people. Harry figures that Ethan isn't taking it seriously enough and won't hire his own security, and finally tells the team that Ethan is married to his ex-wife Grace. The ex-lawyer says that Ethan's opponents are going after his family, but Breanna still refuses and walks off. Sophie says that the rest of them are in. Parker and Sophie tease Eliot about Maria when Parker offers to check at the hospital where Breanna's attempted abductor is, and Harry figures he and Sophie will hack the security around the house using the binders that Hardison left.

At the hospital, Parker, Eliot, and Maria go in and Maria says that the abductor is refusing to talk to the police and has no ID on him. Maria gets them in past security and is amused that Eliot won't tell her why they want to talk to the abductor, kisses him, and leaves.

At the bar, Breanna ignore Harry and Sophie's failed attempts to hack the security. When Harry bungles it and turns off the bar generator, Breanna walks off in disgust,.

Eliot and Parker go into the abductor's rooms, and find two people posing as cops trying to kill the abductor. The team mates attack them and they run off, and a suited man--James Lowe--and the abductor Jerry Vanton's grandson Damon come in. the man says that he's asked the abductor not to do the work, again and again. Lowe talks to Parker and Eliot privately, and explains that he's a lawyer pursuing a lawsuit pro bono against Ethan's oil company, and Vanton keeps getting involved for free. Vanton's granddaughter Sarah has leukemia, and the doctors figure Sarah got the leukemia from benzene exposure, and benzene is found in crude oil. The company's oil platform was damaged three months ago and Ethan's company GulfPetrol covered it up, with Ethan providing the PR. The platform, Hyperion, is still leaking. Lowe is representing Sarah, and the oil is still leaking but GP denies that it's theirs. Lowe needs ironclad evidence that the oil is GP's, and Vanton is trying to help Lowe get the proof. If Lowe wins his case, there'll be hundreds of other suits against GP.

Eliot and Parker return to the bar and find the generator still out. Breanna boots everything back up and says she's no longer on strike now that they know Ethan is the bad guy. Vanton's brake lines were sabotaged, and Mitchell, Nathan & Cupp is representing GP and has all of the evidence that would prove GP is responsible for the oil leak. They've booked the largest conference room in the city. Harry goes to confront Ethan, while Sophie has Breanna get her access to the conference room..

Harry approaches Ethan and Grace at the golf club where they're having lunch, "accidentally" bumps into Grace, and asks about the incident at the house. Ethan joins them, and Parker is posing as a waitress and steals Ethan's phone. Harry brings up Sarah's lawsuit, and Ethan says that Sarah needs the money but GP is innocent. Meanwhile, Parker sends the phone signal to Breanna, who is trying to get into the conference room with Sophie. Ethan uses the phone as an electronic key for everything he's involved with, and Breanna confirms there's military encryption on the phone. Breanna tells Parker to stall, and Parker stalls by carding Harry and slipping the phone back when Breanna is done.

Sophie and Breanna go into the conference room using the cloned phone, and Sophie claims that she's an efficiency expert and Breanna is her assistant, and the managing partner at the firm sent her. She tells the lead counsel, Chandis Peterson, that she's not "efficient".

At the club, Ethan jokingly tells Harry that because of him, Harry doesn't have to pay alimony or child support. Before he leaves, Harry asks Ethan if he's sure the oil isn't coming from Hyperion, and Ethan insists that they're not. Meanwhile, Sophie inspects the files, and Breanna take photos of them with a hidden camera. Later back at the bar, the team have takeout and Breanna says that she ran the numbers on the files and they're tampered with. The raw data could be anywhere, and Eliot says that they should get it from Hyperion. Harry isn't happy that Ethan lied to him, and wants to take him down.

Eliot figures that he, Parker, and Breanna will go on Hyperion to get the data, and physically bring it back. The oil platform has banned all electronics, so they have to bring back the data physically. Hyperion is 120 miles off the Louisiana coast, and the data they need is on the drill floor. Parker will pose as a medic, intercept the incoming crew, and send them to the infirmary. Eliot will pose as a roughneck, take the crew's place on the drilling floor, and get the data. Parker will go the control room and distract the one tech on duty with a medical inspection, Breanna will hack into the primary data systems, and Eliot will stand watch while covered in oil. Then they fake an illness to get them on the first helicopter out. Sophie and Harry will stall the trial until they get the data to Lowe, before Ethan testifies.

Harry has gone to Ethan's house and looks at it from across the street. Sophie finds Harry there and Harry points out that he's going to hurt the people he loves most, by taking down Ethan. She points out that Grace and Becky deserve to know the kind of man Ethan is. Harry admits that he justified what he did by never breaking the law, and used it as a guideline. Sophie tells him that life is complicated, and she calibrated her morality" by believing there was honor among thieves.

On Hyperion, the trio board with the new crew. Maria calls Eliot and suggests they go out for dinner the next night. Eliot says that he's on a "business trip" and claims he's making a smoothie when she hears the helicopter in the background. Maria says that it's what she signed up for and says that they'll talk when he gets back. The security guard takes Eliot's cell phone before he boards.

Harry approaches Grace as she's out jogging.

Eliot talks to Parker privately about his relationship issues, based on her experience with Hardison. She advises Eliot against lying, Parker figures that Hardison is the first person who really saw her, and Eliot has to let Maria see the real him. If she doesn't want Eliot, then Parker says she'll hang her up the edge of a building until she smartens up.

Sophie goes back to the conference room, and Peterson tells her that since the plaintiffs have shown a lack of evidence showing GP is responsible for the spill, the law firm is meeting with the judge to have him toss the case.

Harry starts to tell Grace about Ethan. Grace says that she loves Ethan. Before Harry can respond, Sophie calls and tells him about the case being dismissed. Ethan is at the courthouse, and Harry excuses himself and goes to the courthouse.

Breanna tells Eliot that she's found the data collection console. Eliot is called to the control room, where he's told that he has a personal call by satellite phone. It's Sophie, who says she's his wife and "the baby" I coming early, because the techs are monitoring the call. Breanna is listening as well, and picks up the real intent of the message. The trio get back together and work how to speed up their plan, and that Breanna will rig up the sat phone as a dial-up modem and send the data. Eliot goes to the collection part, but finds no one there except the main operator, who says that there was something wrong about Eliot's earlier call and there are some people who want to talk to Eliot.

Outside the courtroom, Harry and Sophie meet with Lowe and tell him that they have to delay. Lowe warns that they need proof of intention or malfeasance, Sophie goes to Peterson to buy them some time.

The operator takes Eliot to a room, and techs have a surprise party made for Eliot's baby shower. The operator insists that Eliot stay, and gets him a beer. Breanna comes in, and tells Eliot to make sure everyone stay there while she accesses the data.

Parker goes to the control room to do her "medical checks", and finds everyone going to the baby shower. One tech is staying on duty, and Parker says that he looks exhausted and has to give him an exam.

In the courtroom, Peterson tells Sophie that they saved GP $10 million. Sophie asks Peterson if there's anything else Peterson wants to report to the court, but is paranoid and tells her to team to go through everything and see if they missed something, and asks for 10 more minutes before the judge delivers his ruling.

Parker tells tech that he has a highly contagious flu and is going to have to isolate. Once he leaves, Breanna comes in with the thumb drive and tells Parker that they have to rewire the place to send the data back.

Ethan comes into the courtroom at the same time as Judge Lundry comes in. Peterson presents the motion to dismiss, and Harry speaks up from the back and says that it's a toxic tort case and the judge has jurisdiction, based on an obscure case. Lundry dismisses Peterson's motion to dismiss, and tells Harry to call his first witness.

Parker and Breanna finish rewiring the control room, but Breanna says that the two sets of data match because GP cooked the data as it came in, and they can't get the raw data in time. Parker access the cameras that monitor every inch of Hyperion.

Harry questions Ethan, as Grace comes in. Ethan asks Harry if he's trying to get revenge on him for marrying Harry's ex, and then testifies that his lawyer told him he couldn't write a check to Sarah, because it could be interpreted as admitting guilt. Parker calls Sophie and tells her that they have the uplink working, and emails the data to Harry. Harry then shows the court the video of the oil leaking, and Ethan says that the video was illegally acquired , and Peterson tells him to shut up. Lundry says that the evidence isn't admissible, until can be independently verified and investigated.

Ethan and Peterson leave, and Sophie tells Lowe that GP won't be able to hide its activities anymore. Harry assures Larry that there'll be enough evidence for Sarah and all the other class action victims, then goes to Grace as she leaves. She tells Harry that she's not leaving Ethan because he was just doing his job, to provide for her and Becky. Harry is astonished, and Grace tells him that Ethan is there for him and he's there, which is more than Harry ever was. Harry starts to say that he made a lot of mistakes, and Grace tells him that they're done and walks off.

That night at the bar, Eliot is pouring drinks and Parker says that Harry has moved out. Sophie tells the others that things didn't work out for Harry as he hoped, and says that they should give him some time. Parker says that the job was better than running a theater in London, and Eliot asks Sophie if she really plans on leaving. Sophie says that she needs to find out the person she's going to be.

Breanna comes in and shows the others a newscast of a fire on Hyperion. The techs are among those dead, and Sophie figures that GP blew up Hyperion to cover their tracks. The team wondered who gave up the inside information necessary.

Harry meets with Bligh of RIZ and offers his services. Bligh asks why Harry decides to work for RIZ, and he says that he's decided to calibrate his thinking about morality.

description: The team has to infiltrate the shadowy R.I.Z. to stop it from unleashing a worm that can take down the entire electrical grid, and they must use Harry to do it.
tags: ['reference to the stuxnet computer virus', 'oil rig fire', 'r. i z security', 'jumping on an elevator roof', 'brick & basil mexican food truck', 'computer worm', 'tasered', 'apple fritter', 'sleeper hold', 'infiltrator', 'fistfight', 'kissing in public', 'pet magazine', 'incommunicado', 'punching a heavy bag', 'supply chain hack', 'electrical grid', 'the dawn hotel', 'disguise', 'locked in', 'power outage', 'paper copy', 'computer server', 'aerial drone', 'punch in face', 'blackmail', 'double cross', 'outsmarted', 'paperwork', 'continued from previous episode']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Sophie puts her plans to go back to London to be a director on hold. Eliot is watching the news, and the men that he worked with who died when the oil rig exploded. Parker is watching with Eliot, and says that the funeral of the five men was that day. Sophie hasn't heard from Harry, and Eliot points out that Ethan blew up the oil rig and killed five innocent men, just to win a court case. He asks what they're going to do to Ethan, and Sophie points out that if Ethan "mysteriously" dies, they don't get to prove what he did, and nobody gets a penny.

Breanna joins them and says that Ethan used a computer worm to cause the explosion, and the worm overheated the worm drills. She found traces of the worm in the data they scraped from the rig, but it doesn't prove who did it. If they can find the source code of who used the worm, they can prove they're guilty. Eliot figures that someone is helping Ethan, and Breanna says that it's RIZ. Bligh arrived at RIZ's New Orleans office during the trial, and they have a huge cybersecurity department. Sophie tells Breanna to pull up the specs on RIZ's office building in New Orleans, and Eliot tells Breanna to take her time and do it right.

Two months later at the RIZ office, Sophie walks into the lobby posing as a cybersecurity expert. Eliot has already infiltrated the building posing as a security guard, and he summons the lobby elevator with Parker hiding on top. She switches to a car going up and heads to the server room, while Eliot goes to the security surveillance room and takes over from the guard there. Once he's alone, Eliot accesses the cameras. Breanna is outside in a food truck, and directs Sophie to the cybersecurity administrator's office where any incriminating emails will be.

While an aide takes Sophie to the conference room, Parker gets to the server room and Eliot can't bypass Blight's security. Picking the electronic lock, Parker goes in while Breanna overrides the motion sensors. Sophie goes to the ladies' room. The aide, Eugene, says that due to the new protocols, he has to wait nearby. Sophie wonders why Blight is increasing security after she committed the crime, Parker gets into the server room, but finds a glass door blocking her path, that isn't on the specs. Meanwhile, Sophie breaks into the security office but finds that's it's empty. She turns to find another aide behind her, and says that she's there to meet the cyberteam. The aide says that Blight has moved all the equipment up to the 20th floor,

The guard returns to the surveillance room and demands to see Eliot's new badge. Eliot doesn't have one, and knocks the guard out. Another guard approaches Parker, who takes his taser and knocks him out with it. Blight is in the hallway, and Sophie quickly turns her back and walks away only to run into Harry. He ignores Sophie and goes to Bligh.

The team gets out and goes back to the bar, and Breanna confirms that Harry started working for RIZ two days after Ethan's trial ended. They figure Harry went back to being "evil", and Sophie wonders why Harry let her go. Parker doesn't believe Harry might be trying to help them, and tells Sophie that not everyone can be saved. Sophie finally says that they should go "steal" Harry and find out what he knows.

The team goes to a power substation, and Parker and Eliot go in disguised as workers. Sophie tells them over the comms to bring Harry back in one piece. Breanna blanks the cameras covering their path, but realizes it was harder than it should have been and someone else is in the system. Eliot and Parker see Harry talking to Ethan, and they listen as Harry tells Ethan he was sent there to make sure no one figures what Ethan is up to. Ethan insists that it's his project and he's not going to let Harry take any of his credit, and Harry points out that he's spent the last eight months with a crew that took people like Ethan apart, and he knows a lot about security. Ethan hands over the security protocols and storms off,

Harry sees Eliot and Parker approaching him and runs. They easily catch him, and Breanna warns them that someone else is fighting her. Harry tells his former teammates to get out before it happens, and the alarms go off. Breanna recognizes the code and who is responsible. A security team arrives, and Eliot throws Harry to the floor, then fights the team with Parker. Hardison arrives and knocks out the last guard from behind, and tells Harry to come with him. The four of them run out, and Hardison says the alarm is to cover up his hardware taps. Hardison gives the security controls to Breanna and kills the alarms, and has her kill the motion sensors so they can get out. Parker kisses Hardison.

The team regroups at the bar, and Eliot complains that Hardison kept them out of the loop. Harry explains that he couldn't reach out to the team without compromising them, so he reached out to Hardison instead. Hardison and Harry talked via paper to avoid RIZ's electronic surveillance of Harry, and Hardison talked Harry through hacking the RIZ servers. They confirmed that Ethan worked for RIZ ten years ago, and they maneuvered Ethan into position at GP. The rig explosion was intended to prove that RIZ could shut down the US power grid, to show that they could and sell it to the highest bidder.

Sophie talks to Harry privately and asks him why he did what he did. Harry says that he thought he had to dig into RIZ on his own, and his guilt drove him when he misjudged the situation with Grace and Ethan, and almost got Parker, Breanna, and Eliot killed. Harry wasn't going to let guilty destroy Sophie's "family" like it destroyed his. Sophie says that they're family because they learned they can't go it alone and to ask for help, and Harry asks her to help him finish it. Sophie agrees but figures they'd better give the others some time to resolve their issues.

Parker assures Hardison that they don't have any issues to resolve, and Eliot insists that he's not upset. Hardison shakes hands with him and they hug, and Sophie and Harry come back and Hardison explains that RIZ is performing a supply chain hack to plant the worm, and RIZ owns the subsidiary companies. With Hardison's help, Harry has got evidence that RIZ owns dozens of the subsidiary companies, and guys like Ethan protect the companies. RIZ has access to all the government computers, and they blew up the rig to convince their potential buyers they have the access. If they cause a blackout, they prove they can get into any system anywhere. RIZ is going to bring down the US power grid, and Harry's stolen emails aren't enough to do more than cause a minor scandal. They need the worm source code to prove RIZ is the mastermind. The code is on one server 24 floors up with no connection to the outside. Hardison figures if he could install the hardwire taps on the substation, he could grab the code before RIZ wiped it from the server. Only the Feds have the necessary backdoor access, and Eliot says he knows someone who can give them the access. The backdoor has to be opened at the substation and the RIZ server, so Harry will have to go back in undercover. Sophie says that she's done and Parker should run the team, and Harry goes back to his position.

Eliot meets Maria outside a hotel, and she gives him a thumb drive with the Federal codes for the power grid. Before she hands it over, Maria asks Eliot why she should give him something that would end her career. Eliot says that the rig explosion was him and his team failing to stop it, and his team work outside the law. He tells Maria that they used to be criminals, and they've worked off the books for the government. Eliot insists that they're the good guys, and Maria believes him. Maria won't cross the line to be with a criminal despite her feelings for him, and walks off after giving him the drive.

That night, Blight goes to see Harry in his office and admires his new, handcrafted wooden desk. She says that they need to do something about his old partners, and she'll deal with them later that night after the blackout RIZ is causing. Bligh says that they'll lose power for only 60 seconds before the backup generators kick in, tells him that everyone will be taken care of that night, and leaves.

Later, Harry goes to the auditorium where Bligh is with the prospective buyers, as Ethan prepares for his presentation. Ethan demands to know why Harry is there, and Harry says that he's just double-checking the servers. Harry goes to the server room to open the back door at that end. Sophie and Breanna are in the food truck outside the substation, and Sophie tells Breanna that they'll have to trust Harry to do his job, because they can't communicate. Hardison, Parker, and Eliot are inside and tell a worker that they're an inspection task force. They reach the panel, and Eliot talks about how let his guard down with Maria. Hardison and Parker assure him that he opened himself up. Hardison accesses the back door, but the connection is interrupted and Bligh comes in with her security team and tells Harry that the team's weakness is loyalty. The trio in the substation run when they realize they've been made, while Bligh tells Harry that loyalty made them predictable. Bligh takes Harry's phone and has her men take Harry to his office, and lock him in. Bligh tells Harry that her men scoured his office and found the files, and the digital copies he made. Without the code, Harry has nothing.

The others meet in the food truck and Breanna plays back the audio from Harry's office. Breanna says that they should break into the server room and steal the code, even though Bligh knows they're coming, and pull an hour's worth of data off the server, as well as rescue Harry, all before the blackout.

Ethan gives his presentation to the buyers, and Sophie comes in. Bligh walks out and Sophie goes with her, and they go to a nearby conference room. Sophie offers to let RIZ go if Bligh cancels her scheme, hands over Ethan and release Harry, and Bligh figures that Sophie is a distraction.

Eliot walks into one of the building's five street-level points of entry, then runs off after making sure the guards spot him. More guards intercept him, and Eliot fights them. two more guards arrive.

Bligh figures Parker is getting into Harry's office to free him, while Breanna goes to the server.

A figure enters the server room.

The blackout begins throughout the city, and the buyers watch from the window. Bligh tells Sophie that it's too late, and the five street-level exits locked down, along with the server door. The power to the server shut off, so Breanna can't steal the code. Sophie just smiles, and Bligh tells her she's not getting out of the building alive. Bligh starts counting down from 60 seconds when the power comes back up, and Sophie says that she decided to use the blackout when it disabled the security systems in the building.

Eliot fights the guards in the dark.

Breanna climbs through the vents to Harry's office

One of the guards Eliot first attacked was Hardison in disguise, and Hardison slipped into the server room before the door locked.

Bligh figures that Hardison didn't have enough time to download the code from the server, and they have all the information Harry stole. Sophie tells Bligh that she allowed Harry to order the custom desk,

Harry opens the secret compartment in the desk, with paper copies of everything he stole.

Bligh tries to call security, but the phones are dead due to the blackout. She points out that Harry still has to make it out the building, and Sophie points out that only the street-level entrances are sealed.

Breanna opens the locked door, and she and Harry to go to the server room. Parker breaks in through the room's window, and Breanna calls up a drone to haul the whole server with the code on it. As the drone flies off with the server, the rest of the team drop down to the street on zip lines.

Sophie tells Bligh that the whole thing would have been impossible... if Bligh hadn't engineered the blackout. Bligh points out that Sophie still in the building, and as the lights come up Sophie notes that Eliot has been in the dark for 60 seconds. Eliot comes in with an unconscious guard, and escorts Sophie out.

Bligh goes to the auditorium to check with Ethan. Eliot, Sophie, and Harry come in. Eliot ignores Ethan, but Harry punches Ethan in the jaw.

Back at the bar, Eliot serves food for a celebratory dinner. Breanna sends emails to the RIZ people secretly working at the subsidiary companies, suggesting they make donations to the families of the dead men or they'll rat them out to law enforcement. However, she's going to double-cross them once they donate $10 million. Hardison used the code to spell out RIZ's name in lit windows on building, meaning that RIZ can't cover up that they caused the blackout.

Hardison says that he might stick around for a while, while Harry calls his daughter. She tells Harry that Ethan went to the FBI to confess and go into witsec and they're going after Bligh. His daughter also wants to move in with Harry, and says that he's done conning, but is going to go back to being a lawyer and helping people in need.

Sophie walks Harry out, and Harry tells her that they were both lost in grief when they first met. She saw that and helped him, and Sophie says that Harry helped her and he sees her as she could be and she's going to miss that. Sophie kisses Harry on the cheek and wishes him luck, calling him "Harry" instead of "Mr. Wilson" for the first time. Harry leaves, and Sophie takes off her wedding ring and goes back to the others.

Sophie tells the team that it wasn't her final performance, and the jobs are her stage. Parker is happy to let Sophie lead the team, and won't miss the paperwork. The team gives Sophie all of the paperwork and walks out.

description: After filling in for her sister at a talent show, a teen is given the opportunity of a lifetime when she is invited to attend Hollywood Arts High School.
tags: ['reference to my three sons tv show', 'reference to the waltons the first day', 'reference to icarly', 'reference to toy story 2', 'reference to robbie douglas', 'reference to caillou']
synopsis_with_character_names:
The series premiere starts with Tori Vega (Victoria Justice) working on a science project with her lab partner Ian, when her older sister, Trina (Daniella Monet), storms into the house. Trina's upset that her partner for the annual showcase at Hollywood Arts High School is AndrÃ© Harris (Leon Thomas) (referred to in this episode as Andrew by Trina), a 10th grader. She knows that there are going to be important talent scouts and musical industry workers at the show, which is making her nervous as she really wants to impress them. Trina kicks Ian out and insists that her sister helps her and AndrÃ© with the song that she'll perform (Make It Shine). While working together, Tori and AndrÃ© form a friendship despite Trina driving them insane, and AndrÃ© awes Tori with his talent as he sits down at the piano and plays a little tune.

Trina about to sing Make It Shine. And Trina's upset that her partner for the annual showcase at Hollywood Arts High School is AndrÃ© Harris (referred to in this episode as Andrew by Trina), a 10th grader. She knows that there are going to be important talent scouts and musical industry workers at the show, which is making her nervous as she really wants to impress them. Trina kicks Ian out and insists that her sister helps her and AndrÃ© with the song that she'll perform (Make It Shine). While working together, Tori and AndrÃ© form a friendship despite Trina driving them insane, and AndrÃ© awes Tori with his talent as he sits down at the piano and plays his tune. Outside the front porch, AndrÃ© is calling his grandma, When Tori comes by and asks him who he is calling. He says that his grandma will be attending the Big Showcase. AndrÃ© then explains that it is the first time that his grandma has left the house in 6 years.

Tori skips school to attend the showcase with her parents. The family is called backstage before the performance starts, only to discover that Trina's tongue has swollen up because she was allergic to an herb gargle that she drank, which she said was to help her sing better. The guidance counselor, Lane Alexander, who is a very calm and sensible man, asks if anybody can take Trina's place. AndrÃ© assumes that Tori can because she'd heard the song numerous times during rehearsals throughout the week. At first, Tori refuses, but AndrÃ© forces her to, so she slips on a fancy dress and gets on stage. Realizing that she has nothing to lose in front of a crowd of strangers, Tori decides to sing.

Her top-notch performance surprises the audience, and even herself. Principal Eikner takes Tori and her parents backstage and offers Tori a once-in-a-lifetime chance to attend the elite performing arts high school. Tori doesn't think that she's talented enough, but after watching such a strong performance, AndrÃ© believes otherwise. He pulls up the curtain and asks the audience if Tori should join them, to which they all chant, "Yes!" After a moment, Tori accepts the offer. Tori and Trina enter Hollywood Arts. During her first day at Hollywood Arts, Tori gets lost and meets Robbie Shapiro, a shy boy who often speaks through his ventriloquist dummy, Rex. Tori also meets Cat Valentine (Ariana Grande), a hyper and happy, but sensitive girl who is easily upset, often shouting, "What's that supposed to mean!?" when she feels offended.

Robbie (Matt Bennett) (through Rex) gives Tori directions to her first class with Mr. Sikowitz, and when Tori enters the classroom, she accidentally bumps into Beck Oliver, spilling his coffee on his shirt. Tori then rubs the coffee off of his shirt. When Beck's short-tempered and overprotective girlfriend, Jade West, walks in, she becomes mad at Tori for rubbing her boyfriend, which in her books is a flirtatious move.

Tori is introduced to Sikowitz to whom she gives $2 to after mistaking him for a homeless person.

During an improvisation exercise, Sikowitz asks Jade to choose four other students to act with. She chooses Cat, Beck, Tori, and Eli. He asks Robbie to pick a setting, and he chooses 'home.' And AndrÃ© chooses 'big news,' as the situation. Just before they begin, Jade asks Tori to go and wait in the hallway.

The scene starts with Beck (Avan Jogian)(the husband) getting fired from his job, and Cat and Eli (the kids) complaining about this situation. Jade tries to cheer them up by telling them that she got them a new dog, and Tori enters and gets onto the stage. At first, Tori did not play the proper way of a dog, but then Jade told Sikowitz (Eric Lange) to tell Tori to act like a real dog. Tori then does so. Jade claims that dogs usually have fleas and ticks in their fur, and schemingly tells the kids that coffee is a good way to get them out. Beck and AndrÃ© tried to warn her to not do it, but Jade pours an entire cup of coffee on Tori's head, as revenge for 'flirting' with her boyfriend.

Embarrassed and upset, Tori runs from the room and attempts to call her mother, Holly Vega, hoping that she can take her out of the school. AndrÃ© meets up with Tori in the hallway and takes her phone from her. Tori feels that she should simply give up, and face the fact that she isn't unique at all. AndrÃ© then tells her that everybody is unique and special in their own way, and dissuades her from walking away because of Jade.

At home, Tori is watching the video of her performing at the Big Showcase. Trina then comes over, convincing her to stay at the school. Tori does not want to come back though. Trina tells Tori that she actually liked Tori's performance, which Tori thanks, but then chimes in to say that if she would've performed, she would've been amazing.

On Tori's second day at Hollywood Arts, Tori is chosen to pick the actors for a game of Alphabet Improv. She picks AndrÃ©, Cat, Beck, and Jade. During the game, Jade and Tori are fighting (but they follow the rules) while the other actors are out. Beck also fainted, which left Jade and Tori for most of the game. Tori tries her best to push Jade hard enough to get out of the game, until Jade gets eliminated. Beck wakes up again, and tries to make Beck feel better by kissing him, as Tori gets her revenge on Jade by kissing Beck, which is the start of Jade and Tori's rivalry for. (see: Jori).
