The gang is understandably confused and upset. Ryan says he wishes he could go back but that he learned everything he believes from John May and the message that "he lives" is a dagger in Anna's eye. He apologizes to everyone and Erica says no more lies.

A man from the safe company comes to hit the reset button for Valerie who successfully opens the safe.

Chad comes to chat with Anna again and tosses pictures at her of potential live aboard candidates- they all have common issue, infertility, bad health streaks, broken toys he calls them. Chad wonders why they're interested in these people. Anna says she sees the inner worth of people and Vs and that she wouldn't just discard them like humans would He gets right in her face and says he's not buying it and if he can uncover stuff like this in half a day imagine how far he would get with more time. She asks what he wants. He says he doesn't want to be ordinary. She says he isn't ordinary. He says that's why he'll keep digging until he has enough interesting information to run the healing center story, unless she gives him something bigger to run with. He says he can protect her but the question is can they keep helping each other? She says she thinks they'll be helping each other for some time to come. He leaves.

Back at the church the gang waits for news. Joshua calls and says Georgie is alive and hasn't broken. He can't help him now under all of this scrutiny but that he might be able to smuggle him out during the beginning of the live aboard program. Georgie tells them that he's better and he's glad they're safe. Ryan promises to get him out of there. Georgie says no, it's what the Vs are waiting for and that they'll get caught. Ryan tells him to hold on. Georgie says he can't and wants to speak to Jack. Jack tries to tell him to hang on. Georgie says he'll see him around and that he's ready to see him family now. Jack blesses him. Joshua looks pensive and then grabs a big syringe and gives him a lethal dose of V juice. The comm device winks out.

In the morning the gang has a stiff drink and toast Georgie over New York newspaper headlines asking who John May is.

Ryan flashes back to John May's funeral. He sat with James that day and quietly consoled him. Valerie approved.

Ryan calls Valerie and leaves a message saying they need to talk when he gets home saying they need to talk because he's not who he says he is. He says there will be no more lies. As we see him leave this message we watch Valerie go through the contents of the safe which includes fake passports and her real sonogram.

When Erica gets home Tyler tells her he knows. Erica says the doctors were wrong and Joe is her dad. He wonders why she didn't tell him. She thought he wouldn't believe her either and she hoped someone would tell her it was wrong. He runs off to his room and she cries and says "it's not true."

Ryan arrives home and Valerie is gone, the closet cleaned out as well as the safe.

On the V ship Anna watches news coverage about John May. Marcus tells her Georgie is dead and they learned nothing from him. He says the Fifth Column message has produced a ground swell. She says they can have this one victory because she's about to deliver them a thousand defeats. We see her in some kind of pool with little white egg-like lights swimming towards her.

description: Chad and Anna are in Geneva, Switzerland for the U.N. Energy Summit, where Anna is going to present a gift of technology to the world. Meanwhile, Erica learns that the V Task Force is investigating The Fifth Column, and Valerie goes on the run, knowing something is different about her baby and not sure she can trust Ryan.
tags: ['man wrapped in a towel', 'punctuation in episode title', 'medical examination', 'bare chested male']
synopsis_with_character_names:
"V" - "We Can't Win" - April 20, 2010

Chad and Anna travel to Geneva for a political forum at which she plans to present to the world the gift of "Blue Energy" which she says offers answers to some of the world's most pressing problems.

The secretary-general head is skeptical of her presence and doesn't want her to present anything. Speaking to Chad off the record he says the V's "gifts" are a drain on the world's bottom line- healing centers are ruining health care and their technology could imperil other industries. Chad thinks he's more worried about commerce than the health of people and the poltician says they're intertwined.

After seeing news of a devastating monsoon in "Timbal" Anna has Marcus send V troops to bring them Blue Energy in an effort to show up the politicians who are still trying to organize their relief response.

It works as planned as Blue Energy restores the power in Timbal. The politicians relent and let her present at the forum. She holds up two little balls and pushes them together. This creates blue and white waves throughout the room that says represent "clean sustainable energy." She says it's the same power that runs their ships. She takes the balls apart and it stops. The group applauds. She says the V needs are simple and her desire to help is genuine. The leader shakes her hand and says they have much to learn from her.

Chad asks him for another off the record comment. The politician, still clearly skeptical, says Anna came under the guise of bringing a gift and played the politics of tragedy to gain clout. He asks if they're just "visitors" why does she need political clout?

Chad comes to the ship and confronts Anna about her savior-dom and asks what would've happened if there hadn't been a tragedy in Timbal. She says there would've been one somewhere else. He says she thinks she's a god. She asks that what makes him. He says a believer and he believes they're not visitors but here to stay but why, for the benefit of Vs or humans? She says to help. He says he wants to be part of doing good if that's what they're doing. She says she needs people she can trust. She asks if he trusts her. He doesn't answer.

Later Marcus wants to know why they're giving humans Blue Energy. Anna says so they can turn it off once the humans are dependent on it.

Back on the New York ship Lisa fails the empathy test admitted by Joshua. She says it must be a mistake, that her assignment to make Tyler fall in love with her distorted the results. He says too bad, Anna said anyone who failed was to be immolated without exception.

On the ship Tyler- who is still mad at Erica- finds Lisa and she says it's a bad time. He's upset and she's empathetic to that. He says he really needs her and to be away from home right now. Her too, she says. They take some kind of small spaceship into the stratosphere. Tyler floats the idea of joining the live-aboard program. They make out. She makes sure they take off their prying-eye camera jackets. The moment of truth upon them Tyler asks if Vs, um, "do this." She says no and then proceeds to do it anyway.

Joshua and his Fifth Column buddy debate over immolating Lisa. Joshua's against it thinking she can be a great asset to the cause. He's known her forever and thinks she may be becoming human. The other dude says they'd never be able to trust her and wonders if it's a trick to test Joshua's own loyalties.

Tyler and Lisa return to the main ship and Joshua says Anna's coming back and wants to see her. Lisa says Tyler has to go. He says he'll see her tomorrow and she just says goodbye.

Anna tells Lisa that the future of their species depends on Lisa's leadership and judgement. She says there is no room for human emotion or weakness of any kind. She hands her an egg from the nest that has the growing army of soldiers in it and breaks it between their hands. She says Joshua told her she passed the empathy test and that she never doubted her.

Lisa confronts Joshua and he says one day he'll ask a favor from her and she'll comply.

Through an FBI investigation Erica and the V-hunting gang learn that the Vs have killed another Fifth Column cell. One guy survived the attack- Alex Caruso. After Jack visits his dad in the hospital they track him down. He's freaked. He explains he's Fifth Column and they set up a meeting after seeing the message on the ship. The V showed up and now they know names of other FC peeps thanks to an FC website. Since there was a hard drive missing Erica knows the Vs have the info and thinks they'll pick 'em off one by one. Hobbes want to avoid that by using Caruso as bait. Erica doesn't want to kill, but interrogate when they catch him. Alex is up for it. Jack is bummed since he promised Alex's dad he'd keep him safe but he suits up.

Ryan says the Vs are usually about close combat with knives but when they set Alex as bait at an amusement park they send a sniper who kills Alex. Erica runs him down. He gets the upper hand but Jack shoots him and, to their horror, they discover the assassin is human. Tied up for interrogation they ask him why he is working as a hired killer for the Vs and he says because there's no way the humans can win.

Ryan- who has been looking for Val since she took off after discovering Ryan is covering something up- has Erica trace her cell phone. She traces it to a V healing center. The V doctor scans the baby, freaks slightly but then says it's not serious. Val wants to see. He won't let her. Ryan comes in and kills/immolates the V just as he's about to harm Val. They take off.

description: With the sniper under their control, Erica wants him to reveal the location of the hard drive with the names of the fifth columnists. Kyle is prepared to do whatever is necessary to get the information but Father Jack is somewhat reticent. Ryan tells Valerie the truth about himself. She is disbelieving and finds it incredible he has kept this from her all of this time... Read all
tags: ['punctuation in episode title', 'torture']
synopsis_with_character_names:
We pick up right where we left off, with Erica interrogating Jeffrey Barnes in a basement. He says the Vs told him they'd kill his wife and daughter if he didn't kill who they wanted. She asks who else was on their hit list. She wants to know who knows about Fifth Column. They don't believe him when he says he doesn't know.

Val and Ryan race through the streets outside the healing center. She wants to know why he attacked the doctor. Standing on the street he confesses that he's a visitor. She doesn't believe him at first, but he tells her the visitors want their baby.

On board the New York mothership, Anna welcomes the humans for the live aboard program. She's interrupted by Marcus telling her about Val's half-human, half-V baby.

Anna tells Marcus finding Val and Ryan is his top priority.

At their house, Val doesn't want to go along with Ryan, but he tells her the Vs have infiltrated everywhere and they can't trust anyone. He says they'll kill them if they find them. Just then two Vs break into their house. Ryan fends them off, killing them. She sees one of them cut through to their V-skin and suddenly realizes that's what her baby might look like.

Anna convenes with the top Vs from all 29 ships, pissed that it turns out Vs and humans can mate. She says it puts the species at risk and the Fifth Column could breed a species of hybrids to fight them. She wants them to speed up the live aboard program and commence extraction of their human residents immediately.

She wants the mother and father dissected and the baby destroyed.

Ryan takes Val to see Dr. Leah Pearlman, the V doctor. Val guesses that she's a visitor and Leah admits it. Val's mad at Ryan for lying to her. Val says the Vs gave her a vitamin shot at the healing center. Turns out it was R6 - a way for the Vs to track her. Leah has a shot that can mask the tracking, but it takes 24 hours to take effect. Val takes the shot.

Leah tells Ryan there's nothing more important than the baby.

Ryan calls Erica to update her. He says he's going to stay with the Thompsons, some old friends in the country, and won't be back. Leah goes with them. He urges her to tell Ty the truth about the visitors.

Chad gives his report on his brain aneurysm and the Vs plan for surgery.

Erica comes home to talk to Ty and finds him watching something about the church of V. She tries to talk to him, but he runs off to meet Lisa.

Anna tells Lisa she needs Tyler to be part of the live aboard program and remain on the ship until he's no longer needed. And then.... (she doesn't answer, ominously).

Anna is briefed that their doctors are already experimenting on the humans. Marcus tells her about the two visitors Ryan killed. She orders him to release a soldier, even though none has ever set foot on earth. Marcus is to follow him every step of the way.

In the basement, Kyle breaks out the heretic's fork, a medieval torture device, and is about to use it on Barnes when Father Jack returns and tells him that until they know for sure he's lying, they'll treat him with decency.

Joshua's call from the mothership comes through.

Lisa greets Tyler with Anna. He's psyched about the program, but knows his mom won't like it. Anna suggests Lisa stop by later and reassure her.

Father Jack relays Joshua's news, about the soldier after Ryan and Val. But they have no way to contact them. Erica says the prints are back on the sniper, he's ex-military like Hobbes thought. She's heading to his house, hoping for a Fifth Column list to help them contact Ryan and Val.

Ryan gets reacquainted with the Thompsons, who have a cabin in the Adirondacks they can use.

Marcus finds their R6 signal wasn't working, but the soldier has found them.

We see a bad-looking V outside the country home.

On the mothership, Chad undergoes his procedure as the cameras roll. He's not cut open, instead lasers whip around his head and his brain is accessed on a computer screen.

He wakes up to Anna telling him his surgery was a success. He thanks her. She says she wishes all humans shared his sentiment, which of course gets him to ask if there's a problem. She tells him about Fifth Column and he offers to run a story on them.

Erica visits Barnes' wife. She says their daughter was paralyzed from the neck down -- but just then a girl walks into the kitchen, fine. She says the Visitors healed her.

Erica asks to use the bathroom but instead goes poking around upstairs. In an office she finds an external hard drive and takes it.

Back in the basement with Barnes still hung up, they get a few names and partial addresses from it, including Thompson. Barnes says he won't help terrorists and the Vs didn't have to ask him to kill for them. Erica tells him he has innocent blood on his hands. He says they don't believe in fighting, so people like him have to do it for them.

Erica asks again where the Thompsons live. She says either he'll tell her, or eventually he'll tell Hobbes. Hobbes suggests Father Jack leave the room.

Later, Hobbes joins Erica and Father Jack in the car announcing that he knows where the Thompson's farm is.

In the farm house, they're getting ready to leave when the lights go out. Mr. Thompson passes out shotguns.

Mr. Thompson is working his way through the house when the soldier drops from the ceiling and snaps his neck. Mrs. Thompson goes down next.

The soldier uses his special V Soldier hearing and listens for heartbeats in the house.

Ryan leads Val and Leah down the upstairs hallway when suddenly the soldier busts through the ceiling onto Val. She gets free and Ryan takes the soldier on. The soldier gets in a few good licks and knocks Ryan down when Erica and Father Jack bust in the door and shoot it. It runs off.

They run for the car, where Val and the doctor are waiting, and the soldier follows. As it runs around the corner of the house, Hobbes sticks an ax in its chest. The soldier is knocked down, but seems unfazed by what should be a mortal wound.

They drive off, leaving the soldier there.

At a train station, Ryan explains that soldiers are bred to fight from eggs Anna laid. They say their good byes to Ryan.

Hobbes says he knows some people who can disappear Barnes into a secret prison overseas. Erica doesn't object.

Ryan joins Val and Leah to get on the train. Val doesn't want him to come with them. She doesn't want to see him again. She doesn't forgive him and says he was only protecting himself. She says good-bye.

Chad visits Father Jack. He tells him he thinks Anna is keeping secrets from them. He mentions the Fifth Column. Father Jack says he hasn't heard of them. Chad says he's worried about the visitors and wants to know he's not alone. Father Jack says he'll let him know if he hears anything.

Marcus tells Anna they lost the hybrid baby. She tells him to keep looking. Chad comes to see her. He says he might have something for her on the Fifth Column and will let her know. She's pleased.

Erica has a stiff drink at home alone. The doorbell rings. It's Lisa. She says looking for Tyler and asks to come in and wait.

Erica makes her tea. Lisa says Tyler has learned a lot from the Vs. She casually mentions the live aboard program and Erica tries to contain her rage and fear. She says she feels like Tyler is slipping away from her and she wants him to be happy. Tyler comes home.

He has flowers for Lisa. She asks to talk to him. She tells him she doesn't think he should do the live aboard program because his mom really needs him. He says he doesn't want to stay there. Erica can hear him. Lisa says she should leave and goes.

Tyler confronts his mom, asking what she said to Lisa. He doesn't believe her when she says nothing. He tells her he's moving up to the ship and there's nothing she can do about it.

Lisa tells Anna that Tyler won't be doing live aboard because his mom needs him. She tells Anna she can be more effective if she has Erica's cooperation. Anna flinches, but says she trusts Lisa's judgment.

Kyle Hobbes marches Barnes deep into the woods. "First you're going to tell me everything you know about the Vs," Hobbes says, "then you're going to beg me to kill you."

description: Joshua informs Ryan that Anna will be dispatching a shuttle full of trackers to locate and eliminate fifth columnists. He, Father Jack and Kyle decide to shoot it down before it lands. Not all is as it seems however and it's all part of Anna's plan to discredit the fifth column. There's more to the live aboard program that meets the eye. Chad is still carrying on his ... Read all
synopsis_with_character_names:
"V" - "Hearts and Minds" - May 4, 2010

6:00 p.m.

A V shuttle is arriving in the woods. Hobbes shoots it down with a a surface-to-air missile. Jack, Ryan, and Hobbes run to the wreckage and discover it had human beings on it.

Erica looks at bloody crime scene photo at the FBI headquarters. Everyone's phones start ringing. Ryan calls Erica and tells her there are no survivors. They flee the scene.

On the mothership Marcus informs Anna the shuttle was successfully shot down as she expected. They planned it as a frame up job of the Fifth Column.

Twelve Hours Earlier

Ryan investigates his trashed apartment. Joshua calls and tells him Anna is sending a V shuttle filled with trackers to find Fifth Column. Ryan says they'll shoot it down. Joshua says they need V technology to do that and he will supply it but they need to move fast.

Erica walks in on Father Jack working out on a heavy bag and jokes he's dropping his right. He asks if she can do better. She can and does. Hobbes enters and says it's like "The Thorn Birds" up in here. They chat about favorite boxers. Hers is Sugar Ray Leonard. Ryan enters and explains about the V tracker shuttle. He says the trackers are like soldiers with super senses but they can blend better. He explains about blowing up the shuttle. Erica is concerned. So is Hobbes but more from a PR standpoint, since it will make them seem like terrorists. Ryan thinks Anna will keep it from the press to contain the damage since Joshua swore no people would be on it. He says they have to shoot it down in order to preseve their anonymity. Erica gives the go ahead.

Chad returns to visit Father Jack at St. Josephine's. He says he knows in his gut it's not safe for humans to be so trusting of the V's with regards to the live aboard program. He says he wants to join the fight with the Fifth Column. Jack says he hasn't heard anything. Chad says that's too bad since he has an all-access pass to the mothership, Anna, and the V-only shuttles. He says he could be a big asset to the FC. Father Jack tells him to stay away from the V-only shuttles today.

Lisa happens upon a young mother with her baby crying over a nightmare from the night before. Lisa asks her what's wrong. The girl says in the dream she was taken by doctors and poked by hundreds of needles. She says she knows it was a dream but it felt real. Lisa comforts her. (Anna watches this on video).

Chad approaches and Anna thanks him for his report on the live-aboard program. He tells her there are whispers of a threat to the V-only shuttles. She tells him he's come a long way since they met. She asks who his source is. He says that's not how it works, he has to protect his sources. She understands but says there are no V-only shuttles today. Marcus enters, Chad leaves. She tells him they haven't tamped down on all of the Fifth Column on the ship since word of the trackers got out. Marcus says he'll investigate and wonders if they should still send the trackers. She says she has a better idea: if the humans want to blow up a shuttle, they'll let them.

4:45 p.m.

The gang assembles and Hobbes says he got the V code. Father Jack is worried about doing this. The other say they have to.

We fast forward to the moment of the shuttle destruction and the call to Erica.

Erica freaks and calls Tyler, praying he'll answer. He does. She explains about the V shuttle. Tyler flips on the news and he's now freaking that Lisa might be on the shuttle. She tries to reassure him. He says she might be wrong about who was on the shuttle. Boy was she.

Various law enforcement teams investigate the scene. Erica walks through in a daze.

Back in the basement headquarters they try to figure out how it happened. Ryan doesn't know and says Joshua is trying to figure it out. Father Jack is especially upset saying they either value life or they are just like V's. He asks Erica where she is with it. With him, she says. Hobbes says they have bigger problems now since they might not have made a clean getaway. Father Jacks says he's out and stalks off. Hobbes talks about his favorite boxer, someone who was knocked down a lot but always got up. He asks if they want to be the guy who gets knocked down or the one who gets back up.

Tyler arrives at the ship and asks Anna if Lisa is okay. She is. Anna is impressed with is commitment to Lisa. Tyler says he'll do the live-aboard program. Anna says Lisa will be pleased and tells him to go home and pack so he can return and be with Lisa all the time.

Erica's boss Kendrick asks where she was when she returns. She explains about Tyler. He says he wants her on it especially since it seems Fifth Column-y. Malick has a tire tread and some forensice evidence and they have toll booth security footage they can comb through.

Erica goes to work and calls Ryan about the toll booth. He says they did drive through one. She gives him the info and tells him to wipe the toll booth video footage. As she looks at other evidence on her monitor she realizes that the bodies found at the scene were people who were already dead. They didn't kill anyone after all. The Vs filled the shuttle with dead humans. He asks if she has evidence and she says she's looking at it. But as she says this the file disappears saying it has been permanently deleted. Ryan wonders who would do that and Erica checks and it was Kendrick who she sees putting on his coat and saying he's headed out to work on the toll booth footage. Erica tells Ryan to get moving now.

In a race against time Ryan and Hobbes manage to destroy the footage on servers at a security facility just as Kendrick arrives.

Chad goes to visit Father Jack. He asks about him protecting him by telling him about the shuttles. Jack says he was just passing on a rumor. Chad says he has to report on this attack to keep his position intact and be an assest to the resistance. He says he has to come down on hard so if Jack is Fifth Column things are about to get very hard. Jack says it's a good thing he's not FC. Chad says the FC caught Anna off guard. Jack can't believe he asked her about it. He says he did it indirectly.

Anna is recording several takes of a message talking about Vs valuing life. She tells Marcus she's pleased that the FC will now be considered terrorists just as she planned. Lisa enters. She asks which take is better. Marcus says they both seem sufficient. Lisa says the second one seems more sincere. Anna notes her grasp of human emotion seems pretty good. Lisa thanks her and leaves.

The older priest comes and asks Jack if he's okay. He says his faith in himself has been shaken. The older priest tells him to get back to his core values. Jack says he's made terrible choices. The elder priest thinks he means the war. Jack says he doesn't. If it's a matter of law maybe he needs to make a different kind of confession the priest says.

Ryan calls Erica and says the footage wipe was a success. She hangs up as Kendrick walks up.He says he had luck. Even though there was a footage wipe they figured the terrorists had done a dry run earlier in the day and grabbed that footage and got a suspect. Kendrick leads her to interrogation and says it's not your typical terrorist. He opens the door and Father Jack is sitting there looking guilty.

Kendrick interrogates Jack about the tire tread and video. He says he can read the guilt in Jack's eyes and is giving him the chance to unburden himself. Jack is about to say something when Erica pounds the table and demands that Jack answer him. She asks Kendrick to bring in some crime scene stuff. When he leaves she quickly fills Jack in on the V set up and tells him to look scared. Kendrick and Alex return with a picture of the tire tread. Jack gets all huffy and says there are thousands of vehicles in the church fleet with those tires and he was on a public parkway visiting a parishioner whom he was counseling about her adultery. He hopes that they have more to go on in such a high profile case then tire treads and toll booths. He tells them to charge him or let him go. Erica gives him a sly smile. Kendrick tells Alex to cut him loose.

Lisa enters a door with some odd writing on it and sees the corridors and doctors described by the pregnant woman earlier and sees a woman placed on a table and with hundreds of needles poking in to her as doctors look on. She says the faces of others this was done to.

Later she goes to visit Tyler. She tells him she doesn't want him to move on to the ship with me. She says he's a nice guy but she doesn't feel about him like he does about her. He gets mad and says that's not true. She says her mother likes him and she didn't want to disappoint her. He asks about what they shared on the shuttle, what that was about. She says she just wanted to see what "it" was like. He tells her to go. (Obviously, she's protecting him. She's not wearing her V jacket.)

Anna gives her press conference talking about how they value life. She mourns over the shuttle attack and the lives lost. She says their biggest flaw may be that they're too trusting. She demonizes FC for demonizing them for being different. Kendrick watches and tells Malick to get on the ship and reassure Anna the FBI is doing all it can. Anna continues at the conference saying the V's are considering leaving since humans are getting caught in the crossfire. She says they are always of peace and seems on the verge of tears. As she turns she gives a sly smile to Marcus.

Erica goes back to look at the computer log of the file being deleted. Kendrick calls her in to the war room to talk FC. He says he's not letting anyone or anything else harm the Visitors and he's starting a task force to investigate FC. He wants her to head it up and no expense or resource will be spared and she'll be partnering with Malick.

Malick goes to the mothership to talk to Marcus. She gets Anna instead. It turns out that she's a V and she's the one who delted the damning photos using Kendrick's passcode. Malick tells her about the task force and that she's now ready to serve their people and track down FC with the full weight of the U.S. government at her disposal.

Ryan, Hobbes, and Erica watch a Chad report about sympathy for the V's and talk about sticking together. Jack arrives and explains about warning Chad and says he could be an ally and that he's been careful. Hobbes is mad that Jack brought all of this on and them and says they can't trust anyone. They talk about the value of life and not stooping to actual terrorism. Hobbes says they can call it what they want but it's what they are now. Erica says they're the only ones willing to do it. Hobbes welcomes Jack back.

Erica arrives home and Tyler apologizes about going behind her back. He admits Lisa was just using him and he's really upset. She consoles him.

Marcus tells Anna world leaders have been calling offering condolences, to help find FC since they're afraid the Visitors will leave. Anna is pleased and plans to use their fear against them. Lisa comes and tells Anna she failed in getting Tyler to live aboard. She says she pushed too hard and pushed him away and that his mother's pull was too strong. Anna says she understands and that they'll need to find a better incentive for bring Tyler in. She then punches Lisa in the face. She says she will tell Tyler she was injured in a FC attack and that there's no greater incentive for a man than a damsel in distress. She turns to a doctor and tells him to break her legs. Lisa doesn't look happy.

description: In the aftermath of the downed shuttle, Anna continues to manipulate human emotions and arranges for one of the Vs to be badly beaten and then left in alley. She announces that they no longer feel safe on Earth and will therefore leave leading to an outcry and world-wide support for them to stay. As part of her plan, Anna ensures that the attackers are identified, onc... Read all
tags: ['one word episode title']
synopsis_with_character_names:
"V" - "Fruition" - May 11, 2010

In a dark alley a dumpster diver finds Lisa's broken body. Erica and Malick investigate, she is surprised to see its Lisa. Malick asks if Tyler knows she's a V. Erica says she doesn't know. Erica goes to her and says she'll find out who did this to her: they also carved a"V" into her face. Erica asks if she recognized the "men" who hurt her. She flashes back to her mom hitting her and says no. Erica hugs her and says it's going to be okay.

Anna watches this from the ship and says it's time for Joshua to go down to the healing center to fix Lisa's legs but not her face. She says she wants the world to see what the Fifth Column has done to her daughter since a picture's worth a thousand words.

Hobbes watches news on Lisa's assault and is surprised to seek sketches of the suspects include one that looks like him.

Chad also watches a breaking news report that Anna is going to make an announcement. A colleague can't believe this is how Chad, the "voice of Vs", is getting the news like everyone else.

At the church Jack and Father Travis have a full house praying for the Vs. Jack is worried they're praying more for the Vs than themselves. Father Travis tells him to try and find room in his heart for the Vs like his parishioners have.

At the hospital Erica shows mug shots to Lisa, including Hobbes and some other dude with glasses. She says she's sure these are the men who attacked her. Anna arrives and Erica is shocked to hear Lisa is Anna's daughter. Anna pretends to be loving and caring and concerned.

Erica takes her aside to talk and Anna reall pours it on as she looks at the pictures of Lisa's injuries. She can't believe the Fifth Column is terrorizing people as humans have accepted them. Erica shows Anna the mug shots, she says she's never seen these men before. Anna asks about Tyler. Erica says he's heard and is very upset. Anna says he's lucky he wasn't with Lisa when this happened. Erica agrees. Anna says as a mother Erica must empathize. Erica, pointedly says, as a mother she knows if anyone tried to hurt her son there's nothing she wouldn't do to stop them. Anna says then she's sure Erica will find the perps before they hurt someone else's child.

At Fifth Column HQ, Jack and Ryan confront Hobbes, who says he didn't do it and he is being framed again. He says the last time the Vs framed him he had been hired to kill the other guy named as a suspect, glasses guy Lawrence Parker.

We switch to FBI HQ and get the rundown on Parker: a weapons engineer, CIA analyst, went missing four weeks ago, has top secret access. Kendrick thinks Hobbes is the key and they need to find him. Erica suggests the go for Parker, a civilian, instead. Kendrick says she better be right.

Tyler goes to FBI and asks after Lisa and apologizing for not telling her that Lisa was a visitor. She takes Ty to visit Lisa who is having her legs fixed by Joshua. Lisa didn't want him to see her like this. He says he needed to know she was okay. As they speak, Joshua introduces himself to Erica in the outer room. He tells her that the two perps are innocent and that Anna inflicted the injuries to Lisa. Joshua says he doesn't know why but the two framed men have answers and she needs to find them before Anna does. Erica asks if Tyler is in danger. Joshua says that at first Tyler was an assignment but now Lisa's feelings are real and that he doesn't think she would hurt him.

Lisa says she didn't mean the things she said to Tyler about not wanting to see him, she was confused because she's never had feelings like this before.

Anna arrives and puts on Lisa's shoes and says it's time to go. She and Tyler hold hands until the last moment. Erica looks at her lovestruck son sympathetically.

A group of V supporters stand outside the healing center. Chad spies Marcus coming out and asks why he wasn't consulted on helping to control the story. Marcus says Anna has been indisposed. Marcus says they already have it under control. Anna emerges with Lisa and says not to look at the cameras or give eye contact because the less she gives the more poeple will want. Chad tries to get Anna's attention. She whispers to Marcus they're cutting Chad off for now but will bring him back when the time is right. She steps to the podium and reveals that this terrible hate crime has been perpetrated on her daughter. She says they came in peace and offered healing powers and energy and have been repaid with this attack and because of that now they're d leaving.

At FC HQ Ryan says they're lying. Hobbes agree and says she's putting on a show. Ryan points out that she could've healed Lisa's face wounds and didn't. Erica wonders what Anna's interest is in Hobbes and Parker. Hobbes doesn't know. Erica thinks Parker is key. Hobbes also thinks she should ask Tyler if the "lizard princess" told him anything. She doesn't want to. Ryan thinks bringing him into the FC may be the best way of protecting him. She ignores this.

Hobbes goes to his shady lady friend and is tipped off that Parker is holed up in Chinatown. Hobbes tosses his apartment and steals his hard drive. He calls Erica and gives her the deets.

Chad goes to the ship and Marcus tells him Anna has been too busy dealing with the assault and the exodus to talk to him. Chad doesn't believe they're leaving. Marcus says they have to. Chad says he can help by swaying his viewers to protest. Marcus says he's a journalist, tasked to reporting the news not editorializing.

Marcus goes to Anna and she says they have Chad right where they want him: desperate to have them stay for his own career and ready to skillfully persuade his viewers. She tells him to have the Shanghai ship take off immediately. It does.

Later we see a "special commentary" from Chad who says the Vs saved his life and humans who care about a better, more peaceful, technologically advanced world should make it known they want the Visitors to stay.

Ryan and Jack sit outside Parker's place and Jack asks Ryan what's wrong, why he's been different since Val left. Ryan says John May convinced him that human emotions were good but now that he feels so bereft without Val he's not sure if it's true and he can continue the fight. Jack says he can if he has faith.

Erica joins them in the car and tells them to cover the front and back if Parker tries to bolt.

She goes to the apartment and ID's herself as FBI. Parker he says he disappeared because someone came after him and even though he didn't assault Lisa he's running because he's afraid. He isn't sure why the Vs are after him but tells Erica he's been working on an organic compound that was supposed to help with global warming but had bad side effects, algae that caused viruses in amphibians and ... yup, probably lizards... so the project was abandoned. He points out someone stole his hard drive and all his research. Unfortunately it's useless without his colleagues collaborative research, they worked separately so as to be indispensable. So whatever it is- and there are green discs in his briefcase- could kill the Vs. Erica pockets one of the discs.

The FBI roars up outside and Jack calls Erica to warn her. She gets Parker to give her the names of the people who were researching the compound with him and says she will do what she can to help him. She then drops and cuffs him just as the Feds bust in. Kendrick says it's nice work on Erica's part but Malick is suspicious that she was there already.

A V shuttle leaves the White House.

Parker is brought into FBI. Kendrick says the White House has persuaded to keep the Vs on earth. They also want to form a joint human-V task force in which suspected FC terrorists would be remanded to a V ship for questioning starting with Parker. Bad news for Parker.

Erica calls the three musketeers and reports that all of the scientists on Parker's research project are reported missing. Ryan thinks Anna has them. Erica says they have to hold on to Parker somehow, she hopes to get through to Lisa. They're worried about this. Erica says if Anna is going to use Tyler she will return the favor.

Anna, Lisa, and Marcus arrive and Erica pulls Lisa aside for "prep" to confront her attacker. She gives Lisa a picture of Tyler to bring in with her for the line-up to give her comfort and strength. She tells her that this man's fate rests in Lisa's hands and that she cannot condemn an innocent man and she needs to be 100 percent sure. Lisa is about to spill and then Anna busts in.

Lisa goes into the line-up and points to Parker. Erica asks if she's sure. She says she's positive. They depart with Anna's thanks to Erica. Parker is hauled away. Erica says that stopping the FC will be her first priority. Anna says they're bound to cross paths again. Erica says she's not going anywhere. Anna says neither is she.

Hobbes is on the phone to someone saying he has Parker's research and wonders how much the person on the other end is willing to pay.

On the ship, Anna thanks Chad for his report. Chad calls Anna on manipulating him into making that plea. She says all she cares about is peace and the safety of her people. She wants his help in rooting out FC and wants his FC source. He says that would be a breach of his journalistic ethics. She said he already did it once today, what's one more time? She says she's looking out for both of them.

At gang HQ, Hobbes says he's worried about Ryan's moodiness. Ryan says he's on his game and for Hobbes to stay on his. Hobbes gives a speech about special op soldiers and how they don't carry family photos or mementos because if someone discovered them they'd be used against them. Hobbes knows the Vs hit Ryan where it hurts regarding Val and the pain he's feeling will be used against him by the Vs and that in war emotions will get him killed and to burn memories of Val from his heart. Ryan leaves.

On the ship Anna and Lisa survey the eggs of Anna's army, it will be born soon. They're gross and squishy and "Alien"-like. Anna commends Lisa on how well she did today. Lisa promises to keep Erica close and convince her that her kind feelings toward her are real as she did with Tyler.

Lisa goes to Joshua and asks if the eggs are allowed to hatch the soldiers will they destroy the FC? Joshua says they will.

Tyler watches a news report on Parker's arrest. Erica returns and Tyler says she's a hero. So she's heard she says. He says her catching Parker means a lot to him and he thanks her. (He thinks she assaulted Lisa, remember?) Tyler wants to make sure Erica is okay with him dating a V. She admits it's a little weird but she'll deal. He thanks her and walks off. She calls him back and says he was wrong about the Visitors and he would like to get to know Lisa and Anna better. He likes this idea. She looks a little sick.

Marcus reports that the fleet from their home planet will soon be in radar range. Anna says they'll make sure human technology doesn't pick it up. He says fear of the FC is spreading among the 29 ships. She says they just need their queen to assuage their fears. She sends out another bliss missive. Joshua and Lisa exchange glances.

Ryan looks at a picture of him and Val and starts to get the Anna message, he looks up and soaks it in. He then shuts the blinds. His phone gets a text from Val's doctor. "Val's water just broke."

One of the soldier eggs begins to hatch.

A car with tinted windows pulls up in an alley. Marcus is inside. He is meeting Hobbes who says Parker's research is in a safe place and Marcus can have it when Hobbes gets what he wants: a bunch of money and a clean slate with the Vs. Marcus departs without agreeing to anything.

description: Erica decides they need to make a statement about their opposition to the Vs. They decide to go aboard the mother ship and destroy Anna's eggs which are about to hatch and produce her army of warriors. She has an opportunity to get aboard the spacecraft when Tyler once again raises the issue of joining the live aboard program and Anna and Lisa invite them for dinner. ... Read all
tags: ['fifth columnist', 'color in episode title', 'infiltrator', 'saboteur', 'space shuttle', 'space ship', 'space babe', 'space alien', 'lizard', 'girl from outer space']
synopsis_with_character_names:
"V" - "Red Sky" - May 18, 2010

It's go time on the "V" finale.

First up a V soldier finds Val, and abducts her back to the New York mother-ship.

Tyler extends the dinner invite from Anna to Erica, so her fears can be assuaged about the live aboard program.

The gang decides this is it: Erica will use her dinner invite, to get into Anna's private quarters and kill the soldier eggs, with a nifty explosive devised by Hobbes. Hobbes will distract Marcus. They contact Joshua who likes the plan, but is cut off before it can be finalized. Father Jack says he'll send a message to him via Chad. Ryan is planning on going to help too, until he receives word of Val's abduction. Instead of helping he goes to the visitor center, and causes a ruckus, so he will be taken aboard. When he arrives he, and Val make up and he tells her to let the V doctors help deliver the baby. They do and the baby and mama are doing fine. Anna shows up and kills Val. Ryan is allowed to come in and mourn Val. Anna returns, and won't admit to killing her. Ryan grabs her neck but she pushes him off, and says it's his fault for not bringing Val in sooner. Anna tells Ryan the pain he feels, is what she was trying to protect him from, human emotion. She's sorry he lost her but says he now has her. She then grabs him for a little one one on bliss session. It works, she brings his baby to him, a tail pokes out of the blanket, and she welcomes Ryan home.

Hobbes lures Marcus, with the promised research from last week. However, he claims he only has half to keep the bargaining upper hand. He asks why the V's have been framing him. Marcus says they did in order to hire him, and whether he knows it or not he's been working for them for years already, he just didn't know it. Since they know he's a man with a history of selling his loyalty to highest bidder, they want him to infiltrate Fifth Column. Hobbes asks what happens if he says no. Marcus says he won't because they found "her", and shows Hobbes a picture of someone he obviously cares about although we don't see it.

Father Jack gives Decker the message and tells him to leave it in the medical lab. Chad dutifully goes to Anna, who tells him to go ahead and deliver the message in order to see what happens. Chad goes to medical to deliver the message to Joshua saying it's from a friend on the ground. Joshua says he has none. Joshua's crony freaks and says they have to send a message to Erica to know the mission is still on. He does, thinking it's a quick one that can't be traced. It can however, security comes in, and grab Joshua's colleague and isolate Joshua for Anna to deal with, surrounded by blue cylinder of energy.

Chad goes back in to medical, and Joshua realizes he set him up, he tells Chad he will be skinned alive. Chad doesn't believe that saying "Anna wouldn't do that." Joshua says "he's been blinded, and that the humans are in danger." He informs him that the Fifth Column will save humanity. He adds for good measure, that Anna didn't cure his aneurysm, she gave him one. Chad still can't believe it. Joshua gives him the directions to a restricted corridor, where he'll see what's being done to humans. Chad goes a hunting, and finds the secret hallway He sees the Live Aboard humans being tortured on the, spiny tables

Erica and Tyler arrive for dinner with Anna, and Lisa. Erica gives up her gun, and is forced to give up her purse with the explosive. The quartet has a pleasant meal, over which they discuss single motherhood, and Anna claims to be impressed by Erica's juggling. She promises they'll take good care of Tyler. Erica asks if the ship is safe from the Fifth Column. Anna says it is, and pours Erica some wine. Erica gets a call, claiming it's work, she walks out. Lisa follows, and says she knows why Erica is there. She hands her a blue energy grenade which, if placed properly, will destroy the eggs.

Lisa, now firmly on the Fifth Column's side, goes to Joshua, and gets him out of isolation. She calls him very brave, and touches his face. He thanks her, and calls her his queen.

Dinner is interrupted by security, that needs to take Anna to safety, because there's a Fifth Column attack under way. Erica asks for her gun, and Anna okays this. They all go running off. Erica runs off to the egg pool. She tosses the grenade, and runs. It explodes, and throws her through the door.

Outside there's pandemonium in the halls, with people shooting at each other. Erica wants to save Joshua, but he says she has to kill him, to keep suspicion off herself. She does, reluctantly.

Later, Anna thanks her for saving lives. She also mentions the person Erica shot wasn't a V, but a human who infiltrated, and stole a uniform.

Anna spies Chad she heads over, and thanks him for delivering the message. He keeps playing the part, and claims he's glad they won't be driven out. She thanks him for his loyalty, and says without them, he'd lose everything, and sweetly threatens his job, and health.

Anna returns to Erica, who offers thanks for the fun night. Anna suggests they do it again sometime, and Erica assures her they can count on it.

Meanwhile back at the church, the older priest has come across Father Jack's homily which is anti-V. The older father says, "They're a miracle, and maybe they are god's handiwork." Father Jack says he's going to speak from his heart. The older priest says no messages of hate, will come from his pulpit, and tells Jack to write a new homily, or find a new church to preach in.

Erica and Hobbes show up in time for homily. Erica thanks Hobbes for coming through with distracting Marcus. Fearlessly Father jack preaches his homily, about the Vs, and how humans should only serve God, and calls the Vs "false prophets." He wonders who will stand with him, and help fight the coming war. Most of the parishioners leave, but a few stay standing with Hobbes, and Erica. The older priest warns Jack that "this will end badly." Father Jack looks willing to risk it. Chad arrives, and gives Jack the nod, they exchange understanding.

Anna and Marcus and Lisa survey the frozen eggs. Anna is bereft, and asks, "Are they all dead?" Marcus replies, that "only 12 soldiers survived, and that their core temperatures were so greatly affected, they are not sure how many will make it." Anna instructs Marcus find out who else beside Joshua was responsible, at whatever the cost. She cries and screams. Lisa is taken aback. Anna is freaked out by herself and asks "what's happening to me?" Marcus says, she is experiencing her first human emotion. Lisa gets a sly Anna-like smile at this thought.

Anna goes to her monitors and calls on the other ships to come forward. Marcus warns against deploying their ships too soon, going as far as to grab her arm to try and stop her. When she completes the command, Marcus asks, "Do you know what you have done?" Anna replies, "Vengeance". As the scene progresses, we see a map of the Earth, with V ships deploying all over it, they appear to be releasing an unknown red chemical, into the atmosphere. The sound of thunder rolls, and music plays as Father Jack, Erica, Kyle, and Chad, all respectfully notice the sky turning red. Anna observes this as Lisa walks in and looks in wonder, as to what is happening. As the music continues we see that V ships have arrived over, Los Angeles, California, Hong Kong, China, and Florance, Italy, all cities appearing to have a Red Sky. The scene then shifts to the New York Mother-ship's Medical Bay. V doctors, under the apparent supervision of Marcus, revive Joshua, who suddenly awakes, and takes a deep breath. Marcus looks at him with a seemingly pleasant smile, and says "Welcome Back".

The episode ends with Anna surveying the skies. Lisa is looking on, from behind her, from her quarters on the New York Mother-Ship which is seen hovering over New York's Central Park.

description: Michaela Quinn, a female doctor in post-Civil War Boston, Massachusetts, finds more than she bargained for when she answers an ad for a doctor in a small town in the Colorado territory.
tags: ['character name in title']
synopsis_with_character_names:
After the death of her father, Dr. Michaela "Mike" Quinn of Boston, Massachusetts watches their medical practice evaporate and decides she must go where she is needed. She answers an ad for a doctor in the Colorado territory, hoping to continue practicing medicine on her own despite her gender and mother's lack of support.

When she arrives in Colorado Springs in 1867, she is met with derision and hostility by most of the townspeople except Charlotte Cooper (Diane Ladd) and "mountain man" Byron Sully (Joe Lando). Charlotte is matron of the local boarding house and struggling to support her three children, Matthew (Chad Allen), Colleen (Erika Flores), and Brian (Shawn Toovey), after her husband skipped town with their savings.

Sully is a reclusive loner who befriended the neighboring Cheyenne and adopted their ways following the death of his wife and daughter during childbirth in 1865. (He is also a sensitive hunk who throws a mean tomahawk.) Charlotte helps Dr. Mike acclimatize and they bond. Sully offers Dr. Mike his abandoned homestead to live in and she accepts. Charlotte, also the town midwife, calls upon Dr. Mike to help with a difficult delivery, and she successfully performs a "radical" cesarean section.

Charlotte is bitten by a rattlesnake and on her deathbed asks Dr. Mike to care for her children. Dr. Mike begins to have more success with the townspeople as a female doctor, but continues to experience hardships and has trouble winning the hearts of the Cooper children. Brian runs away and Sully helps Dr. Mike find him.

She is hit especially hard after failing to get a shipment of medicine in time to treat Maude Bray, who suffers a fatal heart attack. She is hurt and upset by a discouraging letter from her mother which she shares with the Cooper children who finally realize she will be a loving mother and raise them properly.

After the army carries out a vicious surprise attack on the Cheyenne, Sully brings the grievously injured Chief Black Kettle to the homestead, and Dr. Mike saves his life. When he leaves, Chief Black Kettle gives Dr. Mike her Cheyenne name, "Medicine Woman". The town grudgingly begins to accept her as a woman doctor. A surprise visit at the homestead by Sully on Christmas Eve shows Dr. Mike that she has found her place in the new frontier and inherited a loving family.

description: Miss Olive arrives back in town and believes that she should be the one looking after Matthew, Colleen and Brian. She brings with her a sick cowboy who had contracted influenza but everyone is unaware of the exact nature of his illness. Michaela attempts to try her hand at cooking but is unsuccessful. After the cowboy dies and his child becomes ill with the same thing... Read all

description: When a starving orphaned immigrant takes desperate measures to feed his siblings, the only thing standing between him and a noose is Kid Cole, the new sheriff.
tags: ['theft', 'chore', 'adolescent', 'trial', 'punishment', 'competition', 'rascal', 'bully']
synopsis_with_character_names: A gunslinger named Cole (Johnny Cash) arrives looking for a quiet town in which to hang up his guns, but the people of Colorado Springs are itching to lynch an immigrant for cattle rustling. Dr. Mike gets to spend some time with Mattherw's new love interest, Ingrid, an immigrant from Sweden. Matthew learns that she is malnurished, as well as a lot of the other immigrants in her group. Matthew wants to give to them some food, but Ingrid's brother, Jon, insists on working to mend fences to 'pay' for food. Brian and Sully go hunting and find an injured deer, which Brian takes a special interest in, asking Dr. Mike to 'fix her.' In the process, Brian wants to name the deer after Sully and asks him what his first name is. "Byron" is the reply. While mending the fences, Jon notices the many cattle. When one comes up butchered, a mob comes after the immigrants, finding some of the meat in Jon's tent. He gets to the church, seeking asylm. After the mob wants to hang Jon, they put out an ad for a sherriff. The gunslinger, Cole (Cash), ends up getting the job for the salary of $0.50 a day. After some locals vandlize the Cooper/Quinn home, Matthew admits to Dr. Mike that it was his idea to slaughter the cow for the immigrants to eat.

description: Michaela worries when Charlotte's husband, Ethan Cooper, comes back to the family he abandoned, convincing almost everyone of his newfound ways.
tags: ['fraud', 'father son relationship', 'gambling', 'gift', 'adolescent']
synopsis_with_character_names:
As Dr. Quinn is trying to tell the townspeople that smallpox vaccinations are crucial, the father of her adopted children appears in town. He appears swave and debonair, attempting to charm & woo Dr. Quinn, especially after he tells the children that he is taking them to San Francisco.

***SPOILER ALERT ***But after an auction to raise money for the town to build a school, he slips into the church and steals the money. Sully and Mike catch up to him, making him leave the area and return the money to the church.

All the while, she is trying to convince the local women's group to get their children vaccinated for small pox, running into interference from Olive, the headstrong 'leader' of the group. Harriette, one of the mothers in the group, came over to Dr. Mike's house to vaccinate her children in the cover of darkness to hide it from the others in the group, and she appeared sick with a pain in her stomach. When she died of appendicitis a few days later, Dr. Mike feels terrible regret. This helps endear her to the women's group as she admits that she doesn't have all of the answers and she should have caught the symptoms for what they were.

description: A wandering cowboy abandons his baby boy and leaves him in Dr. Mike's care.
tags: ['boy', 'theft', 'male nudity', 'public nudity', 'fall', 'father son relationship', 'campfire']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Dr. Mike takes in Red McCall, a down-and-out cowboy, and his ailing half-breed infant child. McCall reaches the end of his rope trying to care for his baby, so after robbing Loren's store, he leaves the baby in Michaela's care, sensing she could find a suitable home for his child. Dr. Mike's attempts to find a home for the baby prove futile.

When she travels to a remote cabin to check on the health of it's owner, she finds him badly mangled from a bear attack. Her horse is frightened off by the bear, and she's marooned in the cabin until Sully shows up looking for her. They narrowly escape being the rabid bear's next victims.

After returning to town, Dr. Mike decides she'd rather raise the child herself than turn him over to an orphanage. However, Sully locates Red and convinces him to keep the child.

description: A woman dies and they find a hidden boy at her house. Dr. Mike takes the boy in while they try to determine who he is and if he has any family.
tags: ['boy', 'chore', 'jealousy', 'rascal', 'male bonding', 'father son relationship', 'father figure', 'adolescent']
synopsis_with_character_names: While Sully and Micheala are out on a ride, Dr. Mike wants to stop in and see a patient named Ruby Johnson who lives a ways from town. Upon arriving at her cabin, they find her dead and decide to take her to town for a proper burial. While Mike is looking in the closet for Ruby's nicest dress, she finds a boy hiding in the closet. She takes him into town also and does an exam on him while the body is being prepared. During the ceremony, several of the townspeople are whispering amongst themselves. Afterward, Micheala finds out that the boy named Zack, was the child of a whore. He had lived with her at the saloon until she died when he was five. Ruby took him in and cared for him because Ruby was a former prostitute, also. It is also revealed that Zack may be mentally challenged. ("he was blue for quite a while after he was born.") When Brian is caught in class looking at a drawing, everyone assumes it is his. (As it turns out, Zack is a wonderful artist.) Micheala takes him into her home, buys him school clothes and gets him a haircut for school, all the while being teased and cajoled by the townfolks. They call him 'simpleton' amongs other names. Even Olive, the temporary school teacher, doesn't think he is capable of learning. But Micheala convinces her otherwise. The children call Zack 'idiot' and say some cruel things, so Zack runs away. They find him at Ruby's house hiding in the closet. Brian talks to him and convinces him to come back. **SPOILER**SPOILER**SPOILER** It turns out that Zack is Hank's son. Myra talks Mike into letting Zack come work at the saloon so he can "feel useful." When some drunks start harrassing Zack and threatening to mistreat him, Hank comes out, gets Zack out of the way and beats up the the drunks. While getting patched up, Micheala confronts Hank with her suspicions. He reluctantly owns up to it. When the townspeople make the decision to send Zack away, Hank finally admits it publically. Zack draws a picture of his mother for Hank. Hank then realizes that Zack has talent and needs to go somewhere that will nurture that talent. He goes to Micheala for help, knowing that he cannot take proper care of him.

description: A writer in need of a job reluctantly agrees to work for her father's women's magazine.
synopsis_with_character_names:
News reporter Maya Gallo (Laura San Giacomo) is working at her desk when news anchor Christy (Emily Proctor) demands her to edit the copy for self serving motives. Offended and annoyed, Maya jokingly retypes the copy to read -gang violence is down since last year and they tell me they credit the decrease to removal of the frontal lobe of my brain and in a related story I wet myself- subsequently Maya is fired.

We catch up with Maya again three months later where she has come back from a job interview. Her roommate Wally (Chris Hogan) shares some good news about a potential date as Maya shares her news about a promising interview with Newsweek. Sadly, Wally informs her that she received a message that she didn't get the job based on her references. Wally talks Maya into visiting her father Jack Gallo (George Segal), owner and chief editor of Blush fashion magazine. Maya has not seen her father in a year because he married a much younger woman that went to school with both her and Wally.

When Maya arrives in the Blush lobby, a gaggle of very tall, beautiful, and slender models are being assessed by fashion editor / former supermodel (Noxzema Gotcha Girl) Nina Van Horn (Wendy Malick), and sexually harassed by executive assistant to Mr. Gallo, Dennis Finch (David Spade). Maya tells Finch she is there to see Jack Gallo and is quickly put down. She then approaches Nina and is also put down but with a quick come back puts Nina in her place. Finch quickly seizes the opportunity to suck up and directs Maya to Jacks office.

Jack is pleasantly surprised to see his Maya but they are interrupted by Elliot (Enrico Colantoni), who tries to tell her that Jack is always talking about her and that he is so happy to finally meet her; Elliot is quickly discovered to be a liar when he inadvertently calls her Myra instead of Maya. Nina enters the room regarding a model dispute with Elliot and the dispute is settled by Jack.

When Elliot and Nina leave the room Nina has an opportunity to speak with Jack only to find that he already knows her situation and is more than happy to give her money. When Maya tries to offer a way to pay him back, Jack suggests writing an article for the magazine. Thinking she is a serious journalist Maya turns it down but then changes her mind when Jack says it will be a good way for them to spend time together.

No sooner do the words come out of his mouth when a call comes in that his wife Ally is in the hospital delivering their baby. Maya is upset as she had no idea and stays to write a negative article about her - father the jackass- .

Nina and Finch peer over the desks at Maya discussing newly discovered information about her such as - Maya is a Stanford Graduate, was on the deans list, has no current boyfriend, and is on the pill - Nina fears that Maya is trying to take over the magazine as Elliot joins the conversation.

Later, Elliot asks Maya her opinion about photos of different models for her article and soon discovers that she is a feminist who is opposed to messages models send to young girls. Elliot is lured away by model Lorena (Shannon Maureen Brown), who is in search of Pellegrino. The discussion resumes as Elliot proves a point that everyone enjoys looking at beautiful things.

As Maya collects her check, Finch notifies her that she has a new baby sister. After reality sinks in, Maya goes to the hospital to meet her new sister Hannah, and congratulates her father. Although happy, Jack is afraid to make the same mistakes he made with Maya. Maya reassures Jack that all Hannah needs is her fathers love and time. Jack talks Maya into helping him run the magazine so he can have more time for his new family. Maya agrees.
